Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ϥⲕⲏⲥ ϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲛϭⲓⲟⲩⲙⲁ ⲛϫⲓⲥⲃⲱ
Translation: There is implanted in a holy man the earnest desire to learn,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲡⲁⲧⲉⲫⲩⲥⲓⲥ ⲡⲉ · ⲙⲛⲧⲉⲡⲣⲟϩⲁⲓⲣⲉⲥⲓⲥ ⲡⲉ ϩⲓⲟⲩⲥⲟⲡ ⲁⲡⲟⲩⲙⲉⲣⲟⲥ ·
Translation: which is partly natural and partly voluntary, and these qualities are equally clearly distinguished.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉϥⲕⲁⲧⲟⲣⲑⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁⲣⲉⲧⲏ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲉⲧⲥⲁⲃⲉⲛⲉⲧϩⲓⲧⲟⲩⲱϥ ϩⲓⲧⲛⲛⲕⲟⲟⲩⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲩϣⲱⲡⲉ ϫⲓⲛⲛϣⲟⲣⲡ · ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧϣⲡϩⲙⲟⲧ ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ · ⲙⲡⲣϥⲣⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩϥ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲧⲏⲣⲛ · ϫⲓⲛⲛϣⲟⲣⲡ ⲡⲉⲛⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉⲛϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲓⲏⲥⲟⲩⲥ ⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ·
Translation: The holy man setteth up virtue, and he wisheth to instruct his neighbours by the (examples of) others who have lived from the earliest times, and who have given thanks to Him that hath done good unto us all from the beginning, that is to say, to our God and our Lord Jesus the Christ,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧϥϩⲱⲛ ⲙⲡⲁⲓⲧⲉⲓ ⲙⲙⲟⲛ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⁛—
Translation: those whom He hath....................

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲓϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲙⲙⲛⲧⲣϥϣⲡϩⲙⲟⲧ ·
Translation: I mean that not all have given thanks.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲛⲟⲛ ⲛⲉⲧⲉϥⲣⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁϩⲟ ⲉⲣⲁⲧϥ ϩⲁϩ ⲇⲉ
Translation: We are those (unto whom) He doeth good. And there are very many admonitions (or, teachings), and acts of valiant and blessed men which have come down to us in the Holy Scriptures, which are like unto images that have souls in them, and which will make those who wish to follow them resemble [them] in their glorious integrity, and prevent them from becoming feeble in the performance of their mighty deeds.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ⲇⲉ ϩⲱ ⲛⲉⲧⲉⲓⲛⲁⲥϩⲁⲓⲥⲟⲩ
Translation: The men about whom I shall now write to you are men who maintained their virtuous deeds in our own time, and who did not slacken in their integrity and valiant behavior.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲇⲉ ϩⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧⲣⲣⲟ ⲛⲧⲣⲁⲓⲁⲛⲟⲥ ⲡⲣⲣⲟ ⲉⲧⲉⲣⲉⲧⲙⲛⲧⲣϥϣⲙϣⲉ ⲉⲓⲇⲱⲗⲟⲛ ⲥⲱⲧⲏⲣ ⲁϥϭⲙϭⲟⲙ ·
Translation: And there was in the kingdom of the Emperor Trajan, wherein the worship of idols had spread and prevailed,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛϭⲓⲟⲩⲥⲧⲣⲁϯⲗⲁⲧⲏⲥ ⲉⲡⲉϥⲣⲁⲛ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ · ⲉϥϩⲏⲛ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲣⲣⲟ ⲉϥⲧⲁⲓⲏⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲡⲉϩⲟⲩⲟ ϩⲙⲡⲉϥⲅⲉⲛⲟⲥ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲉⲓⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉⲟⲩⲣⲙⲙⲁⲟ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ ⲡⲉ ·
Translation: a certain general whose name was Plaketas (Placidus) He was near of kin to the king, and he belonged to a very great and noble family, according to (the opinion) of this world, and he was exceedingly rich.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉϥⲟⲩⲟⲧⲃ ⲉⲛⲛⲟϭ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲡⲁⲗⲗⲁϯⲟⲛ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲕⲧⲏⲥⲓⲥ ⲡⲛⲟⲩⲃ ⲙⲛⲡϩⲁⲧ ϩⲉⲛϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ⲉⲛⲁϣⲱⲟⲩ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲕⲥⲉⲉⲡⲉ ⲛϩⲩⲡⲟⲥⲧⲁⲥⲓⲥ ·
Translation: And he exceeded all the other nobles of the palace in his possessions, (in) gold, and (in) silver, and he had troops of slaves, and riches of all kinds in very great abundance;

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲉⲟⲩϩⲗⲗⲏⲛ ⲡⲉ ϩⲛⲧⲉϥⲑⲣⲓⲥⲕⲓⲁ · ⲉϥⲕⲟⲥⲙⲉⲓ ⲇⲉ ϩⲛⲛⲉϩⲃⲏⲩⲉ ⲛⲧⲇⲓⲕⲁⲓⲟⲥⲩⲛⲏ ·
Translation: and by race he was a Greek And he was adorned with all the works of righteousness.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲉⲧϩⲏϣ ⲛϥⲃⲟⲏⲑⲉⲓ ⲉⲣⲟⲟⲩ
Translation: Those who were in distress, he relieved.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲉⲩⲛⲧⲁϥ ⲟⲩⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲛⲧⲟⲥ ϩⲱⲱⲥ ⲟⲛ ⲛⲉⲥϣⲙϣⲉ ⲉⲓⲇⲱⲗⲟⲛ ⲡⲉ ·
Translation: And he had a wife who was herself a worshipper of idols,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲛⲉⲥⲕⲟⲥⲙⲉⲓ ⲡⲉ ϩⲛϩⲱⲃ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲉⲛⲁⲛⲱⲟⲩ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲓⲥⲙⲟⲧ ⲛⲟⲩⲱⲧ ·
Translation: but she was adorned with every excellent quality and virtue in exactly the same degree (as her husband);

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩϫⲡⲟ ⲇⲉ ⲛϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲥⲛⲁⲩ ·
Translation: and two sons were born to them,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲁⲓ ⲟⲛ ⲁⲩⲥⲁⲛⲟⲩϣⲟⲩ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲓⲥⲙⲟⲧ ⲛⲟⲩⲱⲧ · ϩⲛⲧⲉⲩⲡⲣⲟϩⲁⲓⲣⲉⲥⲓⲥ ⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩⲥ ·
Translation: and these they brought up to walk in the same good path as their parents.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲉϥⲟⲩⲟⲛϩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ · ϩⲛⲛⲉϥⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩϥ · ⲉⲧⲉϥⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: And the man was exceedingly well known because of the good works which he was in the habit of doing,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉϥⲟ ⲛⲥⲟⲉⲓⲧ ϩⲛⲧⲉϥⲙⲛⲧϫⲱⲱⲣⲉ · ϩⲱⲥⲧⲉ ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲛⲃⲁⲣⲃⲁⲣⲟⲥ ⲣϩⲟⲧⲉ ⲉⲩϣⲁⲛⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲡⲉϥⲣⲁⲛ ⲙⲙⲁⲧⲉ · ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉⲟⲩⲣⲉϥⲙⲓϣⲉ ⲡⲉ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ ·
Translation: and he was so celebrated for his personal strength and valour that the Barbarians were afraid at the mere mention of his name. For he was a fine fighter,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉϥⲉⲩⲇⲟⲕⲓⲙⲉⲓ ϩⲙⲡⲟⲗⲉⲙⲟⲥ ⲛⲓⲙ ·
Translation: and he had gained great renown in battles of all kinds,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲧⲉϥⲥⲡⲟⲩⲇⲏ ⲧⲏⲣⲥ ⲡⲉ ϭⲱⲣϭ ⲉⲛⲉⲑⲩⲣⲓⲟⲛ ⲙⲙⲁⲧⲉ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛϥⲉⲩⲇⲟⲕⲏⲙⲉⲓ ·
Translation: but his whole desire was to hunt and slay wild animals, and for this he was greatly esteemed.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲙⲡⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲡⲁⲅⲁⲑⲟⲥ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲙⲁⲓⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲓⲙ ϩⲙⲙⲁ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲉⲧⲁⲝⲓⲟⲩ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲟⲃϣϥ ⲉⲙⲙⲛⲧⲣⲉϥⲣⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩϥ ⲙⲡⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ·
Translation: But the Good God, who loveth every man who is worthy of Him in every place, did not forget the deeds of this good man,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲉⲧⲁⲕⲟ ⲧⲉϥⲅⲛⲱⲙⲏ ⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩⲥ ·
Translation: neither did He wish to destroy his good disposition,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲉⲧⲥⲏϩ ϫⲉϩⲛϩⲉⲑⲛⲟⲥ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲉⲧⲣϩⲟⲧⲉ ϩⲏⲧϥ ⲙⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲧⲣϩⲱⲃ ⲉⲧⲇⲓⲕⲁⲓⲟⲥⲩⲛⲏ ϥϣⲏⲡ ⲛⲛⲁϩⲣⲁϥ ·
Translation: but even as it is written, 'Every heathen who feareth God, and who worketh righteousness, shall be accepted by Him,'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲟⲩⲛⲧⲁϥ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲛⲛⲉⲥⲡⲗⲁⲭⲛⲟⲛ · ⲙⲙⲛⲧϣⲁⲛϩⲧⲏϥ ⲛϯϭⲟⲧ ⲁϥⲣϩⲛⲁϥ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲧⲁⲛϩⲟϥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲥⲙⲟⲧ ⲛϯⲙⲓⲛⲉ ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲛⲛⲁⲧⲁⲩⲟⲟϥ ⁛—
Translation: His bowels of compassion yearned towards him, and He was merciful towards him to such a degree that God willed to save his life, and He did so in the way and by the means which I will here declare unto you.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲟⲩϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲁϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϭⲱⲣϭ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲧⲉϥⲥⲩⲛⲏⲑⲓⲁ ⲉⲛⲉⲑⲏⲣⲓⲟⲛ ϩⲙⲡⲧⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: And it came to pass that on a certain day the man went out, according to his custom, to hunt wild beasts in the mountain,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲙⲛⲡⲉϥⲥⲧⲣⲁⲧⲉⲩⲙⲁ ⲉⲣⲉⲛⲉϥϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ ·
Translation: he and his soldiers, and all his slaves were with him.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲥⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲁϥ ⲛϭⲓⲟⲩⲁⲅⲉⲗⲏ ⲛⲉⲓⲟⲩⲗ ⲉⲥⲙⲟⲟⲛⲉ
Translation: And there appeared unto him a herd of deer that were feeding,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲁⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ ·
Translation: And when Plaketas had seen him,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲟⲩⲱϣ
Translation: he wished to take him in a snare.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥϫⲓ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ ⲛϩⲉⲛⲙⲁⲧⲟⲓ
Translation: And he took with him certain soldiers, and hid away all the others, and he gave chase to the animal.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲉⲛⲧⲁⲩⲃⲱⲕ
Translation: Now the soldiers who had gone with him became exhausted, and they gave up the chase, and Plaketas rode into the thicket alone in pursuit of the beast.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲧⲉⲡⲣⲟⲛⲓⲁ
Translation: And by the good Providence of God neither he nor the horse on which he was riding became exhausted in that dense thicket.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣϥⲱⲥⲕ ⲇⲉ ⲉϥⲡⲏⲧ ⲛⲥⲱϥ
Translation: And when he had persevered for some time in his pursuit, an was a very long way off from his companions,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲧⲟⲧⲉ ⲡⲍⲱⲟⲛ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲁϥⲁϩⲉⲣⲁⲧϥ ⲉϫⲛⲟⲩⲧⲟⲟⲩ ⲉϥϫⲟⲥⲉ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ ·
Translation: then the beast stood still upon a very high mountain.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲉⲥⲧⲣⲁⲧⲏⲗⲁⲧⲏⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥϩⲱⲛ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲉⲙⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ϩⲁϩⲧⲏϥ ⲁϥⲁϩⲉⲣⲁⲧϥ ⲉϥϭⲱϣⲧ ⲛⲥⲁⲥⲁ ⲛⲓⲙ ·
Translation: And when the general had approached him, he stood still and looked round about on every side,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥⲙⲟⲕⲙⲉⲕ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ϫⲉⲉϥⲛⲁϭⲟⲡϥ ⲛⲁϣ ⲛϩⲉ ·
Translation: and he wondered by what means he could take him in a snare.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲡⲙⲁⲓⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲡⲉⲧⲉ..ⲟⲓⲛⲟⲛ ⲙⲡⲟⲩϫⲁⲓ ⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ϩⲛϩⲁϩ ⲛⲥⲙⲟⲧ ·
Translation: And God, the Lover of mankind, Who effecteth the salvation of man in very many ways,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲧⲣⲉϥϭⲱⲣϭ ⲉⲡⲁⲓ ϩⲛⲧⲉϥϭⲟⲣϭⲥ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲕⲟⲣⲛⲏⲗⲓⲟⲥ ϩⲓⲧⲙⲡⲉⲧⲣⲟⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲙⲡⲁⲩⲗⲟⲥ ⲛⲧⲁⲩⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲛⲁϥ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉϥⲡⲏⲧ ⲛⲥⲱϥ ·
Translation: snared this (general) in His net, even as was snared Cornelius by Peter, and even as was Paul unto whom He appeared when he was persecuting Him.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲛⲁⲩ ϣⲱⲡⲉ · ⲉϥⲁϩⲉⲣⲁⲧϥ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ · ⲉϥϭⲱϣⲧ ⲉⲡⲍⲱⲟⲛ · ⲉϥⲣϣⲡⲏⲣⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲡⲥⲁ ⲛⲧⲉϥⲙⲛⲧⲛⲟϭ · ⲉϥⲁⲡⲟⲣⲉⲓ ⲇⲉ ϫⲉⲉϥⲛⲁϭⲟⲡϥ ⲛⲁϣ ⲛϩⲉ · ⲁⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲧⲥⲁⲃⲟϥ ⲉⲩⲙⲁⲉⲓⲛ ⲛⲧⲉⲓⲙⲓⲛⲉ · ⲉⲧⲣⲉϥϭⲙϭⲟⲙ ⲛⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ·
Translation: And when a considerable time had passed, during which Plaketas had been looking at the stag, and marvelling at its great size and very fine appearance, and thinking out the means whereby he might capture it, the Lord gave him the following sign; and He made him able to see it,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲁϥⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲛⲁϥ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ · ϩⲙⲡⲉⲓⲥⲙⲟⲧ ·
Translation: and it appeared unto him in the following form.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉⲟⲩⲙⲁⲉⲓⲛ ⲛⲥⲧⲁⲩⲣⲟⲥ ϩⲛⲧⲙⲏⲏⲧⲉ ⲛⲛⲉϥⲧⲁⲡ ·
Translation: There was a figure of a cross between the stag's horns,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉϥⲣⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ⲛϩⲟⲩⲟ ⲉⲡⲣⲏ ·
Translation: and it shone more brightly than the sun,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ϩⲛⲧⲙⲏⲏⲧⲉ ⲟⲛ · ⲛⲛⲉϥⲧⲁⲡ · ⲉϥⲉⲓⲛⲉ ⲙⲡⲥⲱⲙⲁ
Translation: and there was, moreover, between his horns a similitude like unto the body wherein God arrayed Himself in the womb of the Virgin;

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁϥⲧⲁⲁϥ ϩⲓⲱⲱϥ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲉⲛⲟⲩϫⲁⲓ ·
Translation: now He clothed Himself in this body for our salvation.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲁϥⲧⲱϩⲙ
Translation: And He cried out to Plaketas from the animal with the voice of a man,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ϫⲉⲱ ⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ · ⲁϩⲣⲟⲕ
Translation: saying, 'O Plaketas, why dost thou hunt Me?

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲧⲃⲏⲏⲧⲕ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲛⲧⲁⲓⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ
Translation: For it is for thine own sake that I have appeared unto thee 'in the form of this animal.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲡⲉ ⲓⲏⲥⲟⲩⲥ ⲡⲉⲧⲕϣⲙϣⲉ ⲛⲁϥ ⲛⲛⲉⲕⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲁⲛ ·
Translation: I am Jesus, He Whom thou servest, without knowing it.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲛⲉⲕⲙⲛⲧⲣⲉϥⲣⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩϥ · ⲉⲧⲕⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲓ ⲙⲡⲁⲙⲧⲟ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: Thy kind and charitable deeds which thou doest have come before Me.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲁⲓ ⲣⲱ ⲁⲓⲟⲩⲟⲛϩⲧ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: Therefore I have Myself appeared unto thee,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁⲓϭⲱⲣϭ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ϩⲓⲧⲙⲡⲉⲓⲍⲱⲟⲛ ⲛⲁⲗⲟⲅⲟⲛ ·
Translation: and I have snared thee by means of this animal that is without reasoning power.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁⲓϭⲟⲡⲕ ϩⲛⲛⲉϣⲛⲏⲩⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲙⲛⲧⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: And I have netted thee with the nets of My Godhead.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲟⲩⲇⲓⲕⲁⲓⲟⲛ ⲁⲛ ⲡⲉ · ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲛⲉⲧⲙⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲓ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲩⲡⲣⲁⲝⲓⲥ · ⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲱⲟⲩ ⲣϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ⲛⲛⲇⲁⲓⲙⲱⲛⲓⲟⲛ ⲛⲁⲕⲁⲑⲁⲣⲧⲟⲛ · ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲓⲇⲱⲗⲟⲛ ⲉⲧⲙⲟⲟⲩⲧ · ⲛⲁⲗ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲁⲛⲁⲓⲥⲑⲏⲧⲟⲥ ·
Translation: It is not just to allow those who love Me by their good deeds to act as slaves to unclean demons, and idols which are dead, and dumb, and without feeling.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲁⲓⲉⲓ ⲉⲡⲉⲥⲏⲧ ⲉϫⲙⲡⲕⲁϩ · ϩⲙⲡⲉⲓⲛⲉ · ⲉⲧⲕⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲣⲟⲓ ⲛϩⲏⲧϥ ⲉⲓⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲉⲧⲟⲩϫⲟ ⲙⲡⲅⲉⲛⲟⲥ ⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ·
Translation: For this reason did I come upon the earth in the form wherein thou now seest Me, for I wish to deliver (or, save) the race of man.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲛⲁⲓ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ ⲁϥⲣϩⲟⲧⲉ ⲁϥϩⲉ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲙⲡⲕⲁϩ ⁛—
Translation: And when Plaketas heard these things he was terrified, and he fell down upon the ground.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲛⲁⲩ ϣⲱⲡⲉ · ⲁϥⲧⲱⲟⲩⲛ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲙⲁⲩⲁⲁϥ · ⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲉⲉⲓⲙⲉ ⲉⲧⲁⲕⲣⲏⲃⲓⲁ ⲛⲧⲉϣⲡⲏⲣⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲥⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: And when a long time had passed, he rose up, wishing to understand with exactness the miracle which had taken place.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲟⲩ ⲁⲣⲁ ⲧⲉ ⲧⲉⲓⲟⲡⲧⲁⲥⲓⲁ ⲛⲧⲁⲓⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲣⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And he said, 'What then is the sight which I have seen?

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲟⲩⲁϣ ⲙⲙⲓⲛⲉ ⲧⲉ ⲧⲉⲓⲥⲙⲏ ⲛⲧⲁⲓⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲣⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And what manner of voice is this which I have heard?

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲟⲩⲟⲛϩⲕ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲱ ⲡⲉⲧϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲓ ϫⲉⲉⲓⲉⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ
Translation: Make Thyself manifest to me, O Thou Who speakest with me, and I will believe in Thee.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ ⲁϥϩⲉ ⲉϫⲙⲡⲉϥϩⲟ ⲁϥⲱϣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉϯⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ ⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϫⲉⲛⲧⲟⲕ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲕⲧⲁⲙⲓⲉⲛⲕⲁ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉⲧⲕⲧⲟ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲥⲟⲣⲙ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲛⲧⲁⲩⲥⲟⲣⲙ ·
Translation: When Plaketas heard these words he fell down upon his face and cried out, saying, 'I believe, Lord, that Thou art He Who hath created everything, and that Thou are He Who turneth back those who go astray,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲧⲟⲕ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲣⲉϥⲧⲁⲛϩⲟ ⲛⲛⲉⲛⲧⲁⲩⲙⲟⲩ ·
Translation: and that Thou art He Who giveth life unto those who are dead.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲟⲩⲱϣⲃ ⲛϭⲓⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϫⲉⲉϣⲁⲕⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ ⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲛⲅϯⲡⲉⲕⲟⲩⲟⲓ ⲉⲛⲁⲣⲭⲏⲉⲣⲉⲩⲥ ⲛⲛⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲓⲁⲛⲟⲥ · ⲛⲅϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲓⲧⲟⲟⲧⲟⲩ ⲛⲥⲁⲧⲉⲭⲁⲣⲓⲥⲧⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲓⲧⲙⲡⲃⲁⲡⲧⲓⲥⲙⲁ ·
Translation: And the Lord answered and said, 'If thou believest, go, make thy way to the high priest of the Christians, and demand from him the freely-given gift of baptism.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲟⲩⲱϣⲃ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲟⲩⲉϩⲥⲁϩⲛⲉ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲣⲁϫⲱ ⲛⲛⲉⲓϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲧⲁⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ⲙⲛⲛⲁϣⲏⲣⲉ · ϫⲉⲕⲁⲥ ⲉⲩⲉⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ ϩⲱⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ·
Translation: And Plaketas answered and said unto Him, 'Lord, command me to relate these words to my wife and children, so that they also may believe in Thee.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲧⲁⲩⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: And the Lord said unto him, 'Repeat them.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ
Translation: And ye shall be purified from every unclean thing When ye have received the seal of baptism thou shalt return hither, and I will appear unto thee, and I will declare unto thee the mystery of salvation.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲉⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲡⲉⲥⲏⲧ ϩⲓⲡⲧⲟⲟⲩ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ
Translation: And Plaketas came down from the mountain,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲉϥⲏⲓ ·
Translation: and went into his house.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲣⲟⲩϩⲉ
Translation: And when the evening had come he began to speak and tell his wife and sons about the things which he had seen in the vision, and how the Lord had appeared unto him.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲥⲱϣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ
Translation: And his wife cried out and said unto him, 'Lord, my brother, thou hast seen God Whom they crucified, Whom the Christians worship.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ
Translation: For He is the only true God, and it is He Who delivereth those who put their hopes in Him.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁⲥⲱϣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ ⲉⲥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ
Translation: And she cried out vehemently, saying, 'Have mercy upon me, O Lord Jesus the Christ, and upon my two sons also.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉϫⲁⲥ ⲙⲡⲉⲥϩⲁⲓ · ϫⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲟⲩϣⲏ
Translation: And she said unto her husband, In the night which hath passed I myself also saw Him, and He said unto me, To-morrow do thou, and thy husband, and your sons come to Me.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲙⲟⲩ ϭⲉ ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϩⲣⲁⲓ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲟⲩϣⲏ · ⲛⲧⲛⲃⲱⲕ ⲛⲧⲛϫⲓⲃⲁⲡⲧⲓⲥⲙⲁ ϩⲓⲧⲛⲛⲁⲣⲭⲏⲉⲣⲉⲩⲥ ⲛⲛⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲓⲁⲛⲟⲥ · ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲧⲁϥϩⲱⲛ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧⲕ ·
Translation: Therefore come this very night, and let us go and receive baptism from the high priest of the Christians, even as thou wast commanded,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ϩⲓⲧⲙⲡⲁⲓ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲉϣⲁⲩⲣⲣⲙⲛⲏⲓ ⲛⲁϥ ⲛϭⲓⲛⲉⲧⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ·
Translation: for by this do those who believe in Him become members of his household.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ϥⲟⲩⲱϣⲃ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ϫⲉⲡⲁⲓ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲧⲁϥϫⲟⲟϥ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲉⲧⲁϥⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲉⲣⲟⲓ ·
Translation: And Plaketas answered, saying, 'This is what He Who appeared unto me commanded.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ϩⲛⲧⲡⲁϣⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲩϣⲏ ⲁⲩϫⲓ ⲙⲡⲉⲩϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲥⲛⲁⲩ ϩⲛⲟⲩϩⲱⲡ · ⲁⲩⲱ ϩⲉⲛⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲩϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ·
Translation: And in the middle of that night they took their two sons secretly, and a few of their slaves,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲃⲱⲕ ⲉⲣⲁⲧϥ ⲙⲡⲁⲣⲭⲓⲉⲣⲉⲩⲥ ⲛⲛⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲓⲁⲛⲟⲥ ⲁⲩϫⲱ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲙⲡϩⲟⲣⲟⲙⲁ ⲧⲏⲣϥ ·
Translation: and they went to the high priest of the Christians, and they told him all the dream,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩϩⲟⲙⲟⲗⲟⲅⲉⲓ ⲉⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ ⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲓⲏⲥⲟⲩⲥ ⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ·
Translation: and they confessed their belief in the Lord Jesus the Christ,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲥⲡⲥⲱⲡϥ ⲉϯ ⲛⲁⲩ ⲛⲧⲉⲥⲫⲣⲁⲅⲓⲥ ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ϩⲓⲧⲛⲡⲃⲁⲡⲧⲓⲥⲙⲁ ·
Translation: and they entreated him to give them the seal of the Christ by baptism.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲇⲉ ⲉϥⲣⲁϣⲉ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁϥϯⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲉϣⲧⲣⲉⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲱⲛϩ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲥⲉⲉⲓ ⲉⲡⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲧⲙⲉ ·
Translation: And the high priest rejoiced, and ascribed glory to God Who wisheth all men to have life, and to come to the knowledge of the truth.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲁⲣⲭⲓⲉⲣⲉⲩⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲁϥϫⲓⲧⲟⲩ ⲁϥⲕⲁⲑⲏⲅⲉⲓ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲁϥϯ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧⲟⲩ ⲛⲙⲙⲩⲥⲧⲏⲣⲓⲟⲛ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ · ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲡⲓⲥⲧⲓⲥ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁϥⲃⲁⲡϯⲍⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲡⲣⲁⲛ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲙⲛⲡϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ·
Translation: And the high priest took them, and catechized them, and gave into their hands the Holy Mysteries of the Faith, and he baptized them in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲁϥⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ϫⲉⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲧⲉϥⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ϫⲉⲑⲉⲟⲡⲓⲥⲧⲏ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉϥϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲁϥⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲡⲛⲟϭ ϫⲉⲁⲅⲁⲡⲓⲟⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲕⲟⲩⲓ ϫⲉⲑⲉⲟⲡⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And to Plaketas he gave the name of Eusthathius, and to his wife Theopiste; his elder son he called Agapius, and the younger Theopistus;

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥϯ ⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲙⲡⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲉⲧⲧⲁⲓⲏⲩ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲥⲛⲟϥ ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲁϥⲕⲁⲁⲩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: and he gave them the Glorious Body and Blood of the Christ, and dismissed them,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ⲛⲁⲩ · ϫⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲉϥⲉϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲏⲏⲧⲛ ·
Translation: saying, 'May God, the Christ, be with you,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛϥⲭⲁⲣⲓⲍⲉ ⲛⲏⲧⲛ ⲛⲧⲉϥⲙⲛⲧⲣⲣⲟ ϣⲁⲉⲛⲉϩ ·
Translation: and may He graciously grant unto you His kingdom for ever.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲓⲙⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲧϭⲓϫ ⲙⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲛⲙⲙⲏⲏⲧⲛ ·
Translation: And know that the hand of the Lord is with you,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲱⲧⲛ
Translation: and I earnestly beseech you that when ye shall be in Paradise ye remember the soul of John, the least of all men and the most miserable.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ϩⲧⲟⲟⲩⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥϣⲱⲡⲉ · ⲁϥϫⲓ ⲛϭⲓⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲛϩⲉⲛϩⲧⲱⲱⲣ ·
Translation: And when the morning had come Eusthathius took horses,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲉⲡⲧⲟⲟⲩ ⲁϥϩⲱⲛ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲙⲁ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲧⲟⲡⲧⲁⲥⲓⲁ ⲛϩⲏⲧϥ ·
Translation: and he departed to the mountain, and went toward the spot wherein he had seen the vision.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥϫⲟⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲧⲟⲓ ⲛⲧⲗⲟⲓϭⲉ ⲛϭⲱⲣϭ ⲉⲛⲍⲱⲟⲛ ·
Translation: And he dismissed his soldiers, and sent them away to hunt the wild animals,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲇⲉ ⲁϥϭⲱ ⲛⲟⲩⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲙⲁⲩⲁⲁϥ ·
Translation: and he remained where he was alone for a short time;

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲙⲛⲛⲥⲱⲥ ⲁϥϯⲡⲉϥⲟⲩⲟⲓ ·
Translation: then he moved on,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥϩⲛⲧϥ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲙⲁ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲡⲧⲩⲡⲟⲥ ⲛϣⲟⲣⲡ ⲛϩⲏⲧϥ ·
Translation: and went nearer and nearer to the place where he had seen the figure at first.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲡⲁϩⲧϥ ⲉϫⲙⲡⲉϥϩⲟ ⲁϥⲱϣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲁⲓⲉⲓⲙⲉ ϫⲉⲛⲧⲟⲕ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲡϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲧⲟⲛϩ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁⲓⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲕⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲛⲁⲅⲁⲑⲟⲥ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ·
Translation: And he cast himself down upon his face, and he cried out, saying, 'Lord, I know that Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God, and I believe in Thee and in Thy Good Father, and in the Holy Spirit.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϭⲉ ϯⲥⲟⲡⲥⲡ ⲙⲙⲟⲕ ·
Translation: And now I beseech Thee,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲁⲕⲁⲁⲧ ⲛⲙⲡϣⲁ ⲛⲧⲉⲭⲁⲣⲓⲥ · ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲉⲕⲙⲛⲧⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲧⲥⲁⲃⲟⲓ ⲉⲛⲉⲛⲧⲁⲕϫⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲁⲓ ·
Translation: if I be worthy of the holy grace of Thy Godhead, declare unto me the things which Thou hast to say unto me.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲁⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲟⲩⲱϣⲃ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲛⲁⲓⲁⲧⲕ ⲱ ⲡⲗⲁⲕⲏⲧⲁⲥ ⲛⲧⲟⲕ ϫⲉⲁⲕϣⲱⲡ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲙⲡϫⲱⲕⲙ ⲛⲧⲉⲭⲁⲣⲓⲥ ·
Translation: And straightway the Lord answered and said unto him, 'Blessed art thou, O Plaketas, because thou hast received the washing of grace,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲕϯ ϩⲓⲱⲱⲕ ⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧⲁⲧⲧⲁⲕⲟ ⲉⲧⲙⲏⲛ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϣⲁⲉⲛⲉϩ ·
Translation: and hast arrayed thyself in the indestructible garment which abideth for ever.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϭⲉ ⲁϥⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛϭⲓⲡϩⲱⲃ ⲛⲧⲉⲕⲡⲓⲥⲧⲓⲥ ·
Translation: Now, therefore, do thou make manifest the work of thy faith.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲡⲉⲓⲇⲏ ⲡⲇⲓⲁⲃⲟⲗⲟⲥ ⲛⲁⲫⲑⲟⲛⲉⲓ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ϫⲉⲁⲕⲕⲁⲁϥ ⲛⲥⲱⲕ ·
Translation: Since the Devil is envious of thee thou must cast him behind thee;

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ϥⲛⲁⲥⲡⲟⲩⲇⲁⲍⲉ ⲉⲣⲕⲟⲧⲥ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲛϥϯⲟⲩⲃⲏⲕ ·
Translation: and he will be zealous in setting snares of every kind for thee, and he will contend against thee.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ϩⲁⲡⲥ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲕϥⲓ ϩⲁϩⲁϩ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲣⲁⲥⲙⲟⲥ ·
Translation: For thou must of necessity endure manifold temptations.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲕϣⲁⲛϩⲩⲡⲟⲙⲉⲓⲛⲉ
Translation: If thou endurest them in patience thou shalt receive the crown of victory.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲓⲥϩⲏⲏⲧⲉ ⲁⲕϫⲓⲥⲉ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ ϩⲛⲛⲉϩⲃⲏⲩⲉ
Translation: Behold, thou shalt rise very much higher in the works (or, affairs) of (this) life, and in the riches which are temporal.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲁⲗⲓⲛ ⲟⲛ ⲛⲅⲣⲣⲙⲙⲁⲟ ϩⲙⲡϫⲓⲥⲉ ⲙⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁⲧⲓⲕⲟⲛ ·
Translation: And, moreover, thou shalt become rich in spiritual excellence.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲣϭⲱⲃ ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲡⲣϭⲱⲧⲡ ⲛⲛⲁϩⲣⲛⲡⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ · ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛϣⲟⲣⲡ ·
Translation: Now be not weak, neither be thou overcome by the glory of this world, which thou didst possess originally;

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲕⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛϫⲱⲱⲣⲉ ϩⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ · ⲉⲕⲡⲟⲗⲉⲙⲉⲓ · ⲉⲕⲥⲡⲟⲩⲇⲁⲍⲉ ⲉⲁⲣⲓⲥⲕⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲣⲣⲟ ⲉϣⲁϥⲙⲟⲩ · ⲥⲡⲟⲩⲇⲁⲍⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲕⲁⲧⲁϯϩⲉ ⲛⲅϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛϫⲱⲱⲣⲉ · ⲟⲩⲃⲉⲡⲇⲓⲁⲃⲟⲗⲟⲥ
Translation: but as thou didst shew thyself to be a mighty man among men, and as thou didst wage war, and didst strive zealously to serve a king who is mortal, even so do thou strive zealously to prove thyself to be a mighty man against the Devil, and do thou keep fast hold on the faith for Me,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϫⲉⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲁϥ ·
Translation: And when the Lord had said these things unto him

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ
Translation: He departed into heaven,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ⲛⲁϥ · ϫⲉⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ
Translation: and the Lord spake unto him, saying, 'Eusthathius, there shall be unto thee as great a temptation as thou canst wish in that which thou shalt have in the last days.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ
Translation: And Eusthathius said unto Him, 'If this be the last of my days, I now beseech Thee, O my Lord, supposing that I am not able to bear the things which Thou hast appointed me, to remoe them, and not to let them come upon me, and command that our temptation return unto Thee.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲙⲁϯϭⲟⲙ ⲛⲁⲛ ·
Translation: But give us strength, O Lord, Thou God of mighty deeds, for Thou are He in Whom we trust.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲁⲅⲱⲛⲓⲍⲉ ⲱ ⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲧⲁⲭⲁⲣⲓⲥ ⲉⲥⲉϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲥⲣⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲛⲉⲧⲛϩⲏⲧ
Translation: And the Lord said unto him, 'Fight, O Eusthathius, and My grace shall watch over what is in (thy) heart.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲉⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲡⲉⲥⲏⲧ ϩⲓⲡⲧⲟⲟⲩ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ
Translation: And Saint Eusthathius came down from the mountain,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲉⲡⲉϥⲏⲓ ⲁϥϫⲱ ⲉⲧⲉϥⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲛⲧⲁⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϫⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲁϥ ·
Translation: and he went into his house, and told his wife the things which God had said unto him.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩϭⲱⲗϫ ⲛⲛⲉⲩⲡⲁⲧ ϩⲓⲟⲩⲥⲟⲡ ·
Translation: And they knelt down together on their knees,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩϣⲗⲏⲗ ⲉⲩϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲙⲁⲣⲉⲡⲉⲕⲟⲩⲱϣ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⁛—
Translation: and they prayed, saying, 'Let Thy will be done.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲛⲛⲥⲁϩⲉⲛⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲛϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲁⲩϣⲱⲛⲉ ⲛⲗⲟⲓⲙⲟⲥ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ϩⲙⲡⲉϥⲏⲓ · ⲁⲩⲙⲟⲩ ⲛϭⲓⲛⲉϥϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ·
Translation: And it came to pass, after a few days, that a pestilence broke out in the house of Eusthathius, and all his slaves died.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡⲁⲓ ⲇⲉ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲁϥⲁⲓⲥⲑⲁⲛⲉ ⲉⲡⲓⲡⲉⲓⲣⲁⲥⲙⲟⲥ · ⲛϭⲓⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲩϣⲣⲡⲥⲏⲙⲁⲛⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉϥⲛⲁϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲁϥϣⲟⲡϥ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲉϥⲣⲁϣⲉ ⲉϥⲡⲁⲣⲁⲕⲁⲗⲉⲓ · ⲛⲧⲉϥⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ · ⲉⲧⲙⲧⲣⲉⲥⲣϩⲏⲧ ϣⲏⲙ ·
Translation: And when this had happened, Eusthathius perceived that there had actually come upon him the temptation (or, trial) which, according to the indications that had already been given to him, was to come upon him, and he welcomed it as such, and he rejoiced, and exhorted his wife not to lose courage.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲙⲛⲛⲥⲁⲟⲩⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ · ⲁⲩⲙⲟⲩ ⲛϭⲓⲛϥϩⲧⲟⲟⲣ ⲙⲛⲛⲉϥⲧⲃⲛⲟⲟⲩⲉ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ·
Translation: And after a little while all his horses, and cattle, and sheep died,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲧⲉⲓϩⲉ ⲁϥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲉⲡⲉⲓⲣⲁⲥⲙⲟⲥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲣⲁϣⲉ
Translation: and this temptation he also received with joy.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲙⲡⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲛⲉⲣⲉⲡⲇⲩⲙⲟⲥ ⲧⲏⲣϥ ⲣϣⲁ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉⲩⲣⲁϣⲉ ⲡⲉ ϩⲙⲡⲧⲣⲉⲩϫⲣⲟ ⲉⲙⲡⲣⲥⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And it came to pass in those days that all the people were celebrating a festival, and they were rejoicing greatly because they had conquered the Persians,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲣⲣⲟ ⲣϣⲁ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲩ · ϩⲛⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲥⲩⲛⲕⲣⲟⲧⲏⲥⲓⲥ ·
Translation: and the Emperor was celebrating the festival with them with great heartiness,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲛⲉⲡⲉⲧⲉϣϣⲉ ϩⲱⲱϥ ⲡⲉ ⲉⲧⲣⲉϥⲣϣⲁ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲛϭⲓⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ ·
Translation: but Eustathius felt that it was not seemly for him to join them in celebrating the festival.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲡⲉⲓⲇⲏ ⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲥⲧⲣⲁⲧⲏⲗⲁⲧⲏⲥ ϩⲛⲧⲥⲩⲅⲕⲗⲏⲧⲟⲥ ⲛϩⲣⲱⲙⲏ ⲁϥϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲥⲱϥ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲣⲣⲟ ⲙⲡⲉϥϩⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ·
Translation: As, however, he was a great general among the nobles of Rome, the Emperor enquired for him, but did not find him.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲉⲓⲙⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲣⲣⲟ ϫⲉϩⲛⲟⲩⲟⲩⲛⲟⲩ ⲛⲟⲩⲱⲧ ⲙⲡⲉⲗⲁⲁⲩ ϣⲱϫⲡ ⲛⲁϥ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲧϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲛⲁϥ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ·
Translation: And when the Emperor learned that in one hour nothing had been left to him of all his possessions,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲡⲟⲩϩⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲧⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ ·
Translation: and that neither he nor those who were with him had anything left,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲗⲩⲡⲉⲓ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲣⲣⲟ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲧⲥⲩⲛⲅⲗⲏⲧⲟⲥ ⲧⲏⲣⲥ ⲉⲧⲃⲏⲏⲧϥ ·
Translation: he and all the nobles with him were exceedingly sorry on his account,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲣϣⲡⲏⲣⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁϥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ·
Translation: and they marvelled at what had happened to him.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲧⲟⲧⲉ ⲧⲉϥⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ⲡⲉϫⲁⲥ ⲛⲁϥ · ϫⲉϣⲁⲛⲧⲉⲟⲩ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲉⲛϩⲙⲟⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲙⲁ ·
Translation: Then his wife said unto him, 'How long shall we sit here in this place?

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲧⲱⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲧⲛϫⲓ ⲛⲛⲉⲛϣⲏⲣⲉ · ⲛⲧⲁⲩϣⲱϫⲡ ⲛⲁⲛ · ⲛⲧⲛⲃⲱⲕ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲛⲧⲛⲕⲱ ⲛⲥⲱⲛ ⲛⲧⲉⲭⲱⲣⲁ · ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉⲁⲛϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲛⲟϭⲛϭ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲙⲙⲟⲛ ⁛—
Translation: Rise up, and let us take oiur sons who are left unto us, and let us depart and leave this country, because we have become the laughing-stock of those who know us.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ϩⲛⲧⲉⲟⲩϣⲏ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ · ⲁⲩϫⲓ ⲛⲛⲉⲩϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲁⲩⲉⲓ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲩⲃⲱⲕ ⲉⲕⲏⲙⲉ ·
Translation: And that night they took their sons and departed, and they set out for Egypt.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲟⲩⲣⲟⲩϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲏ ⲥⲛⲁⲩ · ⲁⲩⲉⲓ ⲉϫⲛⲧϩⲁⲗⲗⲁⲥⲁ ·
Translation: And when they had been travelling for a day or two, they arrived at the sea,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩϩⲉ ⲉⲩϫⲟⲉⲓ ⲉϥⲙⲟⲟⲛⲉ ⲉⲧⲙⲣⲱ ⲁⲩϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲛⲥⲁⲁⲗⲉ ⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓ ·
Translation: and they found a ship anchored at the quay, and they made enquiries aboiut embarking in the ship.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲛⲁⲩⲕⲗⲏⲣⲟⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲡϫⲟⲉⲓ ⲛⲉ ⲟⲩⲃⲁⲣⲃⲁⲣⲟⲥ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲁⲅⲣⲓⲟⲥ ⁛—
Translation: And the captain of the ship was a savage and brutal man.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲟⲩⲁⲗⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓ ⲁⲩⲣϩⲱⲧ ·
Translation: And when they had embarked in the ship they put to sea,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲛⲁⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲛⲁⲩⲕⲗⲏⲣⲟⲥ
Translation: and the captain of the ship looked upon the wife of Eustathius, and he saw that her face was beautiful, and he loved her.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲡⲱϩ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲡⲉⲕⲣⲟ ⲛⲧϩⲁⲗⲁⲥⲁ · ⲁϥϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲛⲥⲁⲧⲉϥϩⲏⲙⲉ ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ ⲉⲙⲛⲧⲁϥ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲉϯ ·
Translation: And when the captain arrived at the shore of the sea he asked Eustathius for his passage money, but he had it not to give to him;

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲁⲙⲁϩⲧⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲉϥⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ · ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲧⲁⲓϯⲁ ⲛⲧϩⲏⲙⲉ ·
Translation: and he seized the wife of Eustathius in place of the passage money,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲁⲓ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁϥϣⲟϫⲛⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲉⲧⲙϯ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲉⲥϩⲁⲓ ·
Translation: for he had already determined that he would not let her go with her husband.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁϥⲱⲥⲕ ⲉϥϩⲟⲙⲟⲓⲗⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ · ⲛϭⲓⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥⲥⲟⲡⲥⲡ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲁϥϫⲱⲣⲙ ⲟⲩⲃⲉⲛⲛⲉⲉϥ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲛⲁⲩⲕⲗⲏⲣⲟⲥ · ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲩⲁⲙⲁϩⲧⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲛⲥⲉⲛⲟϫϥ ⲉⲑⲁⲗⲁⲥⲥⲁ ·
Translation: And when Eustathius persevered in arguing the matter with him, and in making supplication to him, the captain made a sign to the sailors to lay hold upon him, and to throw him into the sea.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲓⲙⲉ ⲉⲧⲉⲩⲉⲡⲓⲃⲟⲩⲗⲏ ⲁϥⲕⲱ ⲛⲥⲱϥ ⲛⲧⲉϥⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ⲉϩⲛⲁϥ ⲁⲛ ⲁϥϫⲓ ⲙⲡⲉϥϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲥⲛⲁⲩ ⲁϥⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲉϥⲣⲓⲙⲉ ·
Translation: And when Eustathius knew of their evil intentions he very unwillingly left his wife behind, and taking his two sons departed with them weeping,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥⲧⲟⲉⲓⲧ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲁϣⲏⲣⲉ · ϫⲉⲁⲩϥⲓ ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲛⲙⲁⲁⲩ ϩⲓⲧⲛⲟⲩⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲃⲁⲣⲃⲁⲣⲟⲥ ·
Translation: and he made lamentation, saying, 'Woe is me, O my sons, for your mother hath been seized by a barbarian.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉϥⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲁϥⲁϣⲁϩⲟⲙ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥⲣⲓⲙⲉ ⲁϥⲉⲓ ⲉϫⲛⲟⲩⲓⲉⲣⲟ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ · ⲁⲩⲱ ϩⲓⲧⲛⲧⲁϣⲏ ⲛⲙⲙⲟⲩ ⲛⲉⲓⲟⲟⲩⲉ ·
Translation: And he went away heaving sighs and shedding tears, and he came to a river of water, and owing to the heavy rain which had fallen into it

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲙⲡⲉϥⲉϣϭⲙϭⲟⲙ ⲉϫⲓⲟⲟⲣ ⲙⲡⲉϥϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲥⲛⲁⲩ ϩⲓⲟⲩⲥⲟⲡ ·
Translation: he was unable to swim across it with both of his sons at the same time.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲧⲁⲗⲉⲡⲟⲩⲁ ⲉϫⲛⲧⲉϥⲛⲁϩⲃ ·
Translation: And he took the one son on his neck,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲕⲁⲡⲕⲉⲟⲩⲁ ϩⲓⲡⲉⲓⲥⲁ ⲙⲡⲙⲟⲩ ·
Translation: and leaving the other on this side of the river

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥϫⲓⲟⲟⲣ · ⲙⲡⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲁϥⲕⲱ ϩⲓⲡⲉⲕⲣⲟ ⲙⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁϥⲧⲁⲗⲟϥ ⲉϫⲱϥ ·
Translation: he swam across the water, and left on the other side the son whom he had been carrying,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲕⲧⲟϥ ⲉϫⲙⲡⲕⲉⲟⲩⲁ ·
Translation: and then turned back (to fetch) the other.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲉϥϩⲛⲧⲙⲏⲏⲧⲉ
Translation: And it came to pass that whilst he was in the middle of the river

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲛⲁⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲡϣⲏⲣⲉ ϣⲏⲙ · ⲛϭⲓϩⲉⲛϣⲟⲟⲥ ϩⲓϩⲣⲁϥ ⲙⲡⲙⲟⲩⲓ · ⲉϥϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲁϫⲛⲧⲁⲕⲟ
Translation: And when certain shepherds saw the (one) child in the jaws of the lion and that he was uninjured,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩϫⲟⲟⲥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲥⲟⲟⲩⲧⲛ · ϫⲉⲡⲣⲟⲛⲓⲁ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲧⲉⲧϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ⲉⲡⲉⲓϣⲏⲣⲉ ϣⲏⲙ ·
Translation: they said with right understanding, The Providence of God is disposed to protect this boy,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲧⲃⲟⲏⲑⲉⲓ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲥⲛⲟϩⲙ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ ⲙⲡⲉⲑⲏⲣⲓⲟⲛ ·
Translation: and to help him, and it will deliver him from the wild beast.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲡⲱⲧ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲥⲁⲡⲙⲟⲩⲓ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲩⲟⲩϩⲟⲣ ·
Translation: And they gave chase to the lion with their horses,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲙⲟⲩⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲁϥⲣϩⲟⲧⲉ ·
Translation: and the lion was afraid.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲟⲩⲟⲓⲕⲟⲛⲟⲙⲓⲁ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲁⲡⲙⲟⲩⲓ ⲛⲟⲩϫⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡϣⲏⲣⲉ ϣⲏⲙ ·
Translation: And by the dispensation of God the lion dropped the child from his mouth,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲡⲱⲧ ⲁⲛϣⲟⲟⲥ · ϥⲓ ⲙⲡϣⲏⲣⲉ ϣⲏⲙ ⲁⲩⲥⲁⲛⲟⲩϣϥ ⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲩϣⲏⲣⲉ ϩⲓⲡⲉⲓⲉⲃⲧ ⲙⲡⲓⲉⲣⲟ ·
Translation: and fled, and the shepherds picked up the child, and they reared it as a son to them on the east of the river.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲕⲉⲟⲩⲁ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲡⲱⲛϣ ϩⲁⲣⲡⲁⲍⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ·
Translation: And as for the other son which the wolf had carried off

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲧⲉⲡⲣⲟⲛⲓⲁ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲥⲕⲉⲡⲁⲍⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲁϫⲛⲧⲁⲕⲟ ⁛—
Translation: the good Providence of God preserved him also unharmed.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲟⲩⲛⲁⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲛϭⲓϩⲉⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲣⲉϥⲥⲕⲁⲓ ⲁⲩⲡⲱⲧ ⲁⲩϥⲓⲧϥ ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ ⲙⲡⲱⲛϣ ⲙⲡϥϫⲓⲧϥ ⲛϭⲟⲛⲥ ⲗⲁⲁⲩ ·
Translation: For when certain men who were ploughing the land saw him (being carried off) they gave chase to the wolf, and took him from the beast; and the child had received no injury whatsoever.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲣⲉϥⲥⲕⲁⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲛⲛϣⲟⲟⲥ · ⲛⲉⲩϣⲟⲟⲡ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲕⲱⲙⲏ ⲛⲟⲩⲱⲧ ·
Translation: And the ploughmen and the shepherds were living together in the same village,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩϫⲓ ⲛⲛϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲁⲩⲥⲁⲛⲟⲩϣⲟⲩ ϩⲁϩⲧⲏⲩ ·
Translation: and they took the two little children, and reared them as their own.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲛϥⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲁⲛ ⲛⲗⲁⲁⲩ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁϥϣⲱⲡⲉ ·
Translation: Now Eustathius had no knowledge whatsoever of what had happened;

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲛⲉϥⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲡⲉ ⲉϥⲣⲓⲙⲉ · ⲉϥⲧⲁⲩⲟ ⲛϩⲉⲛϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛϯⲙⲓⲛⲉ ϫⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓ ⲛⲁⲓ ·
Translation: but he walked on his way, and he wept, and kept repeating these words, 'Woe is me!

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ⲡⲉⲧⲣⲟⲟⲩⲧ ⲙⲡⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩϣⲏⲛ ·
Translation: I was at one time flourishing like a tree,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲁⲓϣⲟⲟⲩⲉ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁⲓⲥⲣⲟϥⲣϥ ·
Translation: but now I am dried up and withered.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲟⲩⲟⲓ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲟⲗⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϯϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲁⲓⲭⲙⲁⲗⲱⲧⲟⲥ · ⲟⲩⲟⲓ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ⲡⲉⲧⲉⲣⲉϩⲉⲛⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ ⲙⲙⲁⲧⲟⲓ ϣⲟⲟⲡ ϩⲁⲣⲁⲧ · ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲁⲕⲕⲁⲁⲧ ⲙⲁⲩⲁⲁⲧ ·
Translation: Woe is me! I, who at one time had legions of soldiers at my feet, am now left utterly to myself,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲡⲟⲩⲥⲩⲛⲭⲱⲣⲉⲓ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲙⲙⲁⲧⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ · ⲙⲛⲛⲁϣⲏⲣⲉ ·
Translation: and neither my wife nor my children are permitted to be with me.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲙⲡⲣⲕⲁⲁⲧ ⲛⲥⲱⲕ ⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϣⲁⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: But do not, O Lord, cast me away,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲟⲩⲇⲉ
Translation: and be not Thou forgetful of my tears.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲁⲕϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲛⲁⲓ
Translation: O Lord, Thou didst say unto me, 'Needs must that thou shalt be tempted as was Job.'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲓⲥϩⲏⲏⲧⲉ ϯⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲡϩⲓⲥⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲩⲣϩⲟⲩⲟ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ ·
Translation: And behold, do Thou look upon my sufferings which have become exceedingly severe.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲁⲩϩⲟⲩⲣⲱⲡⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲛⲛⲉϥⲛⲕⲁ ⲁⲩⲥⲩⲛⲭⲱⲣⲉⲓ ⲛⲁϥ · ⲛⲧⲕⲟⲡⲣⲓⲁ ⲉⲧⲣⲉϥϩⲙⲟⲟⲥ ϩⲓⲱⲱⲥ ·
Translation: For even if the possessions which he had were all carried away, there still remained to him the dung-hill whereon he could seat himself,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲓⲛⲁϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛϣⲙⲙⲟ · ⲛⲧⲁⲗⲁⲓⲡⲱⲣⲟⲥ · ⲉⲓϥⲓ ϩⲁⲡⲉⲓⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲗⲉⲡⲱⲣⲓⲁ
Translation: whereas I am a miserable sojourner in a strange land, and am burdened with all this mass of misery.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲁⲩϣⲱⲱⲧ ⲛⲛⲉⲕⲗⲁⲇⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲉⲓϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲛⲉϥϣⲏⲣⲉ · ϥⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲧⲛⲟⲩⲛⲉ ⲉⲥϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ ⲉⲧⲉⲧⲉϥⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ⲧⲉ · ⲉⲥⲟ ⲛⲁϥ ⲙⲡⲁⲣⲟⲓⲕⲟⲣⲓⲁ · ⲕⲁⲛ ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲁⲥⲥⲗⲁⲁⲧⲉ ϩⲱⲥ ⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ϩⲛⲟⲩϣⲁϫⲉ ·
Translation: And even if his branches, I mean his children, were lopped off, he still had left to him the root, that is to say, his wife, who would live in the house with him, even though she did not serve him as a wife in the (true sense of) the word.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ϩⲱ ⲡⲉⲓⲉⲃⲓⲏⲛ ⲁⲩⲡⲉⲣⲕⲧⲁⲛⲟⲩⲛⲉ ⲥⲁⲥⲁ ⲛⲓⲙ ·
Translation: But as for me, miserable man that I am, my root is cut off on all sides,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛϯⲛⲁⲩ ⲁⲛ ⲉⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲛⲁⲕⲧⲓⲛ · ⲛⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲗⲁⲙⲡⲁⲥ ⲙⲡⲁⲅⲉⲛⲟⲥ ·
Translation: and I cannot see a single ray of light from the lamp of my race.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲉⲓⲟ ⲙⲡⲉⲥⲙⲟⲧ ⲛⲟⲩϣⲏⲛ ⲉϥϩⲙⲡϫⲁⲓⲉ · ⲉⲩⲕⲓⲙ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲛⲛⲁⲩ ⲛⲓⲙ · ϩⲓⲧⲛⲧϩⲁⲧⲏⲩ ⲙⲡⲇⲓⲁⲃⲟⲗⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Moreover, I am like a tree in the desert, which is being ever shaken by the winds of the Devil.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲙⲡⲱⲣⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲙⲡⲣⲙⲉⲕϩⲡⲉⲕϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ⲉⲧⲟ ⲛϩⲁϩ ⲛϣⲁϫⲉ ·
Translation: Do not, Lord, do not afflict Thy servant, (and drive him) to utter many words,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲉⲓⲧⲁⲩⲟ ⲛⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲡⲣⲉⲡⲉⲓ ⲁⲛ ⲉⲓⲙⲟⲕϩ ⲛϩⲏⲧ ·
Translation: for if I spake the things which I ought not to speak, I should be grieved in heart.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲕⲱ ϭⲉ ⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲛⲟⲩϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ϩⲓⲣⲛⲣⲱⲓ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲟⲩⲣⲟ ⲉϥⲧⲁϫⲣⲏⲩ · ϩⲓⲣⲛⲛⲁⲥⲡⲟⲧⲟⲩ · ϫⲉⲕⲁⲥ ⲛⲛⲉⲡⲁϩⲏⲧ ⲣⲁⲕⲧϥ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉϩⲉⲛϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲩϩⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: Do Thou, therefore, O Lord, set a guard upon my mouth, and a strong seal upon my lips, so that my heart might not incline towards the words which are evil,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲅⲛⲟϫⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲛⲁϩⲣⲙⲡⲉⲕϩⲟ ϯⲙⲧⲟⲛ ϭⲉ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ·
Translation: and Thou mayest not cast me away from before Thy face. And give Thou me rest, O Lord!'

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲁⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲉϥⲁϣⲁϩⲟⲙ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥⲣⲓⲙⲉ ⲁϥⲉⲓ ⲉϫⲛⲟⲩⲕⲱⲙⲏ · ⲉⲩⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲃⲁⲥⲥⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And as he was saying these things, and was heaving sighs and weeping, he came to a village, which was called Bassos,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲁϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲣⲟⲥ ⲁϥⲣϩⲱⲃ ⲛϩⲏⲧⲥ · ⲉϥϫⲡⲟ ⲛⲧⲉϥⲧⲣⲟⲫⲏ ⲙⲙⲏⲛⲉ ·
Translation: and he went into it, and worked there, and procured his daily bread therein.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϩ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲛⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲁⲩⲥⲡⲥⲱⲡϥ ⲛϭⲓⲛⲁⲧⲕⲱⲙⲏ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲉⲧⲣⲉϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲛϥⲣⲟⲉⲓⲥ · ⲉⲛⲕⲁⲣⲡⲟⲥ ⲛⲧⲥⲱϣⲉ ⲉⲁϥⲣⲙⲏⲧⲉ ⲛⲣⲟⲙⲡⲉ · ⲉϥⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲛⲛⲁⲓ ⲉϥϫⲓ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲃⲉⲉⲕⲉ ·
Translation: And when he had lived there a long time the owners of the village entreated him to go and become watchman of the fruit crops in the orchard there, and he fullfilled this work for a period of ten years, and received his wages for the same.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲛⲉϥϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲁⲩⲥⲁⲛⲟⲩϣⲟⲩ ϩⲛⲧⲕⲱⲙⲏ ⲛⲧⲁⲛϣⲣⲡ ϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲥ · ⲛⲥⲉⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲁⲛ ϫⲉⲛⲉⲥⲛⲏⲩ ⲛⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲩⲉⲣⲏⲩ ·
Translation: And his sons were being fed and brought up in the village which we have already mentioned, and they did not know that they were brethren.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲛⲁⲩⲕⲗⲏⲣⲟⲥ ⲇⲉ ϩⲱⲱϥ ⲛⲧⲁϥϥⲓ ⲛⲧⲉⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ⲛⲉⲩⲥⲧⲁⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲁϥϫⲓⲧⲥ ⲉⲧϥⲡⲁⲧⲣⲓⲥ ·
Translation: And the captain of the ship who had carried off the wife of Eustathius took her to his own country,

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲇⲉ ⲛϩⲁⲓⲃⲉⲥ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲁⲥⲣϩⲁⲓⲃⲥ ⲉⲣⲟⲥ · ϩⲱⲥⲧⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲃⲁⲣⲃⲁⲣⲟⲥ ⲉϣϫⲱϩ ⲉⲣⲟⲥ ⲛⲛⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ·
Translation: and the great shadow of God overshadowed her so completely that the barbarian was never able to touch her all that time.

Book Name: History of Eustathius and Theopiste part 1
Verse: ⲡⲁⲓ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁⲧⲉⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ · ⲁⲓⲧⲉⲓ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲉⲧⲙⲧⲣⲉⲡⲁⲗⲗⲟⲫⲩⲗⲟⲥ
Translation: For what this woman had entreated God to grant her was that a pagan man should not touch her at all.

Verse: ⲡϩⲩⲡⲟⲑⲉⲥⲓⲥ ⲙⲡⲓϣⲁ ⲙⲉϩ ⲛⲣⲁϣⲉ ϩⲙⲡⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲉⲛⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲡⲉⲧⲫⲟⲣⲉⲓ ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ · ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲙⲉϩ ⲛⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ⲉϥϣⲉϣⲥϯⲛⲟⲩϥⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲛⲓⲙ · ⲟⲩⲙⲟⲛⲟⲛ ϫⲉⲡⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲧⲉⲩϣⲏ ⁛
Translation: The subject of this festival to-day is full of joy, for it is our holy father, who had put on Christ, Apa Pisentius, who was full of light; and who spread abroad a sweet odour at all times, not only during the day, but during the night also.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲃⲛⲟⲟⲩⲉ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲕⲁϩ ⲙⲛⲛϩⲁⲗⲁⲁⲧⲉ ⲛⲧⲡⲉ ⲥⲉⲉⲩⲫⲣⲁⲛⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲩⲥⲕⲓⲣⲧⲁ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲩⲧⲉⲗⲏⲗ ϩⲙⲡⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲉϥϣⲙⲛⲟⲩϥⲉ ⲉⲧⲧⲁⲓⲏⲩ · ⲡⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲧⲁϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲧϩⲉ ⲉⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛⲁⲧⲁⲙⲟⲛ ⲉⲛϣⲁⲛⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲉⲧϩⲏ ⁛—
Translation: All the beasts which are upon the earth, and (all) the birds which are in the heavens rejoice, and move about gladly, and are happy this day because of the good and glorious news of him which hath reached them, according to what the words shall inform us, if we are able to proceed to the end.

Verse: ⲁⲓⲱⲣⲕ ⲉⲧⲣⲁⲕⲁⲣⲱⲓ ⲉⲧⲙϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲛⲉⲕⲕⲁⲧⲟⲣⲑⲱⲙⲁ · ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉⲉⲕⲡⲏⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲉⲟⲟⲩ · ⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ϫⲓⲛⲧⲁⲣⲭⲏ ⲛⲧⲁⲕⲣⲙⲟⲛⲁⲭⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲁⲧⲕⲣⲉⲡⲓⲥⲕⲟⲡⲟⲥ
Translation: I took an oath to keep silence and not to speak concerning thy righteous acts and judgements, because thou thyself didst flee from the adulations of men from the very beginning, when thou didst become a monk, and before thou didst become a bishop.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲙⲉ ⲉⲛϣⲁⲛⲥⲱⲟⲩϩ ⲧⲏⲣⲛ
Translation: And indeed if we were all to be gathered together, each one having the opportunity of speaking, one would declare (the greatness of) his knowledge, and another his power of disputation, and another would proclaim his power of revealing hidden things; and thus it would happen that all the descriptions (of him) would be laudatory.

Verse: ⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲇⲉ ⲓⲁⲕⲱⲃⲟⲥ ⲡⲁⲡⲟⲥⲧⲟⲗⲟⲥ ⲱϣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲛⲧⲉϥⲉⲡⲓⲥⲧⲟⲗⲏ ⲛⲕⲁⲑⲟⲗⲓⲕⲟⲛ ϫⲉⲡⲉⲧⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲙⲡⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩϥ ⲛϥⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲁⲛ ⲟⲩⲛⲟⲃⲉ ⲛⲁϥ ⲡⲉ ⁛—
Translation: Saint James the Apostle cried out in his Catholic Epistle, saying, 'He who knoweth how to do what is good, and doeth it not, it is a sin unto him.'

Verse: ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲉⲓⲙⲉ ϫⲉⲛⲓⲙ ⲡⲉⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡϩⲓⲉⲣⲟⲥ ⲛⲁⲡⲟⲥⲧⲟⲗⲟⲥ ϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ϫⲉϯⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲣⲱⲙⲉ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ϩⲁⲧϩⲏ ⲙⲙⲛⲧⲁϥⲧⲉ ⲛⲣⲟⲙⲡⲉ ·
Translation: Let us learn, moreover, who it was to whom the Apostle (Paul) referred in his words, I knew a man in Christ fourteen years ago,

Verse: ⲉⲓⲧⲉ ⲉϥϩⲙⲡⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲛϯⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲁⲛ ⲉⲓⲧⲉ ⲉϥⲙⲡⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲛϯⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲁⲛ ⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲡⲉⲧⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ϫⲉⲁⲩⲧⲱⲣⲡ ⲙⲡⲁⲓ ⲛϯⲙⲓⲛⲉ ϣⲁⲧⲙⲉϩϣⲟⲙⲧⲉ ⲙⲡⲉ ·
Translation: but whether he be in the body I know not, or whether he be out of the body I know not, it is only God Who knoweth, (this man I say) was caught up into the third heaven.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ϯⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛϯⲙⲓⲛⲉ ⲉⲓⲧⲉ ⲉϥϩⲙⲡⲥⲱⲙⲁ · ⲉⲓⲧⲉ ⲉϥⲙⲡⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲛϯⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲁⲛ ⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲡⲉⲧⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ϫⲉⲁⲩⲧⲟⲣⲡϥ ⲉⲡⲡⲁⲣⲁⲇⲓⲥⲟⲥ ⲁϥⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉϩⲉⲛϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲩϩⲏⲡ ·
Translation: And I knew such a man, but whether he be in the body (now), or whether he be out of the body (now) I know not, it is only God Who knoweth, (this man I say) was caught up into Paradise, and heard things which were hidden,

Verse: ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲉⲛⲥⲧⲟ ⲁⲛ ⲉϫⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⁛—
Translation: the which it is not lawful for man to utter.

Verse: ⲛⲓⲙ ϭⲉ ⲡⲉⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡⲁⲡⲟⲥⲧⲟⲗⲟⲥ ϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲉⲓⲙⲏⲧⲓ ⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲙⲁⲩⲁⲁϥ ·
Translation: Of whom then was the Apostle speaking if it was not Pisentius?

Verse: ⲉⲡⲉⲓⲇⲏ ⲛⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲡⲏⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ · ⲧⲁⲓ ϩⲱⲱϥ ⲧⲉ ⲧϩⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲛⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲉⲧⲧⲁⲓⲏⲩ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲡⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲁⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲟⲩⲟⲛϩϥ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲛϩⲟⲟⲩ
Translation: For all the saints have fled from the glory (or, adulation) of this world, and this did also our glorious father, Apa Pisentius, whom God hath made manifest to us in our own days.

Verse: ⲉϥⲟ ⲛⲣⲉϥⲣⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ⲙⲡⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ ⲧⲏⲣϥ
Translation: He was a giver of light to the whole world.

Verse: ⲉϥⲟ ⲛϩⲙⲟⲩ ⲉϥϫⲱⲕⲣ ⲛⲟⲩⲟⲛ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲉⲧⲥⲏϩ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲩⲁⲅⲅⲉⲗⲓⲟⲛ ϫⲉⲛⲧⲱⲧⲛ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲉϩⲙⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲕⲁϩ ·
Translation: He was salt which was purified for every one, according to that which is written in the Gospel, 'Ye are the salt of the earth.

Verse: ⲉⲣϣⲁⲛⲡⲉϩⲙⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲃⲁⲃⲉ ⲉⲩⲛⲁⲙⲟⲗϩϥ ϩⲛⲟⲩ ·
Translation: Now if the salt hath become tasteless, wherewith shall they make it salt (again)?

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲟⲛ ϫⲉⲛⲧⲱⲧⲛ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ⲙⲡⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And again, 'Ye are the light of the world.'

Verse: ⲉϥϩⲱⲡ ⲛⲛⲉϥⲡⲟⲗⲓⲧⲉⲓⲁ · ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲅⲉⲛⲉⲁ · ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲙⲛⲛⲉϥⲉⲛⲧⲟⲗⲏ ⁛— ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲧϩⲉ ⲉⲧⲥⲏϩ
Translation: He hid his life and the works thereof, but God hath made manifest those who perform His will and commandments, generation after generation, according to that which is written,

Verse: ϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϩⲏⲛ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲟⲩⲟⲛ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲉⲧⲱϣ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲙⲉ ϥⲛⲁⲣⲡⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲛⲟⲩⲟⲛ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲉⲧⲣϩⲟⲧⲉ ϩⲏⲧϥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ϥⲛⲁⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲡⲉⲩⲥⲟⲡⲥⲡ ⲛϥⲧⲟⲩϫⲟⲟⲩ ⁛—
Translation: God draweth nigh to every one who crieth out to Him in truth, and He doeth the will of every one who holdeth Him in fear, and He will hear their supplication, and will deliver them.'

Verse: ⲧⲉⲧⲛⲟⲩⲱϣ ϭⲉ ⲉⲉⲓⲙⲉ ϫⲉⲉϥⲙⲟⲥⲧⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲧϣⲟⲩⲉⲓⲧ ·
Translation: Now if ye wish to know whether he hated the glory (or, adulation) which was vain, and whether he wished not for any to applaud him in any way or not, go into... and learn concerning him from the acts of his life and the manner in which he used to live.

Verse: ⲁϥϫⲛⲟⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ϫⲉⲟⲩⲛⲧⲉⲧⲛ ⲁⲡⲟⲕⲣⲏⲥⲓⲥ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲓⲙⲉⲣⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Then he asked them, saying, 'Have ye any decided reason for coming into this region?'

Verse: ⲁⲩⲟⲩⲱϣⲃ ϫⲉⲡⲣⲱⲧⲟⲛ ⲙⲉⲛ ⲛⲧⲁⲛⲕⲁⲣⲁⲧⲛ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲛⲉⲓ ϣⲁⲣⲟⲕ ⲛⲧⲛϭⲙⲡⲉⲕϣⲓⲛⲉ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲧⲛϫⲓ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲥⲙⲟⲩ
Translation: And they answered, saying, 'In the first place, we set out in order to come to thee, and to pay thee a visit, and to receive thy

Verse: ϫⲉⲙⲡⲉⲛⲣⲟⲟⲩϣ ⲙⲡⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ · ⲕⲁⲛ ⲉⲡⲁⲣⲁⲅⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲕ · ⲉⲓⲥⲟⲩⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ ⲛϩⲟⲟⲩ ⁛—
Translation: For had it not been for the cares of the world which have occupied us for several days past we should have passed thy way before this.

Verse: ⲙⲛⲛⲥⲱⲥ ⲟⲩⲛⲧⲁⲛ ⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲛⲟⲩⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲛⲁⲡⲟⲕⲣⲓⲥⲓⲥ · ϩⲙⲡⲓⲧⲟϣ ⲉⲛⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲉⲧⲟϣⲥ · ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ϣⲗⲏⲗ ⲉϫⲱⲛ ⲡⲉⲛⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲛ ·
Translation: In the second place, we have a little business in this neighbourhood which we wish to arrange ; but do thou pray on our behalf, O father, that God may journey with us.

Verse: ⲉⲣϣⲁⲛⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ϯⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲁⲛ · ⲧⲛⲛⲁⲕⲧⲟⲛ ϣⲁⲣⲟⲕ ⲛⲕⲉⲥⲟⲡ
Translation: If God be pleased to permit us to do this we shall return to thee again, and we wiU salute (or, kiss) thee, and receive thy blessing before we return to our houses, if it be God's will.'

Verse: ϯϩⲧⲏⲧⲛ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲣⲱⲧⲛ ⲛⲁϣⲏⲣⲉ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲓϯⲙⲉ
Translation: y sons, take ye good heed to yourselves in these villages.

Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲥⲩⲛⲧⲉⲭⲉⲓ
Translation: Hold no intercourse with a woman who is bad.

Verse: ⲙⲡⲣϫⲓⲙⲁⲥⲉ
Translation: Do not seize the ox of the poor.

Verse: ⲉϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲟⲩⲛⲧⲏⲧⲛ ⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲉⲣⲱⲙⲉ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲓⲙⲉⲣⲟⲥ
Translation: If there be any man in this region who is indebted to you, do not treat him harshly, and do not attempt to force him to pay by legal means;

Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲣⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲉⲛⲉⲧⲙⲯⲩⲭⲏ ϫⲉⲕⲁⲥ ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ
Translation: but watch what is in (his) mind, in order that God may shew compassion unto you.'

Verse: ⲁⲩⲟⲩⲱϣⲃ ϫⲉϣⲗⲏⲗ
Translation: And they answered, saying, 'Pray for us, O our father.'

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁⲩⲉⲓ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲓⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ
Translation: And they came away from his presence, and they acted (according to) his plan (or, way), and they gave glory to God because of the words of advice wherewith he had advised them.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲟⲩⲉⲓ ⲇⲉ ϣⲁⲣⲟϥ ⲁⲩⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲉϥⲙⲉⲗⲏⲧⲁ · ϩⲛⲛϣⲁϫⲉ ⲙⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲓⲉⲣⲉⲙⲓⲁⲥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲥϭⲣⲁϩⲧ ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲧⲱⲱⲃⲥ ·
Translation: And when they had come to him, they heard him reciting the words of Saint Jeremiah with great calmness and clearness,

Verse: ⲁⲩϩⲙⲟⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲙⲁ ⲛϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲉⲩϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲡⲇⲓⲕⲁⲓⲟⲛ ⲁⲛ ⲡⲉ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡϩⲱⲃ ⲡⲣⲉⲡⲉⲓ · ⲁⲛ ⲡⲉ · ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲛⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ϣⲁⲛⲧⲉϥⲟⲩⲱ ⲉϥⲙⲉⲗⲏⲧⲁ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥϣⲗⲏⲗ ·
Translation: and they sat down outside his place of abode for a little time, saying, 'It is not right, and the matter is not of such urgency as to make it seemly for us to cry out to the holy man inside until he hath finished reciting the Scriptures and praying

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲟⲩⲱ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲡⲣⲟⲫⲏⲧⲏⲥ · ⲛϥϫⲱⲕϥ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ · ⲁⲩⲧⲱⲟⲩⲛ ϫⲉⲉⲩⲛⲁⲕⲱⲗϩ ⲉⲡⲣⲟ · ⲁϥⲁⲣⲭⲉⲓⲥⲑⲉ ⲉⲡⲉⲡⲣⲟⲫⲏⲧⲏⲥ ⲓⲉⲍⲉⲕⲓⲏⲗ ·
Translation: And when Pisentius had concluded the reciting of the Prophet Jeremiah, and had finished (his prayer), the two men rose up and knocked at the door, at the very moment when he began to (recite) the (Book of the) Prophet Ezekiel.

Verse: ⲁⲩϩⲙⲟⲟⲥ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲟⲛ ⲙⲡⲟⲩⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⁛—
Translation: And they sat down, and did not cry out to Pisentius inside.

Verse: ⲗⲟⲓⲡⲟⲛ ⲁϥϫⲉⲕⲡⲉⲡⲣⲟⲫⲏⲧⲏⲥ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲧⲏⲣϥ ⲁϥⲕⲁⲣⲱϥ · ⲉⲛⲉⲁⲣⲟⲩϩⲉ ⲅⲁⲣ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ·
Translation: And finally he finished reciting the whole of the (Book of) the Prophet (Ezekiel), and he shut his mouth, for the evening had come.

Verse: ⲉⲁⲩⲕⲱⲗϩ ⲉⲡⲣⲟ · ⲁϥⲣⲟⲩⲱ ⲛⲁⲩ ϫⲉⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲟⲓ
Translation: And when the two men knocked at the door, Pisentius answered them, saying, 'Bless me.'

Verse: ⲁϥϭⲱϣⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉϫⲱⲟⲩ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛϣⲟⲩϣⲧ ⲁϥϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲩ · ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ · ϫⲉⲉⲧⲉⲧⲛⲉⲓ ⲉⲡⲉⲓⲙⲁ ⲉⲓⲥ ⲁⲟⲩⲏⲣ ⲛⲛⲁⲩ ·
Translation: And he looked out upon them from a large window, and he spake unto them, saying, 'Did ye come to this place many hours ago?'

Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲁⲩ ϫⲉⲁⲛⲉⲓ ϫⲓⲛⲛϣⲱⲣⲡ ⲙⲡⲉⲛⲧⲟⲗⲙⲁ ⲉⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ϣⲁⲛⲧⲕⲟⲩⲱ ⲉⲕⲙⲉⲗⲏⲧⲁ ⁛
Translation: And they said unto him, 'We came here at dawn, but we did not dare to cry out to thee inside until thou hadst finished thy recital (of the Scriptures)

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ ⲁϥⲣⲓⲙⲉ ⲁϥϩⲓⲟⲩⲉ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ϩⲙⲡⲉϥϩⲏⲧ · ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁⲩ ϫⲉⲁⲓϯ ⲛⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲟⲥⲉ ⲙⲡϩⲟⲟⲩ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛϩⲓⲥⲉ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁⲓⲁⲁⲩ ϩⲛⲡⲉⲧϣⲟⲩⲉⲓⲧ ⁛—
Translation: Then straightway Apa Pisentius wept, and smote upon his breast, and said unto them,' This day I deserve a very great punishment, and all the labours which I have performed are things of vanity.'

Verse: ⲛⲧⲁϥϫⲉ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲉϥⲡⲏⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲧϣⲟⲩⲉⲓⲧ ⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Now these things which the holy man spake (shew) that he fled from the vain adulations of men.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲁϥⲙⲕⲁϩ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲡⲉϥϩⲏⲧ ϫⲉⲁⲩⲉⲓⲙⲉ ϩⲟⲗⲱⲥ · ϫⲉⲁϥⲙⲉⲗⲏⲧⲁ ·
Translation: He was very sad at heart, but the two men knew that he was reciting (the Books of Jeremiah and Ezekiel).

Verse: ⲁⲧⲉⲧⲛⲉⲓⲙⲉ ϭⲉ · ⲱ ⲛⲁⲙⲉⲣⲁⲧⲉ ϫⲉⲉⲣⲉⲛⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲉⲡⲓⲑⲩⲙⲉⲓ ⲉⲡⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲙⲁⲩⲁⲁϥ ·
Translation: Know ye therefore, O my beloved, that the saints crave for the glory of God only.

Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉⲙⲙⲟⲛ ⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲡⲙⲉⲗⲓⲟⲅⲣⲁⲫⲟⲥ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲇⲁⲇ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲁⲓⲉⲡⲓⲑⲩⲙⲉⲓ ⲉⲛⲉⲕⲉⲛⲧⲟⲗⲏ
Translation: If ye will not (believe me), hearken unto the honey-sweet writer David who saith, 'I have desired Thy commandments;

Verse: ϭⲱϣⲧ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲱⲓ ⲛⲅⲛⲁ ⲛⲁⲓ ·
Translation: look Thou upon me and have compassion upon me.'

Verse: ⲡⲥⲟⲫⲟⲥ
Translation: And the truly wise man Paul cried out, saying, 'For we groan in this earnestly desiring to array ourselves in our place of abode which is from heaven.

Verse: ⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲉⲧⲉⲓⲛⲟϭ ⲛϣⲡⲏⲣⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲓⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ ⲉⲧⲓ ⲉϥⲟ ⲙⲙⲟⲛⲁⲭⲟⲥ · ⲉϥⲉⲥⲩⲭⲁⲍⲉ · ϩⲛⲧⲉϥⲣⲓ ⲙⲡⲁⲧϥⲣⲉⲡⲓⲥⲕⲟⲡⲟⲥ
Translation: Hearken also to this great miracle which took place by his I hands when he was a monk living in quiet contemplation in his cell and before he became a bishop.

Verse: ⲁϥϣⲱⲛⲉ ⲉⲡⲉϥⲥⲡⲗⲏⲛ · ⲛⲟⲩⲥⲟⲡ ϩⲙⲡϣⲟⲙⲛⲧ ⲙⲡϣⲁ ⲙⲡⲃⲱⲗ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ
Translation: He was suffering from his spleen on one occasion on the third day of the festival at the end of Easter,

Verse: ⲙⲡⲉϥⲧⲁⲙⲉⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲇⲉ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲥⲛⲏⲩ ϫⲉⲉϥϣⲱⲛⲉ · ⲛⲉ ⲁϥϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲛⲁⲩ ⲡⲉϫⲉϣⲗⲏⲗ ⲉϫⲱⲓ
Translation: but he did not make known to any one of the brethren that he was sick, but he sent them a message and said, 'Pray for me.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲁⲃⲱⲕ ⲉⲧϩⲉⲛⲉⲉⲧⲉ ⲛⲁⲡⲁ ⲁⲃⲣⲁϩⲁⲙ · ⲛⲧⲁϭⲙⲡϣⲓⲛⲉ · ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲥⲟⲛ ⲉⲧϩⲙⲡⲙⲁ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ
Translation: I am going to the monastery of Apa Abraham to visit the brethren who are in that place.

Verse: ⲉⲣϣⲁⲛⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϯⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲁⲕⲧⲟⲓ ϣⲁⲣⲱⲧⲛ ·
Translation: If the Lord be pleased to permit it I shall return to you.'

Verse: ⲛⲧⲁϥϫⲉⲡⲁⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲉⲧⲙⲧⲣⲉⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲉⲓⲙⲉ ϫⲉⲉϥϣⲱⲛⲉ ϩⲟⲗⲱⲥ ·
Translation: Now he spake in this wise because he did not wish to let any one know that he was seriously ill.

Verse: ⲉⲣϣⲁⲛⲟⲩⲁ ⲇⲉ ϣⲓⲛⲉ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲁⲕⲣⲓⲃⲓⲁ ·ϫⲉ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲟⲩ ⲁⲡⲉⲓⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ϫⲉⲡⲁⲓ ·
Translation: Now if any man shall ask in a spirit of contentiousness why the holy man said this,

Verse: ⲙⲁⲣϥⲱϣ ϩⲙⲡϫⲱⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲓⲱⲃ ⲡⲙⲁⲕⲁⲣⲓⲟⲥ · ϥⲛⲁϩⲉ ⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲉⲕⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ϫⲉⲛⲧⲁⲓⲣⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲉⲕⲉⲥⲙⲟⲧ · ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ϫⲉⲉⲕⲉⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲇⲓⲕⲁⲓⲟⲥ ⁛—
Translation: let him read in the Book of Job the Blessed, and he will find that the Lord said unto him, 'I have not done these things unto thee for any other purpose except to make thee shew thyself to be righteous/

Verse: ⲡⲁⲩⲗⲟⲥ ϩⲱⲱϥ ϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲉⲓⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲛⲛⲁⲓ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲉⲩⲁⲅⲅⲉⲗⲓⲟⲛ ϫⲉⲉⲓⲉϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲁϥ ⲛⲕⲓⲛⲱⲛⲟⲥ ⁛—
Translation: And Paul himself said, ' I have done all these things for the sake of the Gospel, that I might be to him a companion.'

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲇⲉ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ · ⲣⲟⲩϩⲃⲇⲟⲙⲁⲥ ⲉϥϣⲱⲛⲉ · ⲙⲡⲉⲛⲉⲥⲛⲏⲩ ϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲛⲥⲱϥ · ⲉϥⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ϫⲉⲉϥϩⲙⲡⲃⲏⲃ ·
Translation: Now when the holy man Apa Pisentius had been sick. for a whole week, and the brethren had made no enquiries after him, for they thought he was in a cave,

Verse: ⲁⲩϣⲁϫⲉ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲩⲉⲣⲏⲩ ϫⲉⲁⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ ϣⲏⲙ ⲱⲥⲕ · ⲙⲁⲣⲛϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲛⲥⲱϥ ·
Translation: they held converse with each other, saying, 'Pisentius tarrieth somewhat over long, let us enquire about him.

Verse: ϫⲉⲙⲉϣⲁⲕ ⲛⲧⲁϥϣⲱⲛⲉ · ϩⲓⲧⲉϩⲓⲏ · ⲏ ⲙⲉϣⲁⲕ ⲛⲧⲁⲡϩⲓⲥⲉ ⲑⲙⲕⲟϥ · ⲙⲡⲉϥⲉϣⲧⲱⲟⲩⲛ ·
Translation: Perhaps he hath fallen sick on the road, or perhaps some suffering hath afflicted him, and he is unable to walk.

Verse: ⲁⲩϫⲟⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲥⲟⲛ ⲉⲡⲉϥⲟⲩⲏⲏⲃ ⲉϥϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲛⲥⲱϥ ·
Translation: And they sent a brother who was a priest to make enquiries about him.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲇⲉ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲟⲩⲟⲓⲕⲟⲛⲟⲙⲓⲁ · ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲁⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲛⲉϣⲡⲏⲣⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: Now when Pisentius had departed, according to the dispensation of God—now observe ye the wonderful acts of God—

Verse: ⲛⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲁⲁϥ ⲉϥⲛⲕⲟⲧⲕ ⲉϥϣⲱⲛⲉ ⲛⲉⲣⲉⲛⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲇⲓⲁⲕⲱⲛⲉⲓ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ϣⲁⲡⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁⲡⲥⲟⲛ ⲃⲱⲕ ϣⲁⲣⲟϥ ·
Translation: all the days which he had passed lying on his bed sick, during which the holy men did not minister unto him, until the very day wherein the brother went to him...

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡⲥⲟⲛ
Translation: Now when the brother went to him, he found the door of the little cell wherein he lived open.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡⲥⲟⲛ
Translation: And when the brother had waited for some time, he rose up and called out to (the dweller) inside, 'Bless me.'

Verse: ⲁⲧⲉⲧⲛⲉⲓⲙⲉ ϭⲉ ⲱ ⲛⲁⲙⲉⲣⲁⲧⲉ ϫⲉⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ⲉⲛⲉⲛⲧⲟⲗⲏ ⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧⲙⲟⲛⲁⲭⲟⲥ ⲛϥϫⲱⲕⲟⲩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲁϫⲛⲙⲛⲧⲣⲉϥϫⲛⲁⲁⲩ ϣⲁⲣⲉⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲙⲉⲣⲓⲧϥ ·
Translation: Know ye then, O my beloved, that him that keepeth the commandments of monasticising, and fulfilleth them without sluggishness, doth the Christ love.

Verse: ⲛϥϫⲟⲟⲩ ϣⲁⲣⲟϥ ⲛⲛⲉϥⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲙⲙⲁⲧⲉ ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ϣⲁⲩⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ
Translation: His holy ones do not speak to Him only, but they see God, each one in the vision which appeareth unto him, according to the form wherein He wisheth to make Himself manifest to them.

Verse: ⲓⲁⲕⲱⲃ ⲙⲉⲛ ⲡⲡⲁⲧⲣⲓⲁⲣⲭⲏⲥ ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϩⲣⲉⲃⲉⲕⲕⲁ ⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲛϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛⲏⲥⲁⲩ · ⲡⲉⲥⲛⲟϭ ⲛϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲉϥϭⲟⲛⲧ ⲉⲓⲁⲕⲱⲃ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲉⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁⲓⲥⲁⲁⲕ ⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲁⲥⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲡⲉϫⲁⲥ ⲛⲁϥ
Translation: Now as concerneth Jacob the Patriarch. When Rebecca had heard the words of Esau, her eldest son, who was wroth with Jacob because of the blessing wherewith Isaac had blessed him, she cried out to him, and said unto him,

Verse: ϫⲉⲉⲓⲥ ⲡⲉⲕⲥⲟⲛ ⲛⲟϭⲥ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ · ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲉⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁⲓⲥⲁⲁⲕ ⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲛϩⲏⲧϥ ⲉⲧⲉⲡⲉⲕⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲡⲉ ·
Translation: Behold thy brother (Esau) is older than thou, and the blessing wherewith Isaac, who is thy father, hath blessed thee (belongeth to him).

Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϭⲉ ⲧⲱⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲅⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲙⲉⲥⲟⲡⲟⲧⲁⲙⲓⲁ ⲛⲧⲥⲩⲣⲓⲁ ϣⲁⲗⲁⲃⲁⲛ ⲡⲁⲥⲟⲛ ⲛⲅⲟⲩⲱϩ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ ϣⲁⲛⲧⲉⲡϭⲱⲛⲧ ⲛⲧⲟⲣⲅⲏ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲥⲟⲛ · ⲕⲧⲟϥ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲙⲟⲕ · ⲙⲏⲡⲟⲧⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲣⲁⲧϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲙⲙⲱⲧⲛ ⲙⲡⲉⲥⲛⲁⲩ ⲛⲟⲩϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲟⲩⲱⲧ ϩⲓⲟⲩⲥⲟⲡ ·
Translation: Now therefore, arise, and get thee gone into Mesopotamia of Syria, to Laban my brother, and do thou abide with him until the fury of the wrath of thy brother hath turned away from thee, lest peradventure I become childless in respect of both of you at once, and on the same day

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲟⲛ ⲁⲓⲥⲁⲁⲕ ϩⲱⲛ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ ⲁϥⲉⲓ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲁⲓⲁⲕⲱⲃ ⲧⲁⲁϥ ⲉⲧⲉϩⲓⲏ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲉⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲙⲉⲥⲟⲡⲟⲇⲁⲙⲓⲁ ·
Translation: And Isaac also commanded him (thus), and he came out (to) Jacob and set him on his way, saying, 'Depart into Mesopotamia'

Verse: ⲁϥⲧⲱⲙⲛⲧ ⲉⲩⲙⲁ · ⲁϥⲛⲕⲟⲧⲕ · ⲛⲉⲁⲡⲣⲏ ϩⲱⲧⲡ ⲉⲣⲟϥ
Translation: And it came to pass that he arrived at a certain place, and he lay down (there); now the sun had set.

Verse: ⲁϥⲕⲱ ⲛⲟⲩⲱⲛⲉ ϩⲁⲧⲉϥⲁⲡⲉ · ⲁϥⲛⲕⲟⲧⲕ ⲁϥⲡⲱⲱⲣⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲣⲁⲥⲟⲩ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲟⲩϣⲏ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ·
Translation: And when he had placed a stone under his head, he lay down and fell asleep, and that night he dreamed a dream.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁϥⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲩⲕⲗⲟⲟⲗⲉ · ⲉⲥⲧⲁϫⲣⲏⲩ · ϩⲓϫⲙⲡⲕⲁϩ ⲉⲣⲉⲧⲉⲥⲁⲡⲉ ⲡⲏϩ ϣⲁϩⲣⲁⲓ · ⲉⲧⲡⲉ ·
Translation: And he saw a cloud fixed upon the earth, and the top thereof reached into the heavens;

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲁⲅⲅⲉⲗⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲩⲛⲁ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲩⲛⲏⲩ ⲉⲡⲉⲥⲏⲧ ϩⲓⲱⲱⲥ ·
Translation: and the angels of God were ascending and descending upon it.

Verse: ⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲛϥⲧⲁϫⲣⲏⲩ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲱⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁϥⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲟⲩϣⲏ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲁϥϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ ·
Translation: Now God was standing upon it, and He made Himself manifest to Jacob ne on that night, and He spake with him.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲙⲉⲥⲟⲡⲟⲇⲁⲙⲓⲁ ⲛⲧⲥⲩⲣⲓⲁ · ⲁⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲟⲛ ϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ ⲛⲧⲉⲩϣⲏ ϫⲉϥⲓⲉⲓⲁⲧⲕ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲛⲅⲛⲁⲩ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲕⲃⲁⲗ ⲉⲛϭⲓⲛⲉⲓ ⲙⲛⲛⲟⲉⲓⲗⲉ ⲛϩⲁⲛⲟⲩⲟⲃϣ ·
Translation: Now when Jacob had gone into Mesopotamia of Syria, God spake again with him in the night season, saying, ' Lift up thine eyes and look with them, and thou shalt see that I will come to the white sheep,

Verse: ⲉⲩϥⲱϭⲉ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲛⲛⲉⲥⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲛⲛⲃⲁⲙⲡⲉ · ⲉⲩⲙⲓⲥⲉ ⲛϩⲉⲛⲁⲩⲉⲓⲛ · ⲁⲩⲉⲓⲉⲓⲛ ⲛⲕⲣⲙⲉⲥ ⲛⲥⲓⲟⲩⲥⲓⲟⲩ ·
Translation: and the (white) sheep shall be with the goats, and they shall bring forth young of variegated colours, and they shall be in colour like ashes, and (some) sheep shall be marked with stars (i.e. spots).'

Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲁϥ ⲟⲛ ϩⲛⲟⲩϩⲟⲣⲟⲙⲁ ⲛⲧⲉⲩϣⲏ ϫⲉⲁⲛⲟⲕ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲓⲥⲁⲁⲕ ⲙⲡⲣⲣϩⲟⲧⲉ ·
Translation: And again God spake unto him in a vision of the night, saying, 'I am the God of Isaac; fear thou not.

Verse: ⲁϣⲁⲓ ⲛⲅⲁⲓⲁⲓ ⲛⲅⲙⲉϩⲡⲕⲁϩ ⲛⲅⲣϫⲥ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲱϥ ·
Translation: Thou shalt certainly increase and multiply, and thou shalt fill the earth, and thou shalt become the lord thereof.'

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣϥⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ϩⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲃ ⲙⲛⲡϩⲁⲧ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲥⲟⲟⲩ · ⲙⲛⲛⲃⲁⲁⲙⲡⲉ ⲙⲛⲛⲧⲃⲛⲟⲟⲩⲉ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ·
Translation: And when God had blessed him with gold, and silver, and sheep, and goats, and cattle of every kind.

Verse: ⲁϥϣⲁϫⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ · ϫⲉⲕⲟⲧⲕ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲡⲉⲕⲏⲓ
Translation: He spake again unto him, saying, 'Get thee back into thy house; I will be with thee.'

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϩⲧⲟⲟⲩⲉ ⲇⲉ ϣⲱⲡⲉ · ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ ⲛϭⲓⲓⲁⲕⲱⲃ ϫⲉⲙⲁⲧⲁⲙⲟⲓ ⲉⲡⲉⲕⲣⲁⲛ ⁛—
Translation: Now when the morning had come Jacob said unto him, 'Shew me thy name.'

Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲉⲧⲃⲉⲟⲩ ⲕϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲛⲥⲁⲡⲁⲣⲁⲛ ·
Translation: And the man said unto him, 'Why dost thou enquire concerning my name?'

Verse: ⲡⲁⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲩϣⲡⲏⲣⲉ ⲡⲉ ·
Translation: Now this is a most wonderful thing.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲕⲁⲁⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉⲁⲡⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ⲉⲓ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ·
Translation: And the man said unto Jacob, 'Let me go, for the daylight is growing stronger.'

Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲛϯⲛⲁⲕⲁⲁⲕ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲁⲛ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲟⲓ ·
Translation: And Jacob said unto him, 'I will not let thee go whilst as yet thou hast not blessed me'

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲛⲓⲙ ⲛⲣⲁⲛ
Translation: And the man said unto Jacob, 'What is the name which thou hast?'

Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲛⲛⲉⲩⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ϫⲉⲓⲁⲕⲱⲃ · ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲡⲓⲥⲣⲁⲏⲗ ⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛⲣⲁⲛ ϫⲉⲁⲕϭⲙϭⲟⲙ ⲙⲛⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲇⲩⲛⲁⲇⲟⲥ ⲙⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ·
Translation: And the man said unto Jacob, 'They shall no more call thee Jacob, but Israel, which is the name which thou shalt have; for thou hast prevailed with God, and thou (shalt be) mighty with men'

Verse: ⲁϥϫⲱϩ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲡⲡⲱϫⲕ ⲙⲡⲙⲉⲣⲟⲥ ⲛⲓⲁⲕⲱⲃ ⲁϥⲛⲟⲩϣⲥ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲉϥⲙⲉⲣⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And the man touched the side of a member of Jacob, and that member became without feeling.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ϫⲉⲁⲓⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛϩⲟ ϩⲓϩⲟ ·
Translation: Then Jacob said, 'I have seen God face to face.'

Verse: ⲁⲥⲟⲩϫⲁⲓ ⲛϭⲓⲧⲁⲯⲩⲭⲏ · ⲁⲡⲣⲏ ⲇⲉ ϣⲁⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲱϥ · ⲛⲧⲉⲣϥⲥⲟⲧϥ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲉⲓⲛⲉ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: My soul is delivered.' Now the sun was rising upon him when he passed the Image of God.

Verse: ⲁⲛⲟⲛ ⲇⲉ ϩⲱⲱⲛ ⲱ ⲛⲁⲙⲉⲣⲁⲁⲧⲉ ϣϣⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲛ ·
Translation: And, O my beloved, it is right that for us this should suffice.

Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉⲁⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ
Translation: If God deemed him worthy thereof, and came down into the world, and spake unto the creature which He had fashioned concerning his restoration with salvation of soul, how very much more will He not send His saints to comfort (His servants) in their sufferings?

Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣⲉⲗⲁⲁⲩ ϭⲉ ⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲣⲁⲡⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ
Translation: Therefore let no man allow himself to be unbelieving concerning this matter which I have related unto him concerning the holy man Apa Pisentius the bishop, for he was worthy to see Elijah the Tishbite.

Verse: ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲃⲟⲏⲑⲉⲓ ⲉⲣⲟⲛ ϩⲙⲛⲉⲧⲕⲛⲁⲉϣϭⲙϭⲟⲙ · ⲉⲁⲁϥ ⲛⲅϣⲛϩⲧⲏⲕ ϩⲁⲣⲟⲛ ·
Translation: But do Thou help us, for Thou art able to help us by what Thou canst do; have compassion upon us.'

Verse: ⲓⲏⲥⲟⲩⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲟⲩⲛϭⲟⲙ ⲛϩⲱⲃ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲙⲡⲉⲧⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ ·
Translation: Jesus said unto him, 'Everything is possible for him that believeth.'

Verse: ⲁϥϫⲓϣⲕⲁⲕ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲙⲡϣⲏⲣⲉ ϣⲏⲙ ϫⲉϯⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ · ⲃⲟⲏⲑⲉⲓ ⲉⲧⲁⲙⲛⲧⲁⲧⲛⲁϩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: And the father of the young man cried out, 'I believe. Help thou mine unbelief.'

Verse: ⲁϥⲉⲡⲉⲓⲧⲏⲙⲁ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲡⲉⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁ ⲙⲡⲟⲛⲏⲣⲟⲛ ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ ⲁϥⲛⲟϫϥ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛϩⲏⲧϥ ϩⲓⲧⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲡⲉϥⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲡⲓⲥⲧⲉⲩⲉ ·
Translation: Then straightway (Jesus) rebuked the evil spirit, and cast him out from the young man because his father believed.

Verse: ϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ϩⲛⲧϭⲟⲙ ⲛⲧⲡⲓⲥⲧⲓⲥ · ⲁⲩⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ϯⲡⲉⲥⲟⲩⲟⲓ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲉⲥⲛⲟϥ ϩⲁⲣⲟⲥ ⲙⲙⲛⲧⲥⲛⲟⲟⲩⲥ ⲛⲣⲟⲙⲡⲉ · ⲧⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲉⲙⲡⲉⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲉϣϭⲙϭⲟⲙ ⲉⲧⲁⲗϭⲟⲥ
Translation: And again it was by the might of faith that a certain woman went to Him, whose blood had been flowing from her for twelve years, and whom no man had been able to heal.

Verse: ⲁⲥϫⲱϩ ⲙⲙⲁⲧⲉ ⲉⲡⲧⲟⲡ ⲙⲡⲉϥϩⲟⲓⲧⲉ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ · ⲁⲡⲉⲥⲛⲟϥ ϭⲱ ⲉϥϣⲟⲩⲟ
Translation: She touched only the outer edge of His garment, and immediately her blood ceased to flow, and dried up.

Verse: ⲉⲁϥϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲥ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲧⲟⲩⲡⲓⲥⲧⲓⲥ ⲧⲉⲛⲧⲁⲥⲛⲁϩⲙⲉ · ⲃⲱⲕ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲉⲓⲣⲏⲛⲏ ·
Translation: Then He spake unto her, saying, 'It is thy faith which hath delivered thee; go in peace.'

Verse: ⲁϥϣⲁϫⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲙⲛⲙⲙⲁⲑⲏⲧⲏⲥ ϫⲉⲉϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲟⲩⲛⲧⲏⲧⲛ ⲡⲓⲥⲧⲓⲥ ⲙⲙⲁⲩ · ⲛⲁⲡϣⲁⲩ ⲛⲟⲩⲃⲗⲃⲓⲗⲉ ⲛϣⲗⲧⲁⲙ ⲧⲉⲧⲛⲁϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲧⲟⲟⲩ ϫⲉⲡⲱⲱⲛⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲓⲙⲁ ⲉⲡⲁⲓ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛϥⲡⲱⲱⲛⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲙⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲣⲁⲧϭⲟⲙ ⲛⲏⲧⲛ ·
Translation: And again He spake unto the disciples, saying, 'If ye have faith as large as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove thyself from this place to that, and it shall remove itself, and there is nothing which shall be impossible for you.'

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲟⲛ ϫⲉⲧⲉⲧⲛⲁϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲛϯⲛⲱϩⲉ ϫⲉⲡⲱⲣⲕ ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲱϭⲉ ϩⲛⲧϩⲁⲗⲗⲁⲥⲁ ⲛⲥⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲛⲏⲧⲛ ·
Translation: And again, if ye shall say to a sycamore tree. Separate thyself (from) the earth, and plant thyself in the sea, it shall hearken unto you.'

Verse: ⲁⲩϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ · ⲉⲧⲃⲏⲏⲧϥ ⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ · ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲉⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ · ϫⲉⲁⲥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲉϥⲟ ⲛⲕⲟⲩⲓ · ⲉϥⲙⲟⲟⲛⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲥⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲁⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲟⲩⲱⲛ ⲛⲛⲉϥⲃⲁⲗ · ⲁϥⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲩⲥⲧⲩⲗⲗⲟⲥ ⲛⲕⲱϩⲧ ϩⲓⲧϩⲏ ⲙⲙⲟϥ
Translation: And moreover, it is said concerning the holy man Apa Pisentius, that it came to pass on a time when he was young, while he was pasturing his father's sheep, that God opened his eyes, and he saw a pillar of fire in front of him.

Verse: ⲛⲉⲩⲛϩⲉⲛⲕⲉϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲇⲉ ϣⲏⲙ · ⲙⲟⲟⲛⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ ⲡⲉ ·
Translation: Now there were certain other young men who were pasturing sheep with him.

Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ
Translation: And he said unto the other young men who were pasturing sheep with him, 'Do ye see the pillar of fire on the road in front of us?'

Verse: ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲓ ϣⲁⲣⲟϥ ϫⲓⲛⲧⲉϥⲙⲛⲧⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲉϥⲥⲱⲧⲡ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲥⲁⲙⲟⲩⲏⲗ ⲛⲧⲁⲧⲉϥⲙⲁⲁⲩ ⲧⲁⲁϥ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲉⲥⲉⲣⲏⲧ ⲉⲡⲣⲡⲉ ⲙⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲧⲁϥϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲛϭⲓⲡϩⲓⲉⲣⲟⲯⲁⲗⲧⲏⲥ ⲇⲁⲩⲉⲓⲇ ϫⲉⲙⲱⲩⲥⲏⲥ ⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲙⲛⲁⲁⲣⲱⲛ ϩⲛⲛⲉϥⲟⲩⲏⲏⲃ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲥⲁⲙⲟⲩⲏⲗ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲧⲉⲡⲓⲕⲁⲗⲉⲓ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲣⲁⲛ ·
Translation: Now since God came unto Apa Pisentius when he was a young man, He chose him even as He did Samuel, whose mother had given him to the temple of God according to her vow, even as the holy Psalmist saith, 'Moses, the holy man, and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among those who called upon His Name.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱϣ
Translation: They cried out to God, and He heard them, and He spake unto them out of the pillar of cloud, and they kept His testimonies, and the ordinances which He had given unto them.

Verse: ⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲇⲉ ϩⲱⲱϥ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲁϥϫⲓ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲕⲉⲗⲱⲗ
Translation: Then the holy man Apa Pisentius himself took his water-pot to fill it with water, for it was the time for filling (the water-pots with) water.

Verse: ⲉⲧⲓ ⲉϥⲛⲁⲙⲟⲩϩⲡⲉϥⲕⲉⲗⲱⲗ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲧⲁϥϩⲟⲙⲟⲗⲟⲅⲉⲓ ⲛⲁⲛ · ϩⲛⲧⲉϥⲧⲁⲡⲣⲟ · ⲉϥⲣⲙⲛⲧⲣⲉ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲁϥϫⲓⲧϥ ϭⲉ ⲁϥⲧⲁⲁϥ ⲙⲡⲥⲟⲛ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲛⲁϥ · ϫⲉⲁⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ϫⲉⲕⲡⲉⲕⲁⲓⲧⲏⲙⲁ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: And whilst Apa Pisentius was filling his water-pot, according to what he confessed to us with his own mouth, and testified to us, he I captured the fish, and (when) he gave it to the brother he said unto him, 'God hath fulfilled thy petition

Verse: ⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁϥⲧⲛⲛⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲁⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲛ ⲛⲇⲁⲛⲓⲏⲗ ⲛϥϭⲱϣⲧ ϩⲏⲧϥ ⲁⲛ ·
Translation: it was He Who sent the meal to Daniel, for which his heart waited.

Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ϫⲉⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲟⲛ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲥⲃⲧⲉⲡⲧⲃⲧ ⲛⲁⲕ · ⲙⲡϩⲟⲟⲩ ϩⲙⲡⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϣ · ⲉⲡⲉⲓⲇⲏ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲕⲁⲁⲕ ⲉⲗⲩⲡⲏ · ϩⲙⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁⲕⲁⲓⲧⲉⲓ ⲙⲙⲟϥ · ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ ·
Translation: He said, 'It is He moreover Who hath prepared the fish for thee this day by His wish, inasmuch as He would not allow thee to suffer grief in respect of that for which thou didst ask at His hand.

Verse: ⲁⲗⲏⲑⲟⲥ ⲕⲁⲗⲱⲥ ⲁϥϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲉⲡⲣⲟⲫⲏⲧⲏⲥ ϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϩⲏⲛ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲟⲩⲟⲛ ⲛⲓⲙ · ⲉⲧⲱϣ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Well and truly doth the Prophet say, God is nigh unto every one, and He directeth him in truth.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ϥⲛⲁⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲡⲉⲩⲥⲟⲡⲥⲡ ⲛϥⲧⲟⲩϫⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: And He will hearken unto their supplications, and will deliver them.

Verse: ⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲛⲁϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ⲉⲟⲩⲟⲛ ⲉⲧⲙⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⁛—
Translation: God shall guard every one who loveth Him.'

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲛϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲙⲡⲓⲥⲣⲁⲏⲗ ⲧⲱⲟⲩⲛ ⲉϫⲙⲙⲱⲩⲥⲏⲥ · ⲙⲛⲁⲁⲣⲱⲛ ⲡⲉϫⲁⲩ ⲛⲁϥ ϫⲉⲟⲩ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲁⲕⲁⲁϥ ⲛⲁⲛ ·
Translation: When the children of Israel had risen up against Moses and Aaron, they said unto him, 'What is this that thou hast done with us?'

Verse: ⲁⲕⲛⲧⲛ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ϩⲙⲡⲕⲁϩ ⲛⲕⲏⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Thou hast brought us forth from the land of Egypt.

Verse: ⲉⲛϩⲙⲟⲟⲥ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲛⲛⲉⲭⲁⲗⲕⲓⲟⲛ ⲛⲁⲁϥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲛⲟⲩⲉⲙⲟⲉⲓⲕ · ⲉⲩⲥⲉⲓ ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ⲙⲁⲛⲁⲛ ⲛϩⲉⲛⲟⲉⲓⲕ ⲙⲛϩⲉⲛⲁⲁϥ ·
Translation: We used to sit down by the brazen pots of flesh, and we ate bread, and now the people have to be satisfied with manna instead of with loaves of bread and pieces of flesh.

Verse: ⲉϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲛ ⲧⲛⲛⲁϩⲓⲱⲛⲉ ⲉⲣⲱⲧⲛ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁⲥϫⲟⲟⲥ · ⲛϭⲓⲧⲥⲩⲛⲁⲅⲱⲅⲏ ⲧⲏⲣⲥ ⲉϩⲓⲱⲛⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: If not (i. e. if thou dost not give us bread and flesh) we will stone you. And the whole congregation spake the word to stone them.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲙⲱⲩⲥⲏⲥ ⲁϥϫⲓϣⲕⲁⲕ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲉⲓⲛⲁϩⲉ ⲉⲁϥⲧⲱⲛ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲗⲁⲟⲥ ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲩⲟⲩⲱⲙ ·
Translation: And Moses cried out to God, saying, ' O God, where shall I find the wherewithal to give unto this people so that they may eat?

Verse: ⲉⲧⲓ ⲕⲉⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲥⲉϩⲓⲱⲛⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲓ ·
Translation: Only a very little more and they will stone me.'

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲙⲙⲱⲩⲥⲏⲥ ϫⲉⲁⲓⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲡⲉⲕⲣⲙⲣⲙ ⲛⲛϣⲏⲣⲉ
Translation: And God spake unto Moses, saying, 'I have heard the murmurings which the children of Israel have made against you.

Verse: ⲁⲧⲉⲧⲛⲉⲓⲙⲉ ϭⲉ ⲱ ⲛⲁⲙⲉⲣⲁⲁⲧⲉ ϫⲉⲡⲥⲟⲡⲥⲡ ⲙⲡⲇⲓⲕⲁⲓⲟⲥ ϭⲙϭⲟⲙ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥⲉⲛⲣⲅⲉⲓ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲉⲧⲥⲏϩ ·
Translation: Ye must know, therefore, O my beloved, that the supplication of the righteous man is exceedingly powerful, and it effecteth much, even as it is written.

Verse: ⲙⲱⲩⲥⲏⲥ ⲙⲉⲛ ⲡⲛⲟⲙⲟⲑⲉⲧⲏⲥ ⲛⲧⲡⲁⲗⲁⲓⲁ ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲉⲡⲓⲕⲁⲗⲉⲓ ⲙⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ · ⲁϥⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϣ ⁛
Translation: Now as concerneth Moses, the Lawgiver of the Old Covenant, immediately that he cried out to God concerning the multitude (of the Israelites), God did according to his wish.

Verse: ⲡⲛⲟⲙⲟⲑⲉⲧⲏⲥ ⲇⲉ ϩⲱⲱϥ ⲛⲧⲇⲓⲁⲑⲏⲕⲏ ⲛⲃⲣⲣⲉ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ ·
Translation: So also was it in the case of the Lawgiver of the New Covenant, Apa Pisentius.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲥⲡⲥⲡⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲥⲟⲛ ⲙⲙⲟⲛⲁⲭⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲗⲩⲡⲏ ⲙⲙⲟϥ · ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲁϥϫⲉⲕⲡⲉϥⲁⲓⲧⲏⲙⲁ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲧϩⲉ ⲉⲧⲥⲏϩ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲯⲁⲗⲙⲟⲥ · ϫⲉⲉⲣⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϫⲱⲕ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲛⲉⲕⲁⲓⲧⲏⲙⲁ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⁛—
Translation: Immediately he made supplication to God on behalf of the brother who was a monk, God did not cause him grief, but fulfilled his petition, even according to that which is written in the Psalm, 'The Lord shall fulfil all thy petitions,'

Verse: ⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲉϯⲕⲉⲛⲟϭ ⲛϣⲡⲏⲣⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲓⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ ⲙⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲉϥⲟ ⲙⲙⲟⲛⲁⲭⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲁⲧϥⲣⲉⲡⲓⲥⲕⲟⲡⲟⲥ
Translation: Hearken moreover to the account of another great and wonderful thing which took place through the holy man Apa Pisentius, when he was a monk, and before he became a bishop.

Verse: ⲁϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲛⲟⲩϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲉϫⲛⲧϣⲱⲱⲧⲉ ⲉⲧⲉⲣⲉⲛⲉⲥⲛⲏⲩ ⲥⲉⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲛϩⲏⲧⲥ ϫⲉⲉϥⲛⲁⲙⲉϩⲡⲉϥⲕⲉⲗⲱⲗ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: It came to pass on a certain day that he went to the well at which the brethren were in the habit of drinking, in order that he might fill his water-pot.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲉϫⲛⲧϣⲱⲱⲧⲉ ⲁϥⲣⲡⲱⲃϣ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩϩ ⲙⲛⲧⲃⲏⲥⲉ ⲙⲡϥϥⲓⲧⲟⲩ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ ·
Translation: Now when he had come to the mouth of the well, he (found that he) had forgotten the rope and the leather bucket, and had not brought them with him.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣϥⲁⲁϩ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲣⲁⲧϥ ⲉϫⲛⲧϣⲱⲱⲧⲉ ⲁϥϣⲗⲏⲗ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲉⲑⲟⲥ ⲛⲛⲉⲥⲛⲏⲩ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ϫⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲛⲧⲟⲕ ⲉⲧⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ϫⲉⲙⲛϣϭⲟⲙ ⲙⲙⲟⲓ ⲉⲧⲣⲁⲕⲧⲟⲓ · ⲛⲕⲉⲥⲟⲡ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲧϩⲉⲛⲉⲉⲧⲉ · ⲉϫⲓ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩϩ
Translation: And when he had stood up at the mouth of the well he prayed to God according to the custom of the brethren, and he said, 'God, Thou knowest well that it is impossible for me to turn back again into the monastery to fetch the rope.

Verse: ⲉⲕⲉⲟⲩⲉϩⲥⲁϩⲛⲉ ϭⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲛϥⲉⲓ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ϣⲁⲣⲟⲓ ⲛⲧⲁϭⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲩϩ ⲙⲡⲁⲕⲉⲗⲱⲗ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ϫⲉⲕⲁⲥ ⲉⲓⲛⲁⲣϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲙⲡⲥⲉⲉⲡⲉ ⲛⲛⲁϩⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: But do Thou command this water to rise up to where I am so that I may be able to fill my water-pot therewith, so that I may serve Thee for the remainder of my days.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲟⲕ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲁⲕⲟⲩⲉϩⲥⲁϩⲛⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲁⲡⲟⲥⲧⲟⲗⲟⲥ ⲡⲉⲧⲣⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲙⲡⲙⲟⲩ ·
Translation: For Thou didst command Thy Apostle Peter, saying, Walk on the water

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥϫⲱⲕ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲉϣⲗⲏⲗ ⲁⲡⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ · ⲉⲡϫⲓⲥⲉ ϣⲁⲛⲧϥⲉⲓ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲣⲱⲥ
Translation: Now when he had finished his prayer, the water rose in the well until it reached the mouth of the well, and he filled his water-pot with water.

Verse: ⲉⲧⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲥⲉⲕ ⲉⲡⲉⲥⲏⲧ ⲁⲩϣⲱⲥ · ⲉϥⲙⲟⲟⲛⲉ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲟϩⲉ ⲛⲉⲥⲟⲟⲩ ϩⲙⲡϣⲟⲛⲧⲉ ϯⲡⲉϥⲟⲩⲟⲓ ⲉⲣⲛⲧⲧⲁⲡⲣⲟ ⲛⲧϣⲱⲧⲉ ⲁϥⲑⲉⲱⲣⲉⲓ ⲙⲡⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⲉϥⲕⲱⲧⲉ ⲉϥⲕⲱⲧⲉ ϩⲛⲧϣⲱⲧⲉ ϣⲁⲛⲧϥⲃⲱⲕ ⲉⲡⲉⲥⲏⲧ ⲉⲡⲉϥⲙⲁ ·
Translation: Now whilst the water was sinking downwards, a certain shepherd, who was pasturing his flock of sheep among the thorn bushes, directed his steps to the mouth of the well, and he looked in, and he saw the water going down by degrees until it reached its place at the bottom.

Verse: ⲉⲓⲛⲁⲧⲛⲧⲱⲛⲅ ⲉⲛⲓⲙ ⲱ ⲡⲙⲁⲕⲁⲣⲓⲟⲥ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Unto whom shall I liken thee, O blessed Apa Pisentius?

Verse: ⲁⲗⲏⲑⲱⲥ ⲉⲕⲧⲛⲧⲱⲛ ⲉⲙⲱⲩⲥⲏⲥ ⲡⲛⲟⲙⲟⲑⲉⲧⲏⲥ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲧⲣⲉⲑⲁⲗⲗⲁⲥⲁ ⲡⲱⲣϫ ⲉⲡⲉⲓⲥⲁ ⲙⲛⲡⲁⲓ · ⲁⲛϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲙⲡⲓⲥⲣⲁⲏⲗ ⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲛϩⲏⲧⲥ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲡⲉⲧϣⲟⲩⲱⲟⲩ ·
Translation: Verily thou art like unto Moses, the Lawgiver, who made the sea to be divided, one half being on this side, and the other on that, and the children of Israel walked in the midst thereof as upon dry ground

Verse: ⲉⲁⲡⲙⲟⲟⲩ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲁⲩ ⲛⲥⲟⲃⲧ ϩⲙⲡⲓⲥⲁ ⲙⲛⲡⲁⲓ ⲛⲥⲁⲟⲩⲛⲁⲙ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲥⲁϩⲃⲟⲩⲣ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: and the water was to them a wall of water on this side and on that, on the right hand and on the left.

Verse: ⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁϥϣⲁϫⲉ ⲙⲛⲧⲡⲉⲧⲣⲁ · ⲁⲥⲧⲁⲩⲟ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛϩⲉⲛⲟⲑⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ ⁛—
Translation: It was Moses who spake to the rock, and it sent forth fountains of water.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲟⲕ ⲇⲉ ϩⲱⲱⲕ ⲱ ⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲁⲡⲉⲕϣⲗⲏⲗ ⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ϣⲁⲧϩⲁⲯⲓⲥ ⲛⲧⲡⲉ · ⲁⲥϫⲱⲕ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛϭⲓⲧⲉⲅⲣⲁⲫⲏ ⲉⲧϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ · ϫⲉⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲧⲁϥϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲁⲩϣⲱⲡⲉ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲧⲁϥϩⲱⲛ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁⲩⲥⲱⲛⲧ ·
Translation: And as for thee, O holy man Apa Pisentius, thy prayer entered into the vault of heaven, and it fulfilled the Scripture, which saith, 'It was He Who spake, and they came into being; it was He Who commanded, and they were created

Verse: ⲁⲕϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲑⲉⲱⲣⲓⲕⲟⲥ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲡⲣⲟⲫⲏⲧⲏⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲛⲟⲉⲣⲟⲥ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲛⲁⲡⲟⲥⲧⲟⲗⲟⲥ · ⲁⲕϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲟⲓⲕⲟⲛⲟⲙⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ
Translation: Thou wast a man of foresight like unto the Prophets, and a man of intellect like unto the Apostles, and thou wast a wise steward.

Verse: ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲁⲓ ⲁⲕⲙⲡϣⲁ ⲛⲧⲉⲕⲕⲗⲏⲥⲓⲁ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ·
Translation: Therefore wast thou worthy of the Church of the Saints.

Verse: ⲁⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲧⲁⲛϩⲟⲩⲧⲕ ⲉⲩⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ ⲙⲯⲩⲭⲏ ·
Translation: God made thee to keep alive a multitude of souls.

Verse: ⲁⲕⲉⲩⲁⲅⲅⲉⲗⲓⲍⲉ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲙⲡⲁⲩⲗⲟⲥ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉⲕⲧⲁϣⲉⲟⲉⲓϣ · ϩⲛⲧⲉⲕⲥⲟⲫⲓⲁ ⲛⲧⲡⲓⲥⲧⲓⲥ ⲛⲟⲣⲑⲟⲇⲟⲝⲟⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉⲕϫⲓϣⲕⲁⲕ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲕⲗⲟⲅⲟⲥ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲕⲩⲣⲓⲝ ⲉⲕⲱϣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲕⲥⲟⲫⲓⲁ ⁛— ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲥⲁⲗⲡⲓⲅⲝ ⁛
Translation: Thou didst preach the Gospel like Paul, and thou didst preach in wisdom the orthodox Faith. And thou didst cry out in thy discourse like a herald, thou didst shout aloud in thy wisdom like a trumpet.

Verse: ⲛⲓⲙ ⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁϣⲧⲁⲓⲟⲕ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲉⲕⲙⲡϣⲁ · ⲱ ⲡⲇⲓⲕⲁⲓⲟⲥ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ
Translation: Who is able to pay unto thee the honour of which thou art worthy, O just and holy man?

Verse: ϣⲁⲕⲉⲓⲙⲉ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲉⲛⲉϩⲏⲡ ϩⲁⲧϩⲏ ⲙⲡⲁⲧⲟⲩϣⲱⲡⲉ ⁛—
Translation: For thou didst know the things which were hidden before they took place.

Verse: ⲛⲉⲕϣⲁϫⲉ ⲙⲛⲛⲕⲟⲥⲙⲓⲕⲟⲛ ϩⲛϩⲉⲛⲱⲇⲏ ⲙⲛϩⲉⲛⲡⲁⲣⲁⲃⲟⲗⲏ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉⲕϣⲁϫⲉ ⲙⲛⲙⲙⲱⲛⲁⲭⲟⲥ ϩⲛϩⲉⲛⲃⲱⲗ ⲙⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁⲧⲓⲕⲟⲛ ·
Translation: Thy discourse which appertained to the things of this world had therein songs and parables ; thy discourse which appertained to the monkish estate (was full of) spiritual explanations.

Verse: ⲛⲉⲕϣⲁϫⲉ ⲡⲉ ⲙⲛⲛⲁⲣⲭⲱⲛ · ϩⲛϩⲉⲛⲡⲁⲣⲁⲡⲟⲗⲏ · ⲁⲩⲱ ϩⲛϩⲉⲛⲙⲩⲥⲧⲏⲣⲓⲟⲛ ·
Translation: Thy words were those of a ruler, parables and mysteries.

Verse: ⲉⲙⲉⲕϣⲓⲡⲉ ϩⲏⲧϥ ⲛⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ
Translation: Thou didst never feel ashamed because of them before any man, according to that which is written, 'My words shall be testimonies concerning Thee before kings, I shall not be ashamed.'

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲛϩⲁϩ ⲛϩⲏⲕⲉ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲛⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲛⲛⲟⲣⲫⲁⲛⲟⲥ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲛϩⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: Thou wast a father to multitudes of the poor in our time, and the father of those who were orphans in our days.

Verse: ⲛⲉⲕⲕⲩⲣⲓⲍⲉ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲉⲓⲣⲏⲛⲏ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲙⲡⲟⲩⲉ · ⲱ ⲡⲙⲁⲓⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ
Translation: Thou didst proclaim like a herald peace unto those who were afar off, O thou God-loving father, Apa Pisentius.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉⲕⲅⲩⲙⲛⲁⲍⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲓϩⲏⲛ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲥⲃⲱ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲟϫ ·
Translation: And thou didst exercise (or, train) those who drew nigh unto thee in the doctrine which was sound.

Verse: ⲁⲕϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲁⲕⲟⲣⲁⲓⲟⲥ · ⲙⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁⲧⲓⲕⲟⲛ · ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲁⲓ ⲛⲅⲭⲁⲣⲓⲍⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲕⲁⲅⲁⲑⲟⲛ · ⲛⲟⲩⲟⲛ ⲛⲓⲙ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲟⲩⲣⲟⲧ ·
Translation: Thou wast a well-skilled spiritual merchant, and therefore thou didst bestow graciously thy good gifts upon every one with great gladness and readiness.

Verse: ⲁⲕϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲁⲕϭⲓⲛⲉ ⲱ ⲡⲙⲁⲓⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲛⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲉⲥⲩⲛⲑⲓⲟⲥ ⲡⲁⲕⲉⲗⲁⲣⲭⲏⲥ ⲛⲧⲁⲗⲏⲑⲉⲓⲁ ·
Translation: Thou didst seek and thou didst find, O God-loving father, Apa Pisentius, thou leader of the truth.

Verse: ⲁⲕⲧⲱϩⲙ ⲁⲩⲟⲩⲱⲛ ⲛⲁⲕ · ⲁⲕⲁⲓⲧⲉⲓ
Translation: Thou didst knock and it was opened unto thee ; thou didst petition God, and He granted thee all thy petitions.

Verse: ⲛⲉⲩⲉⲡⲓⲑⲩⲙⲉⲓ ⲉⲛⲉⲕⲗⲟⲅⲟⲥ ⲛϭⲓⲛⲁⲣⲭⲱⲛ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲉⲩϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲛⲥⲁⲛⲉⲕⲙⲩⲥⲧⲏⲣⲓⲟⲛ ⲛϭⲓⲛⲉⲡⲣⲟⲥⲏⲗⲓⲧⲟⲥ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ·
Translation: The Governors desired eagerly (to hear) thy discourse, and all the proselytes sought eagerly after thy mysteries.

Verse: ⲁⲕⲑⲉⲱⲣⲉⲓ ⲙⲡⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲉⲁⲛⲁⲧⲟⲗⲏⲥ
Translation: Thou didst look upon (?) the man whose name was Anatoles.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲙⲉⲕⲙⲟⲕⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲩⲉⲣⲏⲩ ⲉⲩϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ · ϫⲉⲛⲓⲙ ⲁⲣⲁ ⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲉϩⲥⲁϩⲛⲉ ⲛⲁϥ ⲙⲏ ⲟⲩⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲡⲉ ·
Translation: And they debated the matter together, saying, 'Who then is there that can command him (to accept)? It is not a man'

Verse: ⲁⲩϣⲟϫⲛⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲩⲉⲣⲏⲩ ϫⲉⲙⲁⲣⲛⲧⲁⲩⲟ ⲉⲡϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲕⲟⲗⲗⲟⲑⲟⲥ ⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲡⲣⲱⲙⲉ · ϥⲛⲁϭⲉⲗⲡⲡϣⲁϫⲉ ⲉⲣⲟϥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ϥⲛⲁϩⲡⲫⲱⲃ ⲉⲣⲟϥ
Translation: Then they took counsel together, saying, 'Let us relate the matter to the holy man Apa Colluthus, who is a great one among men; he shall reveal the matter to him (in its true light), and he will not hide the business from him'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲱ ⲡⲣⲱⲙⲉ ϭⲉⲡⲏ ⲡⲱⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲃⲉ ⲛⲅⲣⲡⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲙⲟⲩ ·
Translation: O man, flee quickly from sin, and remember death immediately.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϥⲥⲏϩ ⲅⲁⲣ ϫⲉϣⲁⲣⲉⲡⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛϩⲁⲕ ⲑⲙⲕⲉⲡⲛⲟⲃⲉ · ⲁⲩⲱ ϫⲉⲡϩⲟ ⲛⲛⲁⲥⲕⲏⲧⲏⲥ ⲛⲁⲣⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲙⲡⲣⲏ ·
Translation: For it is written, 'A wise man suppresseth sin, and the face of the ascetic shall shine like the sun.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲣⲓⲡⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲙⲙⲱⲩⲥⲏⲥ · ϫⲉⲁϥⲥⲟⲧⲡⲥ ⲛⲁϥ · ⲉϣⲡϩⲓⲥⲉ ⲙⲛⲡⲗⲁⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ
Translation: Moreover, remember Moses, who chose to suffer with the people of God rather than to enjoy the I pleasures of sin for a time.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲕϣⲁⲛⲙⲉⲣⲉⲡϩⲓⲥⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ·
Translation: If thou lovest the suffering of the saints, they will make themselves to be companions of thine, and they will minister on thy behalf before God.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛϥϯ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛⲁⲓⲧⲏⲙⲁ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩϥ
Translation: And He will grant thee every good thing for which thou dost petition, because thou hast taken up thy cross, and hast followed thy Lord.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲡⲱⲧ ⲛⲥⲁⲟⲩⲕⲁⲑⲉⲇⲣⲁ · ⲛⲉⲟⲟⲩ
