Translation: Do not seek after a seat of glory among men, so that God may shelter thee from the blast of the storm of which thou knowest nothing, and may apportion thee a seat in His metropolis, Jerusalem of heaven.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲇⲟⲕⲓⲙⲁⲍⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲛϩⲱⲃ ⲛⲓⲙ ·
Translation: Test everything.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲙⲁϩⲧⲉ ⲙⲡⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩϥ
Translation: Lay hold upon that which is good. Similarly, do not treat with contempt the image of God.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ⲟⲛ ⲉⲧⲉⲕⲙⲛⲧϣⲏⲣⲉ
Translation: Moreover, keep diligently thy youth with all care, in order that thou mayest be able to keep diligently thine old age with all care, lest thou be put to shame, and thou come to an end in the Valley of Jehoshaphat.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲥⲱⲛⲧ ⲧⲏⲣϥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲁⲩ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ · ⲛⲥⲉⲛⲉϭⲛⲟⲩϭⲕ · ⲉⲩϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ·
Translation: The whole creation of God shall look upon thee, and they shall revile thee, saying,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϫⲉⲛⲉⲛⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲙⲙⲏⲛⲉ ϫⲉⲛⲧⲕⲟⲩⲉⲥⲟⲟⲩ · ⲁⲛϩⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲛⲟⲩⲱⲛϣ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲙⲁ · ⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ⲉⲡϣⲓⲕ ⲛⲁⲙⲛⲧⲉ · ⲛⲟϫⲕ ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϩⲙⲡϩⲏⲧ ⲙⲡⲕⲁϩ ·
Translation: We used to think about thee every day, and believe that thou wast a sheep, but we find thee to be a wolf in this place. Get thee gone now into the pit of Amente, cast thyself down now into the heart of the earth.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲱ ⲡⲉⲓⲛⲟϭ ⲛϣⲓⲡⲉ · ⲛϯϭⲟⲧ ⲉⲕⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ϩⲙⲡⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ · ⲉⲩϯⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲁⲕ ϫⲉⲛⲧⲕⲟⲩⲥⲱⲧⲡ · ⲙⲡⲛⲁⲩ ⲇⲉ ϩⲱⲱϥ ⲛⲧⲁⲕⲉⲓ ⲉⲡⲉⲓⲁ ⲛⲓⲱⲥⲁⲫⲁⲧ · ⲡⲙⲁ ⲙⲡϩⲁⲡ ⲁⲩϩⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲉⲕⲕⲏⲕⲁϩⲏⲩ ·
Translation: O what great shame! Whilst thou didst walk in the world men gave glory to thee thinking that thou wast a man of moral excellence; the moment, however, that thou comest to the Valley of Jehoshaphat, the place of judgement, thou art found to be naked.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲣⲉⲟⲩⲟⲛ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲑⲉⲱⲣⲉⲓ ⲛⲛⲉⲕⲛⲟⲃⲉ · ⲙⲛⲧⲉⲕⲁⲥⲭⲩⲙⲟⲥⲩⲛⲏ ⲉⲧϭⲟⲗⲡ ⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲙⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ·
Translation: And every one looketh upon thy sins, and upon thy shame which is revealed to God and man.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲟⲩⲟⲓ ⲛⲁⲕ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ · ⲉⲕⲛⲁⲕⲧⲉⲡⲉⲕϩⲟ ⲉⲧⲱⲛ ·
Translation: Woe be unto thee in that hour! Whither wilt thou turn thy face?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲏ ⲉⲕⲛⲁⲟⲩⲱⲛ ⲛⲣⲱⲕ ⲛⲅϫⲟⲟⲥ ϫⲉⲟⲩ ⲛⲉⲕⲛⲟⲃⲉ ⲧⲟⲟⲃⲉ ⲉⲧⲉⲕⲯⲩⲭⲏ · ⲉⲥⲕⲏⲙ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩϭⲟⲟⲩⲛⲉ ·
Translation: Or, supposing that thou canst open thy mouth, what wilt thou say? Thy sins have sealed thy soul, which is black like unto sackcloth.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲟⲩ ⲡⲉⲧⲕⲛⲁⲁϥ ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ · ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ · ⲉⲕⲣⲓⲙⲉ · ⲛⲥⲉⲛⲁϫⲓⲣⲓⲙⲉ ⲁⲛ ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲧⲕ · ⲉⲕⲥⲟⲡⲥⲡ ⲛⲥⲉⲛⲁϫⲓⲥⲟⲡⲥⲡ ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲧⲕ ⲁⲛ · ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉϩⲉⲛⲁⲧⲛⲁ ⲛⲉ ⲛⲉⲛⲧⲁⲩⲧⲁⲁⲕ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧⲟⲩ ·
Translation: What wilt thou do in that hour? Thou wilt weep, but they will not accept weeping from thee. Thou wilt make supplication, but they will not accept supplication from thee because the beings into whose hands thou shalt be given are merciless.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲱ ⲟⲩⲟⲓ ⲙⲡⲛⲁⲩⲉⲧⲉⲕⲛⲁⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲧⲉⲥⲙⲏ ⲛϩⲟⲧⲉ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲧϣⲱⲱⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ · ϫⲉⲙⲁⲣⲉⲛⲣⲉϥⲣⲛⲟⲃⲉ ⲕⲟⲧⲟⲩ ⲉⲁⲙⲛⲧⲉ ·
Translation: O woe be unto thee in that hour wherein thou shalt hear that terrible voice which shall give judgement, saying, 'Let the sinners return to Amente.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲟⲛ ϫⲉⲥⲁϩⲉⲧⲏⲩⲧⲛ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲙⲟⲓ · ⲛⲉⲧⲥϩⲟⲩⲟⲣⲧ ⲉⲧⲥⲁⲧⲉ ⲛϣⲁⲉⲛⲉϩ ⲛⲧⲁⲩⲥⲃⲧⲱⲧⲥ ⲙⲡⲇⲓⲁⲃⲟⲗⲟⲥ ⲙⲛⲛⲉϥⲁⲅⲅⲉⲗⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And again, 'Depart ye from Me, O ye accursed, into the everlasting fire which hath been prepared for the Devil and his angels.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲟⲛ ϫⲉⲛⲉⲧⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲛⲙⲡⲁⲣⲁⲃⲁⲥⲓⲥ ⲁⲓⲙⲉⲥⲧⲱⲟⲩ ⲉⲧⲣⲁϥⲱⲧⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲛⲧⲡⲟⲗⲓⲥ ⲙⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁⲛⲟⲙⲓⲁ :—
Translation: And again, 'Those who commit transgressions, and all those who work iniquity, do I hate, and I will destroy them out of the city of God'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϭⲉ ⲡⲁϣⲏⲣⲉ · ⲭⲣⲱ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲧⲥⲧⲟ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ · ⲉⲕⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲁⲧⲟⲡⲕ ·
Translation: Now therefore, O my son, make use of this world, but despise it as thou doest so, and walk therein holding it to be a thing of no account.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲕⲟⲩⲏϩ ⲛⲥⲁⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϩⲛϩⲱⲃ ⲛⲓⲙ · ϫⲉⲉⲕⲉⲣⲉ ⲉⲩⲡⲁⲣⲣⲏⲥⲓⲁ
Translation: Follow thou the Lord in everything, and thou shalt find boldness of speech in the Valley of Jehoshaphat.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲡⲱⲧ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲛⲥⲁⲣⲝ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉⲉⲣϣⲁⲛⲡⲱⲛⲉ ϩⲓϩⲓⲡⲗⲉⲉⲓⲛ · ϣⲁⲣⲉⲡⲕⲱϩⲧ ⲙⲟⲩϩ · ⲛϥⲣⲉⲕϩⲟⲩⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ ⲛϩⲩⲗⲏ ·
Translation: Flee not unto any being of flesh whatsoever, because when the stone striketh upon the fire breaketh out, and it burneth up very much substance.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲱⲧ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲛⲛⲁⲩ ⲛⲓⲙ · ⲛⲅϩⲙⲟⲟⲥ ϩⲁⲧⲉϥϩⲁⲓⲃⲉⲥ · ϫⲉⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲏϩ ϩⲛⲧⲃⲟⲏⲑⲓⲁ ⲙⲡⲡⲉⲧϫⲟⲥⲉ · ϥⲛⲁϣⲱⲡⲉ ϩⲁⲧϩⲁⲓⲃⲉⲥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲧⲡⲉ · ⲛϥⲛⲁⲕⲓⲙ ⲁⲛ ϣⲁⲉⲛⲉϩ ·
Translation: Flee thou to the Lord at every hour, sit thou down in the shadow of Him, for he who abideth in the help of the Most High shall be under the shadow of the God of heaven, and he shall never be moved.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲣⲓⲡⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ⲙⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲧϩⲓⲉⲗⲏⲙ ⲛⲧⲡⲉ · ⲙⲁⲣⲉⲥⲁⲗⲉ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲙⲡⲉⲕϩⲏⲧ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲕⲛⲁϣⲱⲡⲉ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲡⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲟⲗⲕ ·
Translation: Remember thou the Lord and the Jerusalem of heaven; let (the memorial thereof) go up in thy heart, and thou shalt be under the blessing of heaven, and the glory of God shall support thee.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϩⲛϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ⲛⲓⲙ ϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ⲉⲡⲉⲕⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲕϩⲏⲧ ·
Translation: Keep thou thy body and thy heart with the greatest diligence.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲱⲧ
Translation: Follow after peace and humility, and if these are bound together (in thee) they will make thee to see God.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϥⲥⲏϩ ⲅⲁⲣ ϫⲉϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲛⲥⲁϯⲣⲏⲛⲏ ⲙⲛⲡⲧⲃⲃⲟ · ϫⲉⲉⲩⲙⲏⲣ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲩⲉⲣⲏⲩ ·
Translation: For it is written, 'Seek after peace and purity, for they are bound together.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϥⲥⲏϩ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ϫⲉⲕⲁⲛ ⲉⲟⲩⲛⲧⲁⲓ ⲧⲡⲓⲥⲧⲓⲥ ⲧⲏⲣⲥ ϩⲱⲥⲧⲉ ⲉⲡⲉⲛⲉⲧⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: And again it is written, 'And even if I have all the faith, so that (I can) remove a mountain, without love of heart, I am benefited in nothing.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲱ ⲡⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲟⲩ ⲕⲱϩ ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲉϥϣⲟⲩⲉⲓⲧ ·
Translation: O man, wherefore art thou envious of the glory which is empty?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲏ ⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲙⲁⲓϩⲟⲙⲛⲧ · ⲏ ⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲛⲟϭ · ⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲁⲡϫⲁϫⲉ ⲙⲟⲣⲕ ⲉⲧⲃⲏⲏⲧⲟⲩ · ϫⲉⲁϥⲛⲁⲁⲕ · ⲛϣⲙⲙⲟ ⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: Or (why art thou) a lover of money, or (a lover) of magnificence, wherewith the Enemy bindeth thee in fetters, and maketh thee a stranger unto God?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁϣ ⲧⲉ ⲧⲉⲕⲁⲡⲟⲗⲟⲅⲓⲁ ⲉⲧⲕⲛⲁⲧⲁϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲉⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ · ϥⲛⲁϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲛⲁⲕ ϫⲉⲉⲫⲟⲥⲟⲛ ⲕⲙⲟⲥⲧⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲥⲟⲛ · ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ⲡⲉⲧⲉⲕⲙⲟⲥⲧⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲓ ·
Translation: What kind of apology wilt thou be able to make to the Christ when He shall say unto thee, 'Inasmuch as thou hatest thy brother, it is I Whom thou hatest?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲧⲟⲕ ⲇⲉ
Translation: And as for thee, thou shalt depart into the punishment which is for ever, for thou art an enemy of thy brother;

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲱ ⲛⲁⲙⲉⲣⲁⲧⲉ ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲡⲱⲧ ⲉⲣⲁⲧϥ ⲙⲡⲉⲩⲁⲅⲅⲉⲗⲓⲟⲛ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲙⲟⲥ ⲙⲙⲉ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲧⲛⲛⲁⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ · ϫⲉⲙⲡⲣⲧϭⲁⲓⲟ ϫⲉⲛⲛⲉⲩⲧϭⲁⲓⲉ ⲧⲏⲩⲧⲛ ·
Translation: O my beloved, let us flee to the feet of the Gospel of the True Law of God, the Christ, and let us hearken unto Him, saying, 'Condemn not, that ye be not condemned.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲕⲱ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲧⲁⲣⲟⲩⲕⲱ ⲛⲏⲧⲛ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: Forgive, that ye may be forgiven.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲕⲛⲁⲕⲱ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲁⲛ ⲛⲥⲉⲛⲁⲕⲱ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲁⲛ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲱⲱⲕ ·
Translation: If thou dost not forgive, they will not forgive thee.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲕⲛⲁⲙⲟⲩⲣ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲕⲥⲟⲛ · ⲥⲃⲧⲱⲧⲕ ⲉⲛⲕⲟⲗⲁⲥⲓⲥ · ϩⲁⲛⲉⲕⲡⲁⲣⲁⲡⲧⲱⲙⲁ · ϩⲁⲧⲉⲕⲡⲁⲣⲁⲃⲁⲥⲓⲥ · ⲛⲉⲕⲡⲟⲣⲛⲉⲓⲁ · ⲉⲧⲉⲕⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ · ⲛϫⲓⲟⲩⲉ ⲛⲉⲕϭⲟⲗ · ⲛⲉⲕϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛϣⲗⲟϥ ⲛⲉⲕⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ⲉⲧϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲉⲕⲙⲛⲧⲙⲁⲓϩⲟⲙⲛⲧ · ⲛⲉⲕⲡⲉⲧϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲧⲉⲕⲛⲁϯ ⲗⲟⲅⲟⲥ ϩⲁⲣⲟⲟⲩ · ϩⲙⲡⲃⲏⲙⲁ ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ·
Translation: If thou wilt bind thy brother, prepare thyself for punishment for thy slippings aside, and for thy transgressions, and for thy fornications which thou didst commit secretly, and thy thefts, and thy obscene words, and thy evil thoughts, and thine avariciousness, (and) the evil things which thou wilt have to explain before the throne of the Christ.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲥⲱⲛⲧ ⲧⲏⲣϥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲑⲉⲱⲣⲉⲓ ⲙⲙⲟⲕ · ⲉⲣⲉⲛⲁⲅⲅⲉⲗⲟⲥ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲙⲛⲧⲉⲥⲧⲣⲁϯⲁ ⲧⲏⲣⲥ ⲁϩⲉⲣⲁⲧⲟⲩ · ⲉⲣⲉⲛⲉⲩⲥⲏϥⲉ · ⲧⲟⲕⲙ ⲉⲩⲁⲛⲁⲅⲕⲁⲍⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲕ · ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲕⲁⲡⲟⲗⲟⲅⲓⲍⲉ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲅϩⲟⲙⲟⲗⲟⲅⲉⲓ ⲛⲛⲉⲕⲛⲟⲃⲉ ·
Translation: The whole of God's creation will be gazing at thee, all the angels, and all the hosts of heaven will be standing there, with their swords drawn, and they will compel thee to make excuses for and to confess thy sins.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉⲧⲉⲕϩⲃⲥⲱ ⲧⲏⲣⲥ ⲗⲁⲁⲙ · ⲉⲣⲉⲧⲉⲕⲧⲁⲡⲣⲟ ⲧⲏⲙ ⲉⲕⲟ ⲛϩⲃⲁ ⲉⲙⲛⲧⲁⲕϣⲁϫⲉ ⲙⲙⲁⲩ ⲉϫⲱ ⲉⲕⲛⲁϯⲗⲟⲅⲟⲥ ϩⲁⲟⲩⲏⲣ ·
Translation: Thine apparel shall be motley, thy mouth shall be shut, thou shalt be terrorstricken to such a degree that thou shalt be unable to speak or to explain.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲱ ⲡⲧⲁⲗⲉⲡⲱⲣⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲟⲣⲛⲉⲓⲁ ⲉⲧⲟϣ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲟ ⲛⲟⲩⲁ ⲙⲟⲟⲙⲉ · ⲉⲧⲉⲕⲯⲩⲭⲏ · ⲛⲉⲡⲓⲑⲩⲙⲓⲁ ⲛⲛⲃⲁⲗ ·
Translation: O wretched man, thy many fornications, which were the disease (?) of thy soul, and the lusts of the eye,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲙⲟⲕⲙⲕ ⲉⲧϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧϩⲟϫϩϫ ⲙⲡⲉⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁ · ⲉⲩϯⲗⲩⲡⲏ ⲛⲧⲉⲯⲩⲭⲏ ⲡϩⲉ ⲛⲧⲧⲁⲡⲣⲟ · ⲡⲗⲁⲥ ⲛⲣϥϫⲉⲛⲟϭ ⲛϣⲁϫⲉ · ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧϫⲱϩⲙ ⲙⲡⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲧⲏⲣϥ ·
Translation: and the evil cogitations which afflict the spirit and cause grief to the soul, and the slip in the speech (or, mouth), and the tongue which speaketh words of boasting and defileth the whole body,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲉⲗⲗⲏⲃ ⲛϫⲓ ϩⲣⲁϥⲉⲧϩⲟⲟⲩ · ⲛⲕⲁⲧⲁⲗⲁⲗⲓⲁ · ⲛⲕⲱϩ · ⲙⲙⲟⲥⲧⲉ ⲛⲉⲗⲕϣⲁ · ⲛⲕⲱⲙϣ ⲛⲥⲁⲧϩⲉⲓⲕⲱⲛ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: and the evil words of scurrility and indecency, and the gossipings which are inspired by envy and hatred, and the scoffings, and the derisive words about the image of God,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲧϭⲁⲓⲟ ⲛⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲛⲧϩⲏⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲁⲩϥⲟϭⲕ ⲛⲛⲁⲅⲁⲑⲟⲛ ⲙⲡⲡⲁⲣⲁⲇⲉⲓⲥⲟⲥ · ⲙⲡⲁⲑⲟⲥ ⲛϫⲓⲟⲩⲁ ⲉⲧⲟ ⲛϣⲗⲟϥ ⲉϫⲟⲟⲩ · ⲡⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ⲉⲧϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲧϩⲉⲓⲕⲱⲛ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: and the voluntary revilings (or, condemnations) which will deprive thee of the good things of Paradise, and the secret passions which it would be a disgrace to mention, the evil thought towards the image of God,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡϭⲱⲛⲧ ⲡϯⲧⲱⲛ
Translation: and the anger, and discord, and impudence, and arrogance, and the thoughts of the heart (which sprang) from wickedness, and the want of compassion, and ambition

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲏ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲛⲧⲟⲕ ϫⲉϣⲁⲣⲉⲧⲁⲅⲁⲡⲏ ϩⲱⲃⲥ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉϫⲛⲟⲩⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ ⲛⲛⲟⲃⲉ ·
Translation: Hast thou never heard that 'love covereth a multitude of sins'?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ϫⲉⲧⲁⲓ ⲧⲉ ⲧϩⲉ ⲉⲧⲉϥⲛⲁⲁⲥ ⲛⲏⲧⲛ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲉⲧⲛⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲉⲧϩⲛⲙⲡⲏⲩⲉ · ⲉⲧⲉⲧⲛⲧⲙⲕⲱ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲛⲉⲣⲏⲩ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲧⲛϩⲏⲧ ϥⲛⲁⲕⲱ ⲛⲏⲧⲛ ⲁⲛ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲉⲧⲛⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲉⲧϩⲛⲙⲡⲏⲩⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲛⲛⲟⲃⲉ ·
Translation: And this is what your Father which is in heaven doeth for you. If ye do not forgive each other in your hearts, your Father which is in heaven will not forgive you your sins.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲓⲥϩⲏⲏⲧⲉ ⲧⲉⲧⲛⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲁⲙⲉⲣⲁⲁⲧⲉ ϫⲉⲁⲛϯϩⲓⲱⲱⲛ ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲡⲁⲅⲁⲑⲟⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲙⲁⲓⲣⲱⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Behold ye know, O my beloved, that we have clothed ourselves with the good and man-loving Christ.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣⲛⲕⲁⲁⲛ ⲕⲁϩⲏⲩ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲛⲉⲛϩⲃⲏⲩⲉ ⲉⲧϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲁⲛⲉⲣⲏⲧ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲧⲃⲃⲟ · ⲉⲁⲛⲉⲣⲏⲧ ⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲙⲟⲛⲁⲭⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Let us not strip ourselves naked of Him for the sake of our evil works; for we are vowed to God in purity, and we are vowed to the life of the monk.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲣⲛⲉⲥϩⲃⲏⲩⲉ ⲉⲧⲉⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲉ · ⲟⲩⲛⲏⲥⲧⲉⲓⲁ · ⲟⲩϣⲗⲏⲗ · ⲁϫⲛⲱϫⲛ · ⲟⲩⲧⲃⲃⲟ ⲛⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲧⲃⲃⲟ ⲛϩⲏⲧ ·
Translation: Let us do the works thereof which are these: fasting and praying without ceasing, and purity of the body and purity of the heart.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲁⲛⲉⲣⲏⲧ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲧⲃⲃⲟ ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣⲉⲩⲧⲁϩⲟⲛ ϩⲛϩⲉⲛⲡⲟⲣⲛⲉⲓⲁ · ⲉⲩⲟ ⲛⲟⲩⲁⲧⲟ ⲛⲥⲙⲟⲧ ·
Translation: Since we have vowed ourselves to God in purity let us not associate ourselves with the fornications which take manifold forms,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲅⲁⲣ ϫⲉⲁⲩⲡⲟⲣⲛⲉⲩⲉ ϩⲛϩⲁϩ ⲛⲥⲙⲟⲧ ·
Translation: for He saith, 'They committed fornication in very many ways.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲉⲥⲛⲏⲩ · ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣⲉⲩϭⲛⲧⲛ ϩⲛϩⲉⲛϩⲃⲏⲩⲉ ⲛϯⲙⲓⲛⲉ · ⲛⲥⲉϩⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲛ ϩⲁⲡⲉⲥⲏⲧ ⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲓⲙ ·
Translation: O my brethren, o let us not permit ourselves to be found in the works which are of the kind which will make us to fall below every (other) man.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲛⲉⲣⲏⲧ ⲟⲛ ⲙⲙⲟⲛ ⲉⲣⲙⲁⲑⲏⲧⲏⲥ · ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Moreover, we have promised to become disciples of Christ;

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲙⲟⲕϩⲛ ϫⲉϣⲁⲣⲉⲧⲙⲟⲕϩⲥ ⲑⲙⲕⲉⲡϫⲱϩⲙ ·
Translation: let us therefore afflict ourselves, for sorrow bringeth low impurity.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲓⲥ ⲡⲁⲅⲱⲛ ⲕⲏ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ · ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣⲛⲃⲟⲗⲛ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ · ϫⲉⲛⲛⲉⲛⲣϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲃⲉ ·
Translation: And now that the contest is set, let us not allow ourselves to be defeated, so that we may not become slaves unto sin.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲕⲁⲑⲓⲥⲧⲁ ⲙⲙⲟⲛ ⲛⲣⲉϥⲣⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ⲙⲡⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣⲉⲩϫⲓϫⲣⲟⲡ ⲉⲧⲃⲏⲏⲧⲛ ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲫⲟⲣⲉⲓ ⲙⲡⲕⲁⲣⲱϥ ·
Translation: Lightgivers have been placed in the world for us, let them not be offended because of us, let us bear silently,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲟⲩⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲟⲩϫⲁⲓ ϩⲙⲡⲁⲓ ⲛⲏⲫⲉ ⲙⲙⲱⲧⲛ · ⲱ ⲛⲉⲥⲛⲏⲩ ·
Translation: for very many shall be saved through our sobriety, O brethren.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣⲛϥⲓⲱⲡ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲛⲉⲣⲏⲩ ϫⲉⲛⲛⲉⲩϥⲓⲱⲡ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲛ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ ⲛⲛⲕⲟⲗⲁⲥⲓⲥ · ⲕⲁⲛ ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲛϩⲉⲛⲡⲁⲣⲑⲉⲛⲟⲥ · ⲕⲁⲛ ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲉⲛϩⲉⲛⲁⲡⲟⲧⲁⲕϯⲕⲟⲥ · ⲕⲁⲛ ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲛϩⲉⲛⲁⲛⲁⲭⲱⲣⲏⲧⲏⲥ ·
Translation: Let us not enter into reckoning with each other, in order that they may not enter into reckoning with us in the hour of punishment, whether ye are virgins, or whether ye are set apart to do special work, or whether ye are anchorites.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲗⲏⲛ ϥⲛⲁϫⲟⲟⲥ ⲛⲁⲛ ϫⲉⲁⲩⲉⲓⲥ ⲡⲉⲧⲉⲡⲱⲓ ⲡⲉ · ⲙⲛⲧⲉϥⲙⲏⲥⲉ
Translation: Assuredly He shall say unto us, Bring (it hither), this belongeth to Me, and the increase thereof.' And He shall chide us, and say unto us, ' Where is the apparel of the bridal chamber?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲕⲁⲁⲕ · ⲉⲕ ⲙⲡⲉ ⲕⲣⲉⲓⲣⲏⲛⲏ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲕⲥⲟⲛ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲓⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ ·
Translation: 'If thou dost not make peace with thy brother in this world,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲛⲟⲕ
Translation: I will not be with thee in the Day of the Great Judgement.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲕⲥⲉϣϥ ⲡϩⲏⲕⲉ · ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ϩⲱ ⲡⲉⲧⲕⲥⲱϣ
Translation: (If) thou despisest the poor man, it is I Whom thou despisest therewith.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲕϩⲓⲟⲩⲉ ⲉⲡⲉⲃⲓⲏⲛ · ⲛⲧⲕⲡⲉϣⲃⲏⲣ ϩⲱⲱⲕ
Translation: (If) thou rejectest the man of misery, thou art the fellow (or, companion) of the man who rejected Me in My humility upon the Cross.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲏ ⲁⲓϣⲁⲁⲧⲕ ⲛⲗⲁⲁⲩ ϩⲛⲧⲁⲁⲡⲟⲇⲏⲙⲓⲁ ⲉⲡⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Did I ever demand from thee anything during My absence from My home in the world?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲏ ⲙⲡⲓⲭⲁⲣⲓⲍⲉ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲙⲡⲁⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲙⲛⲡⲁⲥⲛⲟϥ ⲛⲟⲩϩⲣⲉ ⲛⲱⲛϩ ·
Translation: Did I not bestow upon thee My Body and My Blood, the Good of life?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲏ ⲙⲡⲓϫⲓϯⲡⲉ ⲙⲡⲙⲟⲩ ϩⲁⲣⲟⲕ ϣⲁⲛⲧⲓⲥⲟⲧⲕ ·
Translation: Did I not taste the death for thy sake until I redeemed thee?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲏ ⲙⲡⲓⲧⲁⲙⲟⲕ ⲉⲡⲙⲩⲥⲧⲏⲣⲓⲟⲛ ⲛⲙⲡⲏⲩⲉ · ϫⲉⲉⲓⲛⲁⲁⲕ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲥⲟⲛ ϩⲓϣⲃⲏⲣ ·
Translation: Did I not make thee acquainted with the mystery of heaven, and make thee My brother and companion?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲏ ⲙⲡⲓϯⲉⲝⲟⲩⲥⲓⲁ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲉϩⲱⲙ ⲉϫⲛⲛϩⲟϥ ⲙⲛⲛⲟⲩⲟⲟϩⲉ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϫⲛⲧϭⲟⲙ ⲧⲏⲣⲥ ⲙⲡϫⲁϫⲉ ⁛—
Translation: Did I not give unto thee the power to trample under thy feet vipers and scorpions, and all the might of the Enemy?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲏ ⲙⲡⲓϯ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛⲟⲩⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ ⲙⲡⲁϩⲣⲉ ⲛⲱⲛϩ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲉⲕⲛⲁⲟⲩϫⲁⲓ ⲛϩⲏⲧⲟⲩ ·
Translation: Did I not give unto thee manifold medicines of life wherewith thou mightest heal thyself?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲁϭⲟⲙ ⲙⲛⲛⲁⲙⲁⲉⲓⲛ · ⲙⲛⲛⲁϣⲡⲏⲣⲉ · ⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲁⲓⲫⲟⲣⲉⲓ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲩ
Translation: My powers, and My signs, and My miracles, which I bore in the world as the [ armour of soldierhood I gave unto thee that thou mightest gird thyself about therewith, and mightest cast down head-long Goliath, that is to say the Devil.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϭⲉ ⲡⲁϣⲏⲣⲉ · ⲛⲁⲓ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲧⲟ ⲛⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲧⲛⲛⲁⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲣⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲛϣⲁⲛⲁⲙⲉⲗⲉⲓ ⲛⲧⲛⲧⲙⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲕⲱ · ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲛⲉⲛⲉⲣⲏⲩ ·
Translation: Now therefore, O my son, these things and those which are far more severe shall we hear if we continue to be careless, and are not obedient (to the command) to forgive one another.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲛⲏⲫⲉ ·
Translation: Let us be sober.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲧⲛⲥⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲁⲣⲉⲧⲏ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲛⲁⲃⲟⲏⲑⲉⲓ ⲉⲣⲟⲛ · ⲙⲡⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲙⲟⲩ · ⲛⲉⲓⲣⲉϥⲣϩⲙⲙⲉ ϩⲛⲧⲙⲏⲏⲧⲉ · ⲙⲡⲡⲟⲗⲉⲙⲟⲥ ⲉⲧⲛⲁϣⲧ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲧϩⲁϩⲟⲧⲉ · ⲛⲉⲓⲣⲉϥⲧⲟⲩⲛⲉⲥ ⲯⲩⲭⲏ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲧⲙⲟⲟⲩⲧ ·
Translation: We know the virtues of God which shall help us in the day of death, and which shall act as a guide for us in the midst of the cruel and terrifying war, and which shall raise up (our) soul(s) from the dead.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛϣⲟⲣⲡ ⲙⲉⲛ ⲁⲩϯ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲡⲓⲥⲧⲓⲥ · ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲛⲛⲟⲩϫⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧⲁⲧⲁⲧⲛⲁϩⲧⲉ ϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲛϩⲏⲧⲛ ·
Translation: Now first of all there have been given unto us faith and the knowledge whereby we may expel unbelief from within us.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲛⲛⲥⲱⲥ ⲁⲩϯ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲥⲟⲫⲓⲁ ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲥⲁⲃⲉ · ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲛⲥⲟⲩⲛ ⲡⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ⲙⲡⲇⲓⲁⲃⲟⲗⲟⲥ · ⲛⲧⲛⲡⲱⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲛⲧⲛⲙⲉⲥⲧⲱϥ ·
Translation: Next, there have been given unto us wisdom and understanding which enable us to understand the thoughts of the Devil, and to flee from him, and to hate him.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲧⲁϣⲉⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲛⲏⲥⲧⲉⲓⲁ ⲙⲛⲟⲩϣⲗⲏⲗ · ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲉⲅⲕⲣⲁϯⲁ · ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲛⲁϯ ⲛⲟⲩϫⲁⲙⲏ ⲙⲛⲟⲩϩⲣⲟⲕ · ⲙⲡⲥⲱⲙⲁ ϩⲓⲧⲛ ⲙⲡⲁⲑⲟⲥ :—
Translation: (And) there are preached unto us fasting, and prayer, and continence, which shall give peace and tranquillity in the body (which is vexed) by passion.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩϯ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲧⲃⲃⲟ ⲙⲛⲟⲩϩⲁⲣⲉϩ · ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲁⲟⲩⲱϩ ⲛϩⲏⲧⲛ ⲉⲧⲃⲏⲏⲧⲟⲩ :—
Translation: There have been given unto us purity and abstinence through which God shall dwell in us.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩϯ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧϩⲁⲣϣϩⲏⲧ ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲣⲙⲣⲁϣ · ⲉⲛϣⲁⲛϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ⲉⲛⲁⲓ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ · ⲧⲛⲛⲁⲕⲗⲏⲣⲟⲛⲟⲙⲉⲓ ⲙⲡⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: And there have been given unto us patient endurance and long-suffering, and if we keep carefully all these (virtues) we shall inherit the glory of God.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩϯ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲁⲅⲁⲡⲏ ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲉⲓⲣⲏⲛⲏ · ⲛⲉⲓⲇⲩⲛⲁⲧⲟⲥ ϩⲙⲡⲡⲟⲗⲉⲙⲟⲥ · ⲙⲉⲣⲉϫⲁϫⲉ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲉϣϩⲱⲡ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲙⲁ ⲉⲧⲉⲣⲉⲛⲁⲓ ⲛϩⲏⲧϥ ·
Translation: There have been given unto us love and peace, these mighty warriors in the battle, for the Enemy is unable to draw nigh unto the place wherein these are.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩϩⲱⲛ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧⲛ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲣⲁϣⲉ ϫⲉⲉⲛⲉⲙⲓϣⲉ ⲙⲛⲧⲗⲩⲡⲏ ⲛϩⲏⲧϥ ·
Translation: We have been commanded concerning the joy wherein there is no grief if we fight.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲧⲥⲁⲃⲟⲛ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲉⲩⲙⲛⲧⲣⲉϥϯ ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And we have also been instructed in generosity and in Christlikeness.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩϯ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲙⲡⲉϣⲗⲏⲗ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲙⲛⲟⲩϩⲩⲡⲟⲙⲟⲛⲏ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉϣⲁⲩⲙⲉϩⲧⲉⲯⲩⲭⲏ ⲛⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ·
Translation: There have been given unto us holy prayer and long-suffering, which are wont to fill the soul with light.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩϯ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧϫⲡⲓⲏⲧ ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲃⲁⲗϩⲏⲧ · ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉϣⲁⲩⲱϫⲛ · ⲛⲧⲕⲁⲕⲓⲁ ·
Translation: There have been given unto us innocency of heart and simplicity, which are wont to blot out wickedness.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲥϩⲁⲓ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲁⲧⲕⲣⲓⲛⲉ · ϫⲉⲉⲛⲉϫⲣⲟ ⲉⲡϭⲟⲗ ⲡⲉⲓϫⲃⲓⲛ ⲉⲧϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲉⲧϩⲙⲡⲣⲱⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Directions have been written down for us in respect of judging no man, and we must overcome the falsehood of this evil blemish which is in man

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲛⲧⲙⲕⲣⲓⲛⲉ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲛⲥⲉⲛⲁⲕⲣⲓⲛⲉ ⲙⲙⲟⲛ ⲁⲛ ϩⲙⲡⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ
Translation: for if we do not judge they will not judge us in the Day of Judgement.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧϩⲏⲇⲟⲛⲏ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧⲁⲧⲥⲉⲓ ϣⲁⲥⲣⲡⲗⲟⲅⲓⲥⲙⲟⲥ ⲛⲥⲟϭ · ⲛⲥⲣⲧⲥⲩ ⲛⲏⲇⲏⲥⲓⲥ ⲛⲁⲧϣⲓⲡⲉ · ⲛⲥⲥⲱⲗⲡ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲁⲗⲓⲛⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲗⲁⲥ ·
Translation: For the pleasure which attendeth drinking in excess maketh a man of understanding- to become a fool, and it turneth the conscience into a shameless thing, and it setteth loose the bridle of the tongue.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲟⲩⲣⲟⲧ ⲙⲡⲧⲏⲣϥ · ⲡⲉⲧⲙϯⲗⲩⲡⲏ ⲙⲡⲉⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ · ⲏ · ⲛⲧⲛⲧⲙⲡⲱϣⲥ ϩⲛⲟⲩϩⲏⲇⲟⲛⲏ ·
Translation: The greatest joy in all the world is to sorrow in the Holy Spirit; let us not stray in pleasure.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲡⲟⲩⲏⲏⲃ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲡⲣⲟⲫⲏⲧⲏⲥ ⲡⲱϣⲥ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲏⲣⲡ ·
Translation: For the priest spake, and the prophet gave a warning concerning wine,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲟⲩⲁⲧⲁⲙⲁϩⲧⲉ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲏⲣⲡ ⲟⲩⲥⲱϣ ⲡⲉ ⲡϯϩⲉ · ⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁⲧⲁⲁϥ ⲉⲛⲁⲓ · ⲛϥⲛⲁϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲁⲛ ⲉϥⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲉⲛⲟⲃⲉ ·
Translation: 'Wine is insolent, drunkenness is a disgrace; whosoever shall devote himself to these shall not be innocent of sin'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩⲡⲏⲣⲡ · ⲉⲕϣⲁⲛⲥⲟⲟϥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲣⲱϣⲉ · ⲉⲕϣⲁⲛϯⲛⲉⲕⲃⲁⲗ ⲉϩⲉⲛⲫⲩⲁⲗⲏ · ⲙⲛϩⲉⲛⲁⲡⲟⲧ ⲕⲛⲁⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ⲉⲕⲕⲏⲕⲁϩⲏⲩ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲥⲁϩⲙⲥ ·
Translation: Wine is good if we drink it in moderation ; if thou givest thine eye to the wine-bottles and to the drinking-pots, thou shalt go naked, even like a corn-stalk (?).

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲟⲩⲟⲛ ϭⲉ ⲛⲓⲙ · ⲛⲧⲁⲩⲥⲃⲧⲱⲧⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲙⲁⲑⲏⲧⲏⲥ ⲛⲓⲏⲥⲟⲩⲥ · ⲙⲁⲣⲟⲩⲥⲁϩⲱⲟⲩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ · ⲙⲡⲏⲣⲡ ⲙⲛⲡϯϩⲉ ·
Translation: Therefore let all those who have prepared themselves to be disciples of Jesus keep themselves away from wine and from drunkenness.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉⲛⲉⲛⲉⲓⲟⲟⲧⲉ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲉϩⲟⲩⲟ ⲙⲡⲟⲥⲉ ⲉⲧⲛⲁϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲏⲣⲡ · ⲁⲩⲥⲁϩⲱⲟⲩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲙⲟϥ · ⲉϣⲁⲩⲥⲉⲟⲩⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲙⲙⲁⲧⲉ · ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡϣⲱⲛⲉ ·
Translation: For our fathers knew very well the danger which would arise because of wine, and they abstained from it, for they were wont to drink it in very small quantities when suffering from sickness.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲛⲧⲁⲩϯⲟⲩⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧϥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲉⲣⲅⲁⲧⲏⲥ ⲧⲓⲙⲱⲑⲉⲟⲥ ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡⲉϥⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲟϣ ⲛϣⲱⲛⲉ · ⲉⲓⲉⲡⲉⲧⲃⲣⲃⲣ ϩⲛⲧⲕⲁⲕⲓⲁ ⲛⲧⲁⲅⲙⲏ ⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧϣⲏⲣⲉ ϣⲏⲙ · ⲉⲩⲟϣ ϩⲓϫⲱϥ ⲛϭⲓⲛϫⲱϩⲙ ⲛⲙⲡⲁⲑⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Now if only a very little wine was allowed to be given to the mighty workman Timothy, whose body was in a very infirm condition, then what shall I say in respect of the man who is bubbling over with wickedness, and is in the prime of early manhood, and who hath in him impure desires and passion in abundance?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲟⲩ ⲡⲉⲧϯⲛⲁϫⲟⲟϥ ⲛⲁⲩ · ϯⲣϩⲟⲧⲉ · ⲉϫⲟⲟⲥ · ϫⲉⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣϥⲥⲱ ⲉⲡⲧⲏⲣϥ ϫⲉⲛⲛⲉⲟⲩⲁ · ⲉϥⲙⲟⲥⲧⲉ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲟⲩϫⲁⲓ ⲕⲣⲙⲣⲙ ⲉⲣⲟⲓ ·
Translation: I am afraid to say it: Let no man drink wine at all, so that he may not hate his own salvation (and) murmur against me.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲉⲓϣⲁϫⲉ ⲅⲁⲣ ϩⲟⲣϣ ⲛⲟⲩⲙⲏⲏϣⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ·
Translation: For these words will be hard unto many at (this) time.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲗⲏⲛ ⲛⲁⲙⲉⲣⲁⲧⲉ · ⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩⲥ ⲉϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲟⲩϩⲏⲩ ⲡⲉ ⲧⲙⲟⲕϩⲥ · ⲡⲉⲧⲛⲁⲙⲟⲕϩϥ ⲅⲁⲣ · ϥⲛⲁⲧⲟⲩϫⲟ ⲙⲡⲉϥϫⲟⲉⲓ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲗⲩⲙⲏⲛ ⲙⲡⲟⲩϫⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩϥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ · ⲁⲩⲱ ϥⲛⲁⲥⲉⲓ ⲛⲛⲁⲅⲁⲑⲟⲛ ⲛⲧⲡⲉ ·
Translation: Nevertheless, my beloved, it is good to keep oneself (from wine), and soberness (?) is beneficial ; for he who keepeth himself sober (?) shall sail in safety his ship into the harbour of the salvation, which is good and holy, and he shall drink of the good things of heaven.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲛⲟϭ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ · ⲉⲛⲁⲓ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ · ⲁⲩϯ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧⲛ ⲙⲡⲉⲑⲃⲃⲓⲟ ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲣⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲉⲛⲁⲣⲉⲧⲏ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ · ⲧⲉⲓⲛⲟϭ ⲛϭⲟⲙ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲛⲧⲁⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ϭⲟⲟⲗⲉϥ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ⲉϥⲛⲏⲩ ⲉⲡⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲉⲑⲃⲃⲓⲟ ·
Translation: And again, a greater thing than all these hath been given into thine hand, namely, the humility which keepeth watch over all the virtues ; humility was this great and holy power wherein God arrayed Himself when He came into the world.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲥⲟⲃⲧ ⲛⲛⲁⲣⲉⲧⲏ · ⲡⲉⲑⲏⲥⲁⲩⲣⲟⲥ ⲛⲛⲉⲡⲣⲁⲝⲓⲥ · ⲡϩⲟⲡⲗⲟⲛ ⲛⲣⲉϥⲛⲟⲩϩⲙ · ⲡⲉⲑⲉⲣⲁⲡⲉⲩⲧⲏⲥ ⲙⲡⲗⲩⲡⲏ ⲛⲓⲙ ·
Translation: It is the wall (round about) the virtues, the treasure-house of actions (or, deeds), the armour which delivereth, the healer of every grief.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲟⲩⲧⲁⲙⲓⲟ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲓϣⲛⲥ · ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲓⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲃ ⲉⲧⲉⲥⲕⲩⲛⲏ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲓⲕⲟⲥⲙⲏⲥⲓⲥ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁⲩϩⲟⲃⲥⲟⲩ ⲛⲟⲩϩⲱⲃⲥ ⲛϭⲟⲟⲩⲛⲉ :—
Translation: And when the apparel of byssus had been made, and the vessels of gold for the tabernacle, and all the things for adornment, they put on apparel of sackcloth.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲟⲩⲉⲗⲁⲭⲓⲥⲧⲟⲛ ⲙⲉⲛ ⲡⲉ ⲛⲛⲁϩⲣⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ϥⲥⲟⲧⲡ ⲇⲉ ⲁⲩⲱ ϥⲧⲁⲓⲏⲩ ⲛⲛⲁϩⲣⲛⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: (Humility) is one of the least of things in the sight of men, but it is chosen and most honourable before God.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲛϣⲁⲛϫⲡⲟϥ ⲛⲁⲛ · ⲧⲛⲛⲁϩⲱⲙ ⲉϫⲛⲧϭⲟⲙ ⲧⲏⲣⲥ ⲙⲡϫⲁϫⲉ ·
Translation: If we acquire it for ourselves we shall (be able to) tread upon all the power of the Enemy.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲉϫⲁϥ ⲅⲁⲣ ϫⲉⲉⲓⲛⲁϭⲱϣⲧ ⲉϫⲛⲛⲓⲙ ⲁⲛ ⲛⲥⲁⲡⲉⲧⲑⲃⲃⲓⲏⲩ ⲙⲛⲡⲣⲙⲣⲁϣ ·
Translation: For He said, 'On whom shall I look except upon him that is humble and long-suffering?'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲣⲛⲕⲁⲡⲛϩⲏⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ · ⲙⲡϩⲉⲃⲱⲱⲛ ϫⲉⲁⲥⲁϣⲁⲓ ⲛϭⲓⲧⲙⲛⲧϣⲟⲩϣⲟ ⲙⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧⲥⲁⲃⲉ ⲣⲱⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Let us not relax our attention in the time of hunger, for boasting increaseth in a man as well as prudence.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲥⲁϣⲁⲓ ⲛϭⲓⲧⲙⲛⲧⲗⲁⲃⲙⲁϩⲧ · ⲁⲥⲣⲣⲣⲟ ⲛϭⲓⲧⲡⲟⲣⲛⲉⲓⲁ ϩⲓⲧⲙⲡⲥⲉⲓ ⲛⲧⲥⲁⲣⲝ · ⲁⲥⲁⲣⲭⲉⲓ ⲛϭⲓⲧⲙⲛⲧϫⲁⲥⲓϩⲏⲧ · ⲁⲛⲕⲟⲩⲓ ⲗⲟ ⲉⲩⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲛⲥⲁⲛⲛⲟϭ · ⲁⲛⲛⲟϭ ⲕⲁⲧⲟⲟⲧⲟⲩ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉⲩϥⲓⲣⲟⲟⲩϣ ϩⲁⲛⲕⲟⲩⲓ · ⲁⲡⲟⲩⲁ ⲡⲟⲩⲁ ⲙⲟⲟϣⲉ ϩⲛⲛⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲛϩⲏⲧ ·
Translation: When gluttony increaseth, fornication reigneth through the drinking of the body, (and) pride hath rule, and the novices cease to listen to the elders, and the elders cease to trouble in any way about the novices, and each one walketh according to the desire of his own heart.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲣⲛⲱϣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲡⲣⲟⲫⲏⲧⲏⲥ · ϫⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲧⲁⲯⲩⲭⲏ ϫⲉⲡⲣⲉϥⲣϩⲟⲧⲉ ⲧⲁⲕⲟ ϩⲓϫⲙⲡⲕⲁϩ ·
Translation: This is the time wherein we must cry out with the prophet, 'Woe unto me, O my soul, for he who striketh terror destroyeth upon the earth.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉⲧⲥⲟⲩⲧⲱⲛ ϩⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲉϥϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲁⲛ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ · ⲉⲧⲉⲡⲁⲓ ⲡⲉ ⲛϥϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲁⲛ ⲉⲡⲧⲏⲣϥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ϫⲉⲁⲡⲟⲩⲁ ⲡⲟⲩⲁ ϩⲟϫϩϫ ⲙⲡⲉⲧϩⲓⲧⲟⲩⲱⲱϥ ·
Translation: And he who is upright among men existeth not according to the Christ, that is to say he doth not exist at all, and each one afflicteth his neighbour.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲅⲱⲛⲓⲍⲉ ⲛⲁⲙⲉⲣⲁⲧⲉ · ϫⲉⲁⲡⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ϩⲱⲛ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁⲛⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲥⲃⲟⲕ ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲉϥϯⲥⲃⲱ ⲛⲛⲉϥϣⲏⲣⲉ · ⲙⲛⲟⲩϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲉϥⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲛⲥⲁⲡⲉϥⲉⲓⲱⲧ ·
Translation: Strive ye, O my beloved, for the time hath drawn nigh, and the days have diminished. The father no longer giveth instruction to his son, and the son hearkeneth not to his father.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱϫⲛ ⲛϭⲓⲙⲡⲁⲣⲑⲉⲛⲟⲥ ⲉⲧⲛⲁⲛⲱⲟⲩ · ⲁⲩⲉⲛⲕⲟⲧⲕ ⲛϭⲓⲛⲉⲓⲟⲟⲧⲉ
Translation: The good Virgins have come to an end. The holy fathers are asleep in every place, the mothers are destroyed like the widows, we have become like unto orphans.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲙⲓϣⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲛ ⲉⲛϩⲟⲥⲟⲛ ⲟⲩⲛⲙⲉⲧⲁⲛⲟⲓⲁ ⲕⲏ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ·
Translation: Let us fight for ourselves, inasmuch as repentance is sufficient for us.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲫⲟⲣⲉⲓ ⲛⲧⲙⲟⲕϩⲥ · ⲧⲁⲣⲛⲣⲃⲣⲣⲉ ϩⲙⲡⲧⲃⲃⲟ · ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲣⲙⲁⲓⲣⲱⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Let us put on ourselves sorrow, and make ourselves new (creatures) in humility.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧⲁⲣⲛⲣϣⲃⲏⲣ ⲉⲓⲏⲥⲟⲩⲥ ⲡⲙⲁⲓⲣⲱⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Let us become lovers of men, and make ourselves companions of Christ, the Lover of mankind.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲁⲛⲉⲣⲏⲧ ⲙⲛⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲙⲟⲛⲁⲭⲟⲥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲁⲅⲁⲡⲏ ·
Translation: Since we are vowed unto God, (we must lead) the life of the monk in love.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲟⲩⲡⲁⲣⲑⲉⲛⲓⲁ ⲁⲛ ⲙⲙⲁⲧⲉ ⲛⲥⲱⲙⲁ ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲟⲩⲡⲁⲣⲑⲉⲛⲓⲁ ⲛⲥⲁ ϩⲱⲱⲕ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲛⲟⲃⲉ ⲛⲓⲙ ·
Translation: Virginity doth not (mean) virginity of the body only, but the keeping of oneself from every sin.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲧⲥⲧⲟ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛϩⲉⲛⲡⲁⲣⲑⲉⲛⲟⲥ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲩⲁⲅⲅⲉⲗⲓⲟⲛ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲧⲉⲩⲙⲛⲧⲣⲉϥϫⲛⲁⲁⲩ · ⲛⲉⲧⲣⲟⲉⲓⲥ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧϫⲱⲱⲣⲉ ϣⲁⲩⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲙⲁ ⲛϣⲉⲗⲉⲉⲧ ·
Translation: For in the Gospel certain virgins were rejected because of their careless slothfulness, whilst those who watched bravely went into the chamber of the bridegroom.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲅⲉⲛⲟⲓⲧⲉ ϭⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲟⲩⲟⲛ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲙⲁ ⲉⲧⲙⲙⲁⲩ ϣⲁⲉⲛⲉϩ ·
Translation: May it happen then that every one (here) may enter into that place for ever!

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧⲙⲛⲧⲙⲁⲓϩⲟⲙⲛⲧ ⲉⲧⲟⲩϯ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲛ ⲉⲧⲃⲏⲏⲧⲥ ·
Translation: And as concerning the love of money by means of which fighting is carried on against us.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲕⲟⲩⲱϣ ⲉϫⲡⲟ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛϩⲉⲛⲭⲣⲏⲙⲁ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲟ ⲙⲙⲟⲟⲗⲉ · ⲛⲧⲟⲉⲓⲙⲉ ⲙⲡⲕⲱϩⲧ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲙⲁⲓⲧⲟ ⲛϩⲟⲩⲟ · ⲏ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧⲉϣⲱⲱⲧ ⲏ ϩⲛⲟⲩϫⲓ ⲛϭⲟⲛⲥ · ⲏ ϩⲛⲟⲩⲉⲓⲣⲃⲟⲛⲉ · ⲏ ϩⲛⲟⲩϩⲱⲃ ⲛϭⲓϫ ⲉϥⲟϣ · ⲉⲙⲉⲕⲥⲣϥⲉ ⲉϣⲙϣⲉ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲡⲗⲏⲛ ϩⲛⲥⲙⲟⲧ ⲛⲓⲙ
Translation: If thou wishest to gain for thyself these things (or, possessions) which are transient, and can be destroyed by fire, by great avariciousness, or by trafficking, or by violence, or by evil design, or by excessive manual labour, thou art not free to serve God, at least certainly not in every way.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉϣϫⲉ ⲁⲕⲉⲡⲓⲑⲩⲙⲉⲓ ⲉⲥⲱⲟⲩϩ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲛⲟⲩⲃ ⲏ ⲟⲩϩⲟⲙⲛⲧ · ⲁⲣⲓⲡⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲛⲧⲁϥϫⲟⲟϥ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲩⲁⲅⲅⲉⲗⲓⲟⲛ · ϫⲉⲡⲁⲧϩⲏⲧ · ⲥⲉⲛⲁϥⲓ ⲛⲧⲉⲕⲯⲩⲭⲏ ϩⲛϯⲟⲩϣⲏ · ⲛⲉⲛⲧⲁⲕⲥⲃⲧⲱⲧⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ⲉⲩⲛⲁϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲛⲓⲙ
Translation: If thou hast the eager desire to collect for thyself gold or bronze, remember that which He spake in the Gospel, saying, 'Thou man of no understanding, they shall carry away thy soul this very night; (and) the things which thou hast prepared unto whom shall they belong?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲅⲱⲛⲓⲍⲉ ⲱ ⲡⲁⲙⲉⲣⲓⲧ ⲛⲅϯⲟⲩⲃⲉ ⲙⲡⲁⲑⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Strive eagerly then, O my beloved, and fight against (this) passion.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲅϫⲟⲟⲥ
Translation: Thou shalt say, 'I will do what Abraham did, I will act uprightly in respect of God, the Most High, Who created the heavens and the earth—saying. If I have taken anything of the things which belong unto thee, from a thread even unto a shoe-latchet'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ
Translation: The stranger who is humble is a great good, and the Lord loveth the proselyte. Concerning, moreover, the slothfulness by means of which fighting is carried on against us, (and) concerning the right hand of need,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲣⲓⲡⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ϫⲉϥⲥⲏϩ · ϫⲉⲥⲉⲛⲁϣⲱⲡⲉ
Translation: remember that it is written, 'Thy houses for gathering in are accursed, and the things which are in them.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲃ ⲇⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲙⲛⲡϩⲟⲙⲛⲧ ·
Translation: And again concerning the gold and the bronze James spake, saying, 'Their rust shall bear witness against them, and the rust shall devour your flesh like fire.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ϫⲉϥⲥⲟⲧⲡ ⲛϭⲓⲟⲩⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲇⲓⲕⲁⲓⲟⲥ
Translation: And, 'He chose a man, a righteous man who had no idol, he saw their affliction'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧⲃⲃⲟⲕ
Translation: Again, purify thyself from the curse before the Lord calleth thee, for thou hast set thy hope upon God, because it is written 'Let your hearts be purified, (and) perfect towards God.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϯϣⲓⲛⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲡⲁⲙⲉⲣⲓⲧ ϩⲙⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ·
Translation: I enquire of thee, O my beloved in the Lord,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲕⲁⲓ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲁⲕⲕⲁ
Translation: for if thou hast made God to be a helper (unto thee), and if thou art unto Him one beloved, and if thou hast set thy heart to walk in the commandments of God,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲧⲟϥ ⲇⲉ ⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉϥⲉⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲛⲧⲉⲧⲉⲕⲡⲩⲅⲏ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛⲉⲓⲉⲣⲟ · ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲕⲉⲓⲉⲣⲟ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲁⲩ ⲛⲧⲑⲁⲗⲁⲥⲥⲁ ·
Translation: then will God Himself bless thee so greatly that thy fountain shall become a river unto thee, and thy river shall become unto thee a sea.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲕⲁⲓ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲛⲧⲕⲟⲩϩⲁⲣⲙⲁ · ⲉⲕϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲛϩⲩⲡⲡⲉⲩⲥ ⲛⲧⲉⲅⲕⲣⲁϯⲁ · ⲉⲣⲉⲡϩⲏⲃⲥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲙⲟⲩϩ ϩⲁϫⲱⲕ ⲉⲕϯⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ϩⲙⲡⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓⲛ ⲉⲧϩⲏⲡ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲉⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁ ·
Translation: For thou art the chariot, and continence shall be the charioteer. The lamp of God is kindled above thee, and thou shalt give forth the light which belongeth unto the Spirit.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲕⲟⲓⲕⲟⲛⲟⲙⲉⲓ ⲛⲛⲉⲕϣⲁϫⲉ ϩⲛⲟⲩϩⲁⲡ ·
Translation: Thou shalt control thy words in (giving) judgement.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉϥⲉⲭⲁⲣⲓⲍⲉ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧϣⲟⲉⲓϫ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ · ⲛⲥⲉⲧⲙϩⲉ ⲉⲉⲓⲇⲱⲗⲟⲛ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲕⲡⲟⲗⲓⲥ ·
Translation: God granteth unto thee graciously the skill of the saints in contending, so that thou mayest not fall headlong before the image (or, phantom) in thy city.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲅⲟⲩⲉϩ ⲣⲁⲧⲕ ⲉϫⲙⲡⲙⲁⲕϩ ⲛⲛⲁⲣⲭⲱⲛ ⲙⲡⲕⲁⲕⲉ ·
Translation: Thou settest thy foot upon the neck of the prince of darkness.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲛⲛⲥⲁⲛⲁⲓ ⲟⲛ ϯϩⲱⲛ ⲉⲧⲟⲟⲧⲕ ⲉⲧⲙⲕⲁⲡⲉⲕϩⲏⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ · ϫⲉⲡⲣⲁϣⲉ ⲛⲛⲇⲁⲓⲙⲟⲛⲓⲟⲛ ⲡⲉ ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲡⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲕⲁⲡⲉϥϩⲏⲧ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲥⲉⲉⲛⲧϥ ⲉⲧϭⲟⲣϭⲥ ⲙⲡⲁⲧϥⲉⲓⲙⲉ ·
Translation: And besides these things, I command thee not to relax thy hold upon thy heart, for it is the joy of devils to make a man to relax his hold upon his heart, and to bring him into the net before he is aware of it.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲁⲙⲉⲗⲉⲓ ⲟⲩⲛ · ⲉϫⲓⲥⲃⲱ ⲉⲧϩⲟⲧⲉ ⲙⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ·
Translation: Therefore be not thou careless in receiving the teaching of the fear of the Lord.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲅⲡⲣⲟⲕⲟⲡⲧⲉⲓ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲛⲓⲧⲱⲱϭⲉ · ⲛⲃⲣⲣⲉ ·
Translation: Thou shalt go forward (or, grow) like the new plants,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲕⲛⲁⲣⲁⲛⲁϥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲙⲁⲥ ⲛⲃⲣⲣⲉ · ⲉϥⲛⲉϫⲧⲁⲡ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲓⲉⲓⲃ ·
Translation: and thou shalt please God like a new (i. e. young) bull which driveth away the sheep with (his) horns.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲟⲛ ⲛⲟⲩⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛϫⲱⲱⲣⲉ ϩⲙⲡϩⲱⲃ ⲙⲛⲡϣⲁϫⲉ ·
Translation: Moreover, be thou a valiant man, both in deed and in word.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲡⲣϯϩⲟ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲛⲓϩⲩⲡⲟⲕⲣⲏⲧⲏⲥ · ⲙⲏⲡⲟⲧⲉ ⲛⲥⲉⲕⲟ ⲛⲧⲉⲕⲧⲟ ⲉⲛⲙⲙⲁⲩ ·
Translation: Do not turn thy face away as do the hypocrites, lest thou join them and become converted unto them.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲡⲣⲧⲁⲕⲉⲟⲩϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲟⲩⲱⲧ ϩⲙⲡⲉⲕⲁϩⲉ · ⲉⲓⲙⲉ ϫⲉⲉⲕⲛⲁϯ ⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲙⲙⲏⲛⲉ ⲙⲙⲏⲛⲉ ·
Translation: Do not destroy (or, waste) the first day (of the week) in thy field, for thou must know what that must give to God day by day.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϩⲙⲟⲟⲥ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲟⲩⲁⲁⲕ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩϩⲏⲅⲉⲙⲱⲛ ⲛⲥⲁⲃⲉ ⲛⲅⲕⲣⲓⲛⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲗⲟⲅⲓⲥⲙⲟⲥ · ⲉⲓⲧⲉ ⲉⲕⲁⲛⲁⲭⲱⲣⲉⲓ · ⲉⲓⲧⲉ ⲉⲕϩⲛⲧⲙⲏⲏⲧⲉ ·
Translation: Seat thyself by thyself, like a prudent governor, and try (thyself) judicially according to thy reason; and whether thou art away by qf thyself on a journey, or whether thou art among a crowd,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲗⲏⲛ ϯϩⲁⲡ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ ⲙⲙⲏⲛⲉ ·
Translation: thou shall pass judgement on thyself daily.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲕⲁⲓ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲛⲁⲛⲟⲩⲥ ·
Translation: For it is very much better for thee to be one among a crowd of a thousand people and to possess a very little humility, than to be a man living in the cave of a hyena in pride.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲩⲣⲙⲛⲧⲣⲉ ϩⲁⲗⲱⲧ · ⲉϥϩⲛⲧⲙⲏⲏⲧⲉ ⲛⲥⲟⲇⲟⲙⲁ
Translation: It may be remembered in respect of Lot, that he lived in the midst of Sodom, and still was a believer and a good man.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲛⲥⲱⲧⲙ
Translation: But we also hear in respect of Cain, with whom upon the earth there were only three other people, that he became a sinner.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϭⲉ ⲉⲓⲥ ⲡⲁⲅⲱⲛ ⲕⲏ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ · ⲇⲟⲕⲏⲙⲁⲍⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲛⲏⲩ ⲉϫⲱⲕ ⲙⲙⲏⲛⲉ · ϫⲉⲉⲕⲏⲏⲡ ⲉⲣⲟⲛ ϫⲓⲛⲉⲕⲏⲏⲡ ⲉⲛⲉⲧϯ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲛ ·
Translation: Now therefore, behold, the contest is prepared for thee. Examine thou carefully those who come upon thee daily, for we must hide ourselves even as those who wage war against us hide themselves.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲟⲩⲙⲟⲛⲟⲛ ϣⲁⲣⲉⲛⲇⲁⲓⲙⲟⲛⲓⲟⲛ ⲉⲓ ⲛⲁⲕ ϩⲙⲡⲟⲩⲛⲁⲙ · ⲡⲉϩⲃⲟⲩⲣ ⲇⲉ ϥⲟⲩⲟⲛϩ ⲉⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲓⲙ ·
Translation: For the devils are not wont to come against thee on the right hand only, but they appear also on the left hand to every man.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲕⲁⲓ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ϩⲱ ⲁⲗⲏⲑⲱⲥ · ⲁⲩϯ ⲛⲙⲙⲁⲓ ϩⲙⲡⲟⲩⲛⲁⲙ ⲁⲩⲉⲓⲛⲉ ⲛⲁⲓ · ⲙⲡⲇⲓⲁⲃⲟⲗⲟⲥ ⲉϥⲥⲟⲛϩ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩⲉⲓⲁ ⲛⲧⲟⲟⲩ ·
Translation: For in very truth, in my own case, they fought against me on the right-hand side, and they brought unto me the Devil, being bound in the form of a wild ass, but the Lord helped me.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϭⲉ ⲡⲁϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲫⲟⲣⲉⲓ ⲙⲡⲉⲑⲃⲃⲓⲟ ⲛⲅⲕⲁⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛⲣⲉϥϫⲓ ϣⲟϫⲛⲉ · ⲙⲛⲡⲉϥⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲛⲁⲅⲁⲑⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Now, therefore, O my son, array thyself in humility, and make the Christ to be unto thee a counsellor, and His Good Father (also);

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲅⲣϣⲃⲏⲣ · ⲉⲩⲣⲙ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲛⲟⲙⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ϩⲙⲡⲉϥϩⲏⲧ ·
Translation: make thyself a companion and a divine man, in whose heart is the Law of God.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲅⲧⲛⲧⲱⲛⲅ ⲛⲧϩⲉ ⲛⲟⲩϩⲏⲕⲉ ⲉϥϥⲓ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲥⲧⲁⲩⲣⲟⲥ · ⲉϥⲟ ⲛϣⲃⲏⲣ ⲉⲡⲣⲓⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Make thyself to be like unto the poor man who carried His Cross, who became a companion of weeping.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲅⲣϩⲏⲕⲉ ϩⲱⲱⲕ ⲛⲟⲩⲥⲟⲩⲇⲁⲣⲓⲟⲛ · ⲉⲧⲉⲕⲁⲡⲉ · ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲉⲕⲙⲁ ⲛϣⲱⲡⲉ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛⲧⲁⲫⲟⲥ · ϣⲁⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲧⲟⲩⲛⲟⲥⲕ ⲛϥϯ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛⲧⲉϭⲣⲏⲏⲡⲉ ⲙⲡⲉϫⲣⲟ :—
Translation: Make thyself to become poor, (put) a napkin on thy head, and let thy place of abode be unto thee a tomb, until God shall raise thee up and give unto thee the crown of triumph.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲕϣⲁⲛⲥⲱϣⲙ ⲛⲟⲩⲥⲟⲡ · ⲙⲛⲟⲩⲥⲟⲛ · ⲉϥϯϩⲓⲥⲉ ⲛⲁⲕ ϩⲛⲟⲩϣⲁϫⲉ ·
Translation: If it happeneth on a time that thou art utterly cast down about a brother, who hath caused thee suffering by (his) words ;

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲏ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲉⲕϩⲏⲧ ⲡⲱⲗϩ ⲉⲩⲥⲟⲛ · ⲉⲕϫⲱ
Translation: or if thy heart hath been wounded by a brother, and thou sayest, 'he is not worth this ';

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲣⲓⲡⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ϫⲉⲉⲕϩⲏⲩ ϩⲱⲱⲕ ⲛϩⲁϩ ⲛⲥⲟⲡ ·
Translation: Remember how that thou thyself hast benefited on several occasions.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲏ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲥⲱⲧⲙ
Translation: Dost thou not hear the Christ saying, 'Forgive thy brother seventy times seven'?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲏ ⲛⲅⲣⲓⲙⲉ ⲁⲛ
Translation: Dost thou thyself not weep often when thou makest supplication, saying, 'Forgive me I the multitude of my sins '?

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲩⲛⲟⲩ ϣⲁⲕⲧⲱⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲕϩⲙⲡⲥⲟⲗⲥⲗ ⲛⲧⲙⲉⲧⲁⲛⲟⲓⲁ ·
Translation: And straightway thou shalt rise up, and thou shalt be [feeling] the consolation of repentance,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲅⲡⲱⲧ ⲉⲣⲁⲧϥ ⲙⲡⲉⲕⲥⲟⲛ ·
Translation: thou shalt flee to the feet of thy brother,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲉⲕϩⲏⲧ ⲃⲏⲗ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: thy heart shall be as water,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉⲡⲉⲕϩⲟ ⲣⲟⲟⲩⲧ · ⲉⲣⲉⲣⲱⲕ ⲙⲏϩ ⲛⲣⲁϣⲉ ·
Translation: thy face shall be joyful, thy mouth shall be filled with gladness,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲣⲉϯⲣⲏⲛⲏ ⲕⲱⲧⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲕ · ⲉⲕⲥⲱⲃⲉ ⲉⲕⲕⲱⲣϣ ⲉⲡⲉⲕⲥⲟⲛ · ϫⲉⲕⲱ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲡⲁⲥⲟⲛ · ϫⲉⲁⲓϯϩⲓⲥⲉ ⲛⲁⲕ
Translation: peace shall be enveloping thee, and thou shalt make supplication to thy brother,

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲣⲓⲙⲉ · ⲁϣⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲉⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲣⲁϣⲉ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϩⲙⲡⲣⲓⲙⲉ ·
Translation: Thy weeping shall be abundant, but great joy shall be unto thee through (thy) tears.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉϯⲣⲏⲛⲏ ⲧⲉⲗⲏⲗ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲧⲛⲙⲏⲧⲉ · ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲉⲡⲛⲉⲩⲙⲁ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ϩⲱⲱϥ ⲣⲁϣⲉ ⲛϥⲱϣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ · ϫⲉⲛⲁⲓⲁⲧⲟⲩ ⲛⲛⲣⲉϥⲣⲉⲓⲣⲏⲛⲏ ϫⲉⲛⲧⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲉⲧⲟⲩⲛⲁⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲟⲩ ϫⲉⲛϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: And peace shall boast itself in your midst, and the Spirit of God Himself shall rejoice and shall cry out, saying, 'Blessed are the peacemakers, for it is they who shall be called the sons of God.'

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲉⲣϣⲁⲛⲡϫⲁϫⲉ ⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲧⲉⲥⲙⲏ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲱⲛⲏ · ϣⲁϥϫⲓϣⲓⲡⲉ ·
Translation: When the Enemy heareth the sound of the voice (of thy weeping) he becometh ashamed.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ϫⲓⲉⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲉⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲥⲙⲟⲩ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲛⲁⲕ
Translation: (Take care) that God is glorified, so that a great blessing may be unto thee.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ϭⲉ ⲡⲁⲥⲟⲛ ⲙⲁⲣⲛⲙⲓϣⲉ ⲉⲣⲟⲛ · ⲉⲕⲥⲟⲟⲩⲛ ϫⲉⲁⲡⲉϩⲗⲟⲥⲧⲛ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲙⲁ
Translation: Now therefore, O my brother, let us fight boldly. Thou knowest that contention existeth in every place.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲛⲉⲕⲕⲗⲏⲥⲓⲁ ⲙⲟⲩϩ ⲛⲣⲉϥϯⲧⲱⲛ ϩⲓⲣⲉϥϭⲱⲛⲧ ·
Translation: The churches are filled with men who love fighting and with men of wrath.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲛⲥⲟⲟⲩϩⲥ ⲛⲙⲙⲟⲛⲁⲭⲟⲥ ϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲙⲙⲁⲓⲣⲛⲟϭ · ⲁⲧⲙⲛⲧϫⲁⲥⲓϩⲏⲧ ⲣⲣⲣⲟ ·
Translation: The Congregations and the bodies of monks love to arrogate to themselves greatness, pride hath made itself to be king (or, to rule).

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲛⲡⲉⲧⲧⲁⲩⲟ ⲛⲟⲩⲙⲛⲧϫⲱⲱⲣⲉ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲉⲧϩⲓⲧⲟⲩⲱϥ · ⲁⲗⲗⲁ ⲡⲟⲩⲁ ⲡⲟⲩⲁ ϩⲟϫϩϫ ⲙⲡⲉⲧϩⲓⲧⲟⲩⲱϥ ·
Translation: No man sheweth bravery on behalf of his neighbour, but every man inflicteth persecution on his neighbour.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲛϩⲉ ⲉⲧⲙⲏⲏⲧⲉ ⲛⲛⲓϩⲓⲥⲉ ·
Translation: We have fallen into the midst of sufferings.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛϥϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲁⲛ ⲛϭⲓⲟⲩⲡⲣⲟⲫⲏⲧⲏⲥ ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲟⲩⲅⲛⲱⲥϯⲕⲟⲥ ·
Translation: There is neither prophet nor Gnostic.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲙⲛⲗⲁⲁⲩ ϫⲡⲓⲟ ⲛⲗⲁⲁⲩ · ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉⲁⲧⲙⲛⲧⲛⲁϣⲧϩⲏⲧ ⲁϣⲁⲓ ·
Translation: No man chideth another in respect of any matter, because hardness of heart hath increased.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲡⲉⲧⲛⲟⲉⲓ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲁⲕⲁⲣⲱϥ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉⲟⲩⲟⲉⲓϣ ⲙⲡⲟⲛⲩⲣⲟⲛ ⲡⲉ ·
Translation: He who hath understanding shall speak out, for the time is evil.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲡⲟⲩⲁ ⲡⲟⲩⲁ · ⲣⲣⲣⲟ ⲛⲁϥ ⲙⲁⲩⲁⲁϥ ϩⲉⲛⲕⲁⲧⲁⲫⲣⲟⲛⲓⲧⲏⲥ ⲛⲉ · ϩⲙⲡⲉⲧⲉⲙⲉϣϣⲉ
Translation: Every man maketh himself to be his own king, and they devote their minds to the contemplation of the things which are unseemly.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ϩⲓⲧⲛⲧⲉⲥⲡⲟⲩⲇⲏ ⲙⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧϥⲁⲓⲣⲟⲟⲩϣ ⲙⲡⲉⲛⲙⲁⲓⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲥⲟⲛ ⲭⲁⲏⲗ ⲡϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲙⲡⲙⲁⲕⲁⲣⲓⲟⲥ ⲥⲧⲉⲫⲁⲛⲟⲥ ⲡⲟⲩⲟⲓ ⲙⲙⲟⲩⲓ ⲉⲡⲣⲙⲧⲡⲉⲇⲓⲁⲥ ⲧⲁϩⲏⲧ ⲛⲧⲡⲟⲗⲓⲥ ⲥⲛⲏ
Translation: Through the diligence and the care of our God-loving brother, Xael, the son of the blessed Stephanos, the rush of lions on the man of the plains, belonging to the heart of the city, Esna.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁϥⲥⲙⲛⲡⲉⲓϫⲱⲱⲙⲉ ϩⲛⲛⲉϥϩⲓⲥⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ
Translation: He composed this book through his labor.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁϥⲇⲱⲣⲓⲍⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲉⲡⲙⲟⲛⲁⲥⲧⲏⲣⲓⲟⲛ ⲙⲡϩⲁⲅⲓⲟⲥ ⲙⲉⲣⲕⲟⲩⲣⲓⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲧⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲡⲟⲗⲓⲥ ⲧⲃⲱ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲟⲩϫⲁⲓ ⲛⲧⲉϥⲯⲩⲭⲏ ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲩⲱϣ ⲛϩⲏⲧϥ ⲉⲡⲣⲁⲛ ⲙⲡϩⲁⲅⲓⲟⲥ ⲓⲱϩⲁⲛⲛⲏⲥ ⲙⲛⲡⲡⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲁϩⲱⲙⲱ ϫⲉⲕⲁⲥ ⲉⲣⲉⲡϩⲁⲅⲓⲟⲥ ⲙⲉⲣⲕⲟⲩⲣⲓⲟⲥ ⲡⲉⲥⲧⲣⲁϯⲗⲁⲧⲏⲥ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲙⲁⲣⲧⲩⲣⲟⲥ ⲛϫⲱⲱⲣⲉ ⲙⲛⲡϩⲁⲅⲓⲟⲥ ⲓⲱⲥ ⲡⲃⲁⲡⲧⲓⲥⲧⲏⲥ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲉⲡⲣⲟⲇⲣⲟⲙⲟⲥ ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲙⲛⲡϩⲁⲅⲓⲟⲥ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲡⲁϩⲟⲙⲱ ⲡⲁⲣⲭⲏⲙⲁⲛⲧⲣⲓⲧⲏⲥ ⲛⲁⲡⲁⲣⲁⲕⲁⲗⲉⲓ ⲙⲡⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲱϥ
Translation: He presented it to the monastery of the Holy Macarius of the mountain of the city, Tbow, for the salvation of his soul in order for them to read in it the name of the Holy John, and the Holy Apa Pahmon so that the Holy Macarius, the soldier and courageous martyr and the Holy John the Baptist, the forerunner of Christ and the Holy Apa Pahmon, the Archimandrite will intercede to Christ for him.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲛϥⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ϩⲛⲡⲉⲓⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ ⲛϥⲧⲟⲩϫⲟϥ ⲉⲛϭⲟⲣϭⲥ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲙⲡⲇⲓⲁⲃⲟⲗⲟⲥ ⲙⲛⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛⲡⲟⲛⲏⲣⲟⲥ ⲛϥϯⲧⲟⲟⲧ ϩⲛϩⲱⲃ ⲛⲓⲙ ⲉⲡⲁⲅⲁⲑⲟⲛ ⲙⲛⲛⲥⲁⲧⲇⲓⲁⲑⲉⲥⲓⲥ ⲟⲩⲛ ⲙⲡⲉⲓⲃⲓⲟⲥ ⲉϥⲛⲁⲙⲡϣⲁ ⲙⲡⲕⲱ
Translation: and that he blesses him in this world and that he preserves him from every snare of the Devil and wicked men and he assists him in every good thing after the circumstance of this life so he will be worthy of the forgiveness of his sins and receive the inheritance of all the saints, as it shall come to pass. Amen.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲣⲓⲡⲁⲙⲉⲉⲩⲉ ϩⲱ ⲁⲛⲟⲕ ⲑⲉⲟⲡⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ ⲡⲓⲉⲓⲓⲁⲭ ⲛⲇⲓⲁⲕⲟⲛⲟⲥ ⲡϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲛⲥⲉⲩⲏⲣⲟⲥ ⲡⲁⲣⲭⲏⲡⲣⲉⲥⲃⲩⲧⲉⲣⲟⲥ ⲙⲡϩⲁⲅⲓⲟⲥ ⲙⲉⲣⲕⲟⲩⲣⲓⲟⲥ ⲛⲧⲡⲟⲗⲓⲥ ⲥⲛⲏ
Translation: Remember, for my part, Theopistis, of the deacon, the son of Severus, the archpriest of the Holy Macarius of the City Esna.

Book Name: Instructions of Apa Pachomius in MERC.AR in Budge ed. - part 2
Verse: ⲁⲓⲥϩⲁⲓ ⲡⲁⲓ ϫⲱⲱⲙⲉ ϩⲛⲧⲁϭⲓϫ · ϣⲗⲏⲗ ⲉϫⲱⲓ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲕⲱ ⲡⲉⲡⲗⲩⲑⲟⲥ ⲛⲛⲁⲛⲟⲃⲉ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ϫⲉⲥⲉⲟϣ ⲉⲙⲁⲧⲉ ⲉⲥⲉϣⲟⲡⲉ —
Translation: I wrote this work by my hand. Pray for me so that God forgives the multitude of my sins because they cry out exceedingly.

Verse: ⲧⲙⲁⲣⲧⲩⲣⲓⲁ ⲙⲡϩⲁⲅⲓⲟⲥ ⲃⲓⲕⲧⲱⲣ ⲡⲉⲥⲧⲣⲁⲧⲏⲗⲁⲧⲏⲥ ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲙⲁⲣⲧⲩⲣⲟⲥ ⲉⲧⲧⲁⲓⲏⲩ ⲙⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡϥⲁⲓⲕⲗⲟⲙ ⲛⲁⲙⲉ · ⲛⲧⲁϥϫⲱⲕ ϫⲉⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲁⲅⲱⲛ ⲉⲧⲧⲁⲓⲏⲩ · ⲛⲥⲟⲩϫⲟⲩⲧⲥⲁϣϥⲉ ⲙⲡⲉⲃⲟⲧ ⲫⲁⲣⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ·
Translation: [HERE BEGINNETH] THE MARTYRDOM OF SAINT BIKTÔR (VICTOR), THE GENERAL AND MARTYR, THE MAN GLORIOUS IN CHRIST, THE WEARER OF THE CROWN IN VERY TRUTH, WHO COMPLETED HIS GLORIOUS STRIFE ON THE SEVEN AND TWENTIETH DAY OF THE MONTH PHARMOUTE.

Verse: ϩⲛⲟⲩⲉⲓⲣⲏⲛⲏ ⲛⲧⲉⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲉⲣⲉⲛⲉϥⲥⲙⲟⲩ ⲉⲧⲟⲩⲁⲁⲃ ⲛⲁⲉⲓ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉϫⲱⲛ ⲛⲧⲛⲟⲩϫⲁⲓ ⲧⲏⲣⲛ ϩⲓⲟⲩⲥⲟⲡ ϩⲁⲙⲏⲛ : — —
Translation: IN THE PEACE OF GOD. MAY HIS HOLY BLESSING COME UPON US, AND MAY WE ALL BE SAVED TOGETHER. AMEN.

Verse: ⲁⲥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲇⲉ ϩⲛⲧⲙⲛⲧⲣⲣⲟ ⲛⲇⲓⲟⲕⲗⲏϯⲁⲛⲟⲥ ⲡⲣⲣⲟ ϩⲛⲧⲙⲉϩϣⲟⲙⲧⲉ ⲛⲣⲟⲙⲡⲉ ⲛⲧⲉϥⲙⲛⲧⲣⲣⲟ · ϩⲙⲡϣⲟⲣⲡ ⲛⲉⲃⲟⲧ · ⲡⲇⲓⲁⲃⲟⲗⲟⲥ ⲁϥⲥⲱⲣⲙ ⲙⲡⲉϥϩⲏⲧ ⲛⲥⲁⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲉⲧⲣⲉϥⲉⲓⲣⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲧⲉⲙⲉϣϣⲉ ·
Translation: And it came to pass in the kingdom (i. e. reign) of the Emperor Diocletian in the third year of his reign, in the first month, that the Devil led his heart astray from God, and made him to do the things that were not seemly.

Verse: ⲁϥϣⲙϣⲉ ⲛⲛⲉⲓⲇⲱⲗⲟⲛ · ⲁϥⲕⲱ ⲛⲥⲱϥ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲧⲡⲉ · ⲉⲧⲃⲉϩⲉⲛϣⲉ ⲙⲛϩⲉⲛⲱⲛⲉ · ⲙⲛϩⲉⲛⲙⲟⲩⲛⲅ ⲛϭⲓϫ ⲉⲩϣⲟⲩⲉⲓⲧ ⁛
Translation: And Diocletian worshipped idols, and thrust the God of heaven behind his back, for the sake of [creatures made of] wood and stones, and for the sake of the vain things that were fashioned by the hands of men.

Verse: ⲥⲱⲧⲙ ϭⲉ ⲧⲉⲛⲟⲩ ⲉⲧⲙⲛⲧϫⲱⲱⲣⲉ ⲛⲟⲩϣⲏⲣⲉ ϣⲏⲙ ϫⲉⲃⲓⲕⲧⲱⲣ ·
Translation: Hearken [ye] now to [the account of] the valour of the young man [called] Victor.

Verse: ⲇⲓⲟⲕⲗⲏϯⲁⲛⲟⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲡⲣⲣⲟ · ⲁϥⲥⲩⲙⲃⲟⲩⲗⲉⲩⲉ ⲉⲣⲛⲉⲧⲉⲙⲉϣϣⲉ ⲙⲡⲙⲧⲟ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲓⲏⲥⲟⲩⲥ ⲡⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥⲧⲟⲥ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲛⲁⲓ ⲛⲉ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲁⲁⲩ ·
Translation: And the Emperor Diocletian took counsel and decided to do the things that were unseemly before God, Jesus the Christ; and this is what he did.

Verse: ⲁϥⲧⲁⲙⲓⲟ ⲛⲥⲁϣϥⲉ ⲛⲧⲟⲩⲱⲧ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲃ · ⲁϥϯⲣⲁⲛ ⲉⲣⲟⲟⲩ ϫⲉⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛϩⲟⲓⲛⲉ ⲁⲛ ⲛⲉ ·
Translation: He made seventy images of gold, and gave unto them the name of gods which they certainly were not.

Verse: ⲁϥⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲙⲁⲁⲃⲧⲏ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛϩⲟⲟⲩⲧ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲙⲁⲁⲃⲧⲏ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲛⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ ·
Translation: To thirty-five of these he gave names of gods, and to thirty-five the names of goddesses;

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲡⲥⲉⲉⲡⲉ ⲛⲛⲉϥⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ
Translation: now the number of his other gods and goddesses amounted to one hundred and forty.

Verse: ϩⲧⲟⲟⲩⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲥⲟⲩⲟⲩⲁ ⲙⲡⲁⲣⲙⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲁⲇⲓⲟⲕⲗⲏϯⲁⲛⲟⲥ ⲡⲣⲣⲟ ⲙⲛⲡⲉϥⲥⲧⲣⲁⲧⲉⲩⲙⲁ ⲧⲏⲣϥ · ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲡⲁⲣⲭⲟⲥ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲥⲧⲣⲁⲧⲏⲗⲁⲧⲏⲥ · ⲁⲩⲃⲱⲕ ⲉⲡⲣⲡⲉ : —
Translation: And it came to pass at dawn, on the first day of the month Parmoute, that the Emperor Diocletian, and all his army, and the eparchs, and the generals went into the temple.

Verse: ⲡⲣⲣⲟ ⲇⲉ ⲁϥϩⲙⲟⲟⲥ ⲉϫⲙⲡⲉⲑⲣⲟⲛⲟⲥ · ⲁϥⲧⲣⲉⲡⲓⲕⲩⲣⲓⲝ ⲱϣ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ·
Translation: And the Emperor took his seat upon the throne, and he caused the herald to make a proclamation, saying,

Verse: ϫⲉⲁⲙⲏⲓⲧⲛ ⲁⲣⲓⲑⲩⲥⲓⲁⲍⲉ ⲱ ⲛⲣⲱⲙⲉ ⲛϩⲣⲱⲙⲁⲓⲟⲥ ·
Translation: O [all] ye Roman people, come ye and offer up sacrifice.'

Verse: ⲁⲡⲣⲣⲟ ⲧⲁⲙⲓⲉⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲃⲟⲙⲱⲥ ⲛϩⲁⲧ ⲙⲛⲟⲩϣⲟⲩⲣⲏ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲃ :
Translation: And the Emperor made an altar of silver and a vessel wherein to burn incense of gold ;

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲁϥⲧⲁⲙⲓⲉⲟⲩⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲥⲧⲩⲗⲗⲟⲥ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲃ ·
Translation: and he made a great pedestal of gold,

Verse: ⲁϥⲕⲁⲁϥ ⲙⲡⲙⲧⲟ ⲉⲃⲟⲗ ⲛⲧϣⲏⲩⲉ ϫⲉⲕⲁⲥ ⲉⲩⲉⲧⲁⲗⲉⲡⲁⲡⲟⲗⲗⲱⲛ ⲉϫⲱϥ ·
Translation: and he placed it before the altar so that the [statue of] Apollo might be set upon it.

Verse: ⲁϥⲕⲉⲗⲉⲩⲉ ⲛϭⲓⲡⲣⲣⲟ · ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲩⲛⲗⲓⲃⲁⲛⲟⲥ ϩⲓⲥⲁⲙⲓⲧ · ϩⲓⲛⲉϩ ⲙⲙⲉ · ϩⲓⲕⲟⲛϯⲧⲟⲛ · ⲉⲥⲉⲡⲱϩⲧ ⲉϫⲛⲧϣⲏⲩⲉ ⲉⲧⲙⲟⲩϩ ·
Translation: And the Emperor commanded them to bring frankincense, and the finest flour of wheat, and the purest oil, and rare old wine, and to pour them out upon the altar whereon was blazing fire.

Verse: ⲙⲛⲛⲥⲱⲥ ⲁϥϫⲉⲣⲟ ⲛϣⲏⲧ ⲛⲕⲉⲣⲱⲛ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲃ · ⲙⲛϥⲧⲟⲟⲩϣⲉ ⲛⲕⲉⲣⲱⲛ ⲛϩⲁⲧ · ⲙⲛϣⲏⲧ ⲛϩⲧⲟ ⲉⲩⲟⲩⲟⲃϣ · ⲁⲩⲥⲱⲕ ϩⲏⲧⲟⲩ ⲛⲛⲉϥⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ϣⲁⲡⲣⲡⲉ ·
Translation: And afterwards they lighted two hundred candles on golden candlesticks, and four hundred candles on silver candlesticks, and two hundred white horses drew his gods into the temple.

Verse: ⲡⲣⲣⲟ ⲇⲉ ⲇⲓⲟⲕⲗⲏϯⲁⲛⲟⲥ · ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲟⲩⲉⲓⲛⲉ ⲉϩⲟⲩⲛ ⲛⲛⲉϥⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉⲡⲣⲡⲉ · ⲁϥⲟⲛⲕϥ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ϩⲓⲡⲉϥⲑⲣⲟⲛⲟⲥ ·
Translation: 'And when they had brought his gods into the temple the Emperor Diocletian stood up on his throne,

Verse: ⲁϥϥⲓ ⲙⲡⲉϥⲕⲗⲟⲙ ϩⲓϫⲱϥ · ⲁϥⲧⲁⲁϥ ⲉϫⲛⲧⲁⲡⲉ ⲙⲡⲁⲡⲟⲗⲗⲱⲛ · ⲁϥⲟⲩⲱϣⲧ ⲛⲁϥ ⲛϣⲟⲙⲛⲧ ⲛⲥⲟⲡ ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ ·
Translation: and he lifted his crown off his head, and set it upon the head of [the statue of] Apollo, and he bowed down and worshipped it three times, saying,

Verse: ϫⲉⲛⲧⲕⲟⲩⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ ⲉϥⲟⲛϩ ⲱ ⲡⲁⲡⲟⲗⲗⲱⲛ ⲡⲛⲟϭ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲡⲁⲓ ⲉⲧϯ ⲛⲁⲛ ⲙⲡⲉϫⲣⲟ ϩⲙⲡⲡⲟⲗⲉⲙⲟⲥ ·
Translation: Thou art the god who livest, O Apollo, the greatest of the gods, who dost give unto us victory in war.

Verse: ⲡⲣⲣⲟ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉϥⲟⲩⲱϣⲧ · ⲁⲡⲉϥⲕⲉϣⲟⲙⲛⲧ ⲛϣⲃⲏⲣ ⲉⲓ ⲉⲧⲣⲉⲩⲟⲩⲱϣⲧ · ϩⲣⲱⲙⲁⲛⲟⲥ · ⲙⲛⲃⲁⲥⲓⲗⲉⲓⲧⲏⲥ · ⲙⲛⲉⲩϩⲁⲓⲟⲥ ·
Translation: And after the Emperor had worshipped Apollo, his three fellow [Caesars], Romanus, Basileides, and Euaios, came and worshipped Apollo also.

Verse: ⲛⲁⲓ ⲉϩⲉⲛ
Translation: Now these | held equal rank and power with the Fol. 2 « Emperor, and he loved them exceedingly.

Verse: ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡⲟⲣⲇⲓⲛⲟⲛ
Translation: And it came to pass that when the turn of the Protector had come to offer up sacrifice, now his name was Basileides

Verse: ⲁⲥϣⲱⲡⲉ ⲇⲉ ⲛⲧⲉⲣⲟⲩⲑⲩⲥⲓⲁⲍⲉ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ · ⲁⲡⲟⲣⲇⲓⲛⲟⲛ ⲙⲡⲉϥϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲧⲁϩⲟϥ ⲉⲧⲣⲉϥⲑⲩⲥⲓⲁⲍⲉ ·
Translation: And it came to pass that when all the people had offered up sacrifice it came to the turn of his son to offer up sacrifice.

Verse: ⲟⲩϣⲏⲣⲉ ⲡⲉ ⲉϥϩⲛⲙⲛⲧⲯⲓⲧⲉ ⲛⲣⲟⲙⲡⲉ · ⲉϥϣⲙϣⲉ ⲙⲡⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥⲣϩⲟⲧⲉ ϩⲏⲧⲟⲩ ⲛⲛⲉϥⲉⲛⲧⲟⲗⲏ ·
Translation: Now he was a young man of nineteen years of age, and he worshipped God, and held His commandments in fear.

Verse: ⲉϥⲟ ⲙⲡⲁⲣⲑⲉⲛⲟⲥ ϩⲙⲡⲉϥⲥⲱⲙⲁ · ⲉϥⲟⲩⲱⲙ ⲛⲟⲩⲥⲟⲡ ⲕⲁⲧⲁⲥⲁⲃⲃⲁⲧⲟⲛ · ⲉϥϣⲗⲏⲗ ϩⲛⲛⲉⲩϣⲟⲟⲩⲉ ·
Translation: He was a virgin in body, he ate once only each week, he prayed all night long,

Verse: ϫⲓⲛⲡⲉϩⲟⲟⲩ ⲛⲧⲁϥⲥⲱⲧⲙ ⲉⲛⲉⲭⲣⲓⲥϯⲁⲛⲟⲥ ⲉⲩⲱϣ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ϩⲛⲧⲉⲕⲕⲗⲏⲥⲓⲁ · ⲁⲡⲉϥϩⲏⲧ ⲃⲱⲕ ⲉϩⲣⲁⲓ ⲉⲙⲡⲏⲩⲉ ·
Translation: and from the day wherein he had heard the Christians crying out to him in the church his heart had departed into heaven.

Verse: ⲁϥⲙⲉⲥⲧⲉ ⲡⲕⲟⲥⲙⲟⲥ · ⲛⲉⲙⲉϥⲥⲉⲏⲣⲡ ⲇⲉ · ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲉϥⲟⲩⲉⲙϭⲓⲛⲟⲩⲱⲙ ⲉϥϩⲏⲙ ·
Translation: He hated the world. He did not drink wine, neither did he eat food cooked with fire.

Verse: ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲧⲟⲃⲧⲃ ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲉϥϣⲟⲩϣⲟⲩ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ϩⲛⲟⲩϩⲃⲥⲱ ⲛϩⲟⲉⲓⲧⲉ ⲉⲛⲉϩ ·
Translation: He did not decorate his person, and he did not adorn himself with rich apparel and fine raiment.

Verse: ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲉϥⲁⲗⲉ ⲉϩⲧⲟⲟⲩ ⲇⲉ ϩⲁⲣⲙⲁ ·
Translation: He did not mount the horse which was used in a chariot (i. e. a war-horse).

Verse: ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲉϥⲟⲩⲱⲙ ⲙⲛⲡⲉϥⲉⲓⲱⲧ · ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲉϥϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ · ϩⲓⲧϩⲏ ⲛⲛⲟϭ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ·
Translation: He neither ate food with his father nor did he enter into converse with him in the presence of any one who was greater than himself.

Verse: ⲏ ⲛϥϫⲱ ⲛⲟⲩϣⲁϫⲉ ⲛϣⲗⲟϥ ·
Translation: He never gave utterance to an obscene (or, scurrilous) word,

Verse: ⲟⲩⲇⲉ ⲙⲉϥⲱⲣⲕ ⲗⲁⲁⲩ ⲛⲁⲛⲁϣ ⲉⲡⲧⲏⲣϥ ·
Translation: and never, under any circumstances, did he swear an oath by anything or by anybody.

Verse: ⲁⲩⲱ ⲉϥϣⲁⲛⲥⲱⲧⲙ
Translation: And whenever he heard concerning any one who was in distress, if that person w^ere a Christian, ^ he used to minister unto him,

Verse: ⲡⲉϥⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲇⲉ ⲁϥϩⲓⲥⲉ ⲛⲙⲙⲁϥ · ϫⲉⲉⲓⲛⲁϫⲓ ⲛⲁⲕ ⲛⲧϣⲉⲉⲣⲉ ⲛⲃⲁⲥⲓⲗⲉⲓⲧⲏⲥ ⲡⲉⲥⲧⲣⲁⲧⲏⲗⲁⲧⲏⲥ ·
Translation: And his father wearied him exceedingly, saying, 'I shall take the daughter of Basileides the general for thee to wife,'

Verse: ⲛⲉⲁⲩⲥⲙⲛⲧⲥ ⲅⲁⲣ ⲙⲛⲛⲉⲩⲉⲣⲏⲩ · ⲉϣⲏⲧ ⲛⲕⲉⲛⲧⲏⲛⲁⲣⲓⲟⲛ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲃ · ⲭⲱⲣⲓⲥ ⲛⲧⲁⲉⲓⲟ · ⲁⲩⲱ ϥⲧⲟⲟⲩϣⲉ ⲛⲕⲉⲛⲧⲏⲛⲁⲣⲓⲟⲛ ⲛϩⲁⲧ ·
Translation: for his father and Basileides had made an agreement in respect of her for two hundred centenarii of gold, besides gifts, and four hundred centenarii of silver,

Verse: ⲙⲛⲙⲏⲧ ⲛϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ⲛϩⲟⲟⲩⲧ · ⲙⲛⲙⲏⲧ ⲛϣⲉ ⲛϩⲙϩⲁⲗ ⲛⲥϩⲓⲙⲉ · ⲉⲩϫⲓ ⲙⲁⲛⲓⲁⲕⲏⲥ ⲛⲛⲟⲩⲃ · ⲙⲛϥⲧⲟⲟⲩ ⲛϣⲉ ⲛϩⲧⲟ · ⲁⲩⲱ ⲙⲏⲧ ⲛϣⲉ ⲙⲙⲁⲥⲡⲟⲣⲕ · ⲙⲛⲙⲏⲧ ⲛϣⲉ ⲛϭⲁⲙⲟⲩⲗ · ⲙⲛⲙⲏⲧ ⲛϣⲉ ⲛⲥⲧⲉⲓⲱϩⲉ ⲛϭⲱⲙ ·
Translation: and ten menservants, and ten hundred maidservants wearing golden bracelets, and four hundred horses, and ten hundred mules, and ten hundred camels, and ten hundred farms which were under tillage,

Verse: ⲙⲛⲙⲏⲧ ⲛϣⲉ ⲛϭⲓⲛⲟⲩⲃⲁⲗ ⲉⲩⲡⲗⲉⲁ ϩⲛⲧⲑⲁⲗⲁⲥⲥⲁ · ⲙⲛⲙⲏⲧ ⲛⲏⲓ ⲉⲣⲉⲙⲏⲧ ⲛⲥⲧⲉⲓⲱϩⲉ ⲉⲛⲟⲩⲁ ⲛϩⲏⲧⲟⲩ ·
Translation: and ten hundred ships which sailed the sea, and ten houses (palaces ?) to [each] one of which were attached ten farms under tillage,

Verse: ⲭⲱⲣⲓⲥ ⲛⲉⲧⲉⲣⲉⲡⲉϥⲉⲓⲱⲧ ⲛⲁⲧⲁⲁⲩ ⲛⲁϥ · ϩⲉⲛⲛⲟϭ ⲛϩⲩⲡⲉⲣⲉⲥⲓⲁ ⲛⲉⲩϣⲟⲟⲡ ⲛⲁϥ ϩⲓϫⲙⲡⲕⲁϩ ·
Translation: besides the things which his father was to give to him, and a very large number of men who were to do the work on [his] land.

Verse: ⲡⲙⲁⲕⲁⲣⲓⲟⲥ ⲇⲉ ⲁⲡⲁ ⲃⲓⲕⲧⲱⲣ · ⲙⲡⲉϥⲡⲉⲓⲑⲉ ⲛⲁⲩ · ⲉϥϫⲱ ⲙⲙⲟⲥ
Translation: And the blessed Apa Victor would not be persuaded by his father and Basileides, and he said unto them,

Verse: ϫⲉⲛⲁⲓ ⲧⲏⲣⲟⲩ ⲥⲉⲛⲁⲧⲁⲕⲟ : —
Translation: ' All these things shall perish ' ;

Verse: ⲉϥϩⲁⲣⲉϩ ⲛⲁϥ ⲉⲧⲙⲛⲧⲣⲣⲟ ⲛⲙⲡⲏⲩⲉ ·
Translation: and he kept himself for the kingdom that is in the heavens.

Verse: ⲛⲉϣⲁⲣⲉⲡϫⲟⲉⲓⲥ ⲓⲏⲥⲟⲩⲥ ⲟⲩⲱⲛϩ ⲉⲣⲟϥ ⲛϩⲟ ϩⲓϩⲟ · ⲉϥⲙⲉ ⲙⲙⲟϥ ⲉⲧⲃⲉⲡⲉϥⲧⲃⲃⲟ ·
Translation: And the Lord Jesus was wont to appear to him, face to face, and He loved him because of his purity.
